title: Financial Reporting Analyst
full description:
Would you like to become part of the most international company in the world? Would you like to work for a company where people mean the world to us? Our goal has always been to attract and retain the best talent the world over. We provide challenge and opportunity for personal and professional development. We recognise the difference that You bring to our business and together we share the pride of being part of the company that has been leading the way in international express shipment since 1969.
Financial Analyst (Permanent)
We are pleased to announce that an exciting opportunity exists for Financial Analyst within DHL Express Ireland. This is a permanent role which is based in the Swords, Dublin office. The salary range is €40,000 - €45,000 plus benefits including bonus, contribution to health insurance and company pension, free onsite parking and a mix of hybrid working from the office and at home.
Job Purpose
The role of Financial Analyst is to ensure high quality/ cost effective managerial reporting in accordance with accounting principles and all relevant corporate policies.
The main duties of the role will be:
Timely and accurately processing of Monthly financial closing
To create and maintain first class financial reporting in adherence to group policies
Monitoring and analysis of results and key figures at terminal and product level with Budget and year-on-year comparison
Manage and monitor the ongoing and future financial performance of the business to ensure management can optimise decision making.
Balance Sheet review coordination
Preparation of Budgets, Forecasts and Monthly Forecasts
Ensure adherence to DPDHL accounting standards, business compliance, policies and procedures are adopted and complied with by all departments
Internal and external audits
Internal controls & ensure monthly reporting of internal controls to region.
Build solid relationships with both external and internal customers to foster collaboration, networking & best practice.
Manage multiple stakeholders - Internal - Shared Service Centres, External – PWC
Assist with AP queries, Concur & GET
Adopt and deliver the Finance strategy
Projects
Ad hoc analysis
What you bring?
2 years’ experience in Financial Reporting Essential
Recognized Accountancy Qualification - Diploma, Degree, Accounting Technician
Influence business decision by demonstrating a detailed understanding of the business
Excellent communication skills at all levels across the business and with external stakeholders
Excel advanced essential
Commercial & financial experience
Financial Auditing
SAP knowledge is an advantage
Team player, communicative person with can do attitude, time flexibility.

title: Analytic & Insights Analyst
full description:
The role: Analytic & Insights Analyst
We are looking for a Lead Analytic & Insights Analyst to come be part of our ever growing & dynamic Marketing Effectiveness team in our Dublin office.
Are you our next star player?
This role reports into the Department Head of Marketing Effectiveness, serving as a senior member of the team who will relish ownership opportunities to work closely with the operational marketing teams to deliver insight and deliver the ‘why’ analysis.
Why we need you:
Your role will include:
Work with the Head of Department and team lead to deliver reporting & marketing efficiency measurement to the business
Application of data to areas such as A/B testing and return on investment analysis
Extracting and analysing very large and multi-dimensional data sets
Supporting the marketing evaluation team with access to and provision of data and analysis
Supporting the modelling team with data & insights as required, including data auditing, sense checking model outputs, providing business context, developing new analysis and visualisations to support the modelling efforts
Work with agency partners & internal partners to ensure that company standard is followed with regards request for & delivery of data and reporting on media asset delivery to enable analysis
Who we’re looking for:
Ideally have a Degree qualification in a quantitative (STEM) field with experience with SQL/Oracle, Excel, PPT and PowerBI (or equivalent data viz tool) It's an advantage to have exposure with data analysis application e.g. R, python, SAS, etc. a bonus. Knowledge of the online Poker / Casino / Sportsbook industries would be an asset.
Your experience:
Previous marketing analytics experiences are an advantage and working with media agencies
Will need technical & data literacy within a commercial environment
Have a love for BOTH data analytics and data science
Have an outstanding desire to build value from data and information
Ability to measure marketing and understand what drives business performance. Experience working with linear through to digital channels
Have experience of delivering MMM programs and marketing effectiveness measurement. Data modelling is an advantage.
Your behaviours:
Resilience: Resilient and confident under pressure, comfortable in dealing with ambiguity and running multiple simultaneous projects
Quality obsessed: gets it right first time and has an outstanding attention to detail
Partner management and influencing skills: comfortable operating at pace to a high standard, despite requiring the involvement of multiple partners across multiple countries to deliver results. Actively builds a network of effective relationships across Flutter. Can get things done both through formal channels and informal networks
Fast learner: Learns quickly when facing new situations. Experiments to find and craft new solutions. Pursue the challenge of unfamiliar tasks and extracts lessons learned from failures or mistakes
Comfortable both in detail and in stepping back to consider long term strategy
What’s in it for you?
Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus. And we provide advice and dedicated assistance to those moving to Dublin.
Your package will include:
health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address)
a personal interest allowance to let you learn something new or pursue a hobby
the option to join our company pension scheme
looking to extend your family? You will receive a cash gift of 1,000 EUR for your new addition whilst working for us
in-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career
free fresh fruit, snacks and drinks in the office
access to an onsite gym.
What happens next?
We will aim to get back to you as soon as possible. If you meet the criteria, we’ll contact you to arrange a Zoom interview.
The Group
PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange, which brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.
We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.
We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact: talent@starsgroup.com.
Please note we cannot accept general applications; this inbox is just for providing support to those who need it.

title: Graduate Systems Analyst (Data Privacy) – 12 Month Fixed Term Contract
full description:
Aptiv Privacy Office are seeking a Graduate Systems Analyst to join their growing team on a 12 month fixed term contract to support Functional Development and Lifecycle Management in their Privacy Risk Management system (OneTrust).
Under the guidance of the Director of Global Data Privacy, you will ensure continued technical development to support change in Data Privacy processes. You will be provided with an excellent opportunity to develop Subject Matter Expertise in OneTrust, and skills and knowledge in Privacy Risk Management tooling and operations.
Your Role
Engage with the Privacy Office team to build a Development program, based upon business requirements and priorities.
Investigate OneTrust functionality, liaise with OneTrust Support and Training, and recommend solutions to satisfy business requirements, balancing customisations with OooB Product Development and Enhancements.
Facilitate support Process Design workshops with key stakeholders.
Manage and implement change to schedule, to include:
Design/build/test/go-live of development/configuration according to business requirements.
User Access Security Configuration and Management.
Manage OneTrust Reporting suite, requests, development and distribution.
Manage OneTrust Communications Management functionality and configuration.
Undertake data analysis, data mapping, batch uploads and data cleansing, data quality monitoring and improvement.
Trouble-shoot queries and issues and liaise with users/Privacy Office/OneTrust to resolve as appropriate.
Engage with internal and external stakeholders as requested, in support of Privacy Office team.
Your Background
Recent graduate within the field of Information Technology and Systems or Data Management and Analytics.
Experience and/or training in IT Systems and Data Management.
Critical and creative problem-solving, supported by team meetings and workshops, delivering actions and solutions.
Strong communications in English, both written and verbal; engaging with the Privacy Office team, and other internal teams and external teams.
Aptiv Rewards & Advantages
Competitive compensation package including; Healthcare, Pension & TaxSaver schemes.
Learning, professional growth and development in a world recognized international environment.
Access to internal & external training, coaching & certifications.
Recognition for innovation and excellence.
Opportunities to give back to the community.
Meaningful work that makes a difference in the world
Some see differences. We see perspectives that make us stronger.
Diversity and Inclusion are sources of innovation and creativity, both of which are essential to Aptiv’s success. Everyday our diverse team comes together, drives innovation, pursues solutions, and meets challenges using their unique abilities, perspectives and talents, changing what tomorrow brings. When you join our team, you’ll get encouraged to think boldly, express your viewpoint and innovate as a matter of habit.
Some See Technology. We See a Way to Make Connections.
At Aptiv, we don’t just see the world differently; we work to change reality. That means developing technology that rewrites the rules of what’s possible in the pursuit of making transportation safer, greener and more connected. Today there are more than 180,000 of us globally, located in 44 countries, and united by one mission. Join the movement and together, let’s change tomorrow.
Privacy Notice - Active Candidates: https://www.aptiv.com/privacy-notice-active-candidates
Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Data/Business Analyst
full description:
Bachelor’s Degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science or related field
Industry experience as a Business/Data Analyst or related specialty (e.g. Software Engineer, Data Engineer) with extensive professional experience and a proven track record in a role focused on understanding, manipulating, processing and extracting value from large datasets.
Proven experience in relational database concepts with an expert knowledge of SQL.
Demonstrated analytical skills with passions on working with structural data sets

Amazon strives to be the world’s most customer-centric company, where customers can research and purchase anything they might want online. We set big goals and are looking for people who can help us reach and exceed them. Amazon Payments allows millions of Amazon customers to pay for purchases on Amazon and on third party sites. We are looking for a Business Analyst (BA) to support the Amazon Risk and Compliance Services (RCS) team, where we create strong programs to help keep our transaction services safe. The BA will retrieve and analyze large amounts of data based on legal government requests, or internal customers' requests.

The ideal candidate must be passionate about data-driven decision making, uncompromisingly detail oriented, smart, efficient, and driven to help the RCS organization achieve its goals. They will be an individual contributor who is comfortable with ambiguity and able to successfully drive business intelligence projects to completion. This role is on a team with Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Business Analysts and works closely with the Financial Crimes Compliance teams, investigative specialists, and Product teams to drive highly effective machine learning and monitoring solutions in the compliance space.

But that’s not all – you should also have very strong business and communication skills and be able to work closely with global stakeholders to define key business questions and build data sets that answer them.

Our BAs are expected to have a detailed understanding of our business and never lose sight of the broader problems that we are trying to solve. We need actionable insights, along with reports. We want someone who can distill knowledge from data that will help us decide what to build and how it should work. Above all, you should be passionate about using data – lots and lots of data – to solve problems and improve the way we serve our customers. You should be curious about what’s happening in the industry and hungry to learn more, and you should leverage that interest to provide guidance and support for other engineers based on marketplace best practices.


Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project
Experience in communicating with users, other software teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software/data product features, and technical designs.
Experience influencing software engineering best practices within your team
Background in BigData, Machine Learning and Data Mining is a plus
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age

title: Order Management Analyst (Japanese Speaking)
full description:
Our Company


Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.


We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
Order Management serves as a core business partner within the finance organisation focused on the analysis of data from several sources and the development of scalable solutions to ensure accurate booking and reporting of revenue. We provide world-class support to our customers through collaboration across the organization. Our team promotes a dynamic culture, fostering personal growth and career development.
What you’ll do
Understand multiple go-to market models supporting Digital Marketing solution offerings – on-demand subscription, licensing (perpetual and term), maintenance and support, managed services and professional services.
Utilize multiple complex systems and processes to lead enterprise deal pipeline, contracts, provisioning and record revenue – SalesForce, SAP (ECC, Convergent Charging/Mediation, Consolidated invoicing).
Interpret and validate an enterprise “deal” (using contracts, purchase order and approval documentation) to ensure accurate recording of revenue (booking, provisioning, invoicing).
Book and record revenue from fully executed contracts/deals using manual and semi-automated processes into the systems mentioned above.
Actively review sales pipeline and corresponding deal information to anticipate potential booking issues or negative customer experience impact, and work to resolve during the deal negotiation process.
Conduct weekly reconciliations and other oversight activity to ensure accurate revenue booking/recording using SQL, Excel and Tableau reports.
Engage with various business partners by resolving issues raised by customers related to the Order Management process.
Partner with the department’s cross-geo/organizational teams focused on data management, innovation, integration (acquisitions), and enablement, to find opportunities to drive efficiencies through streamlining processes and system improvements.
Work cross-functionally with multiple internal Adobe Departments (Deal Desk, Revenue Assurance, Credit, Legal, Customer Success Management, Sales, Product Delivery (Provisioning), Professional Services, Tax, Sales Finance etc.), Enterprise Customers, and Partners.
Support increased workload and additional hours when required i.e month/quarter end.
What's needed to succeed
Fluent business Englishd business Japanese (written and spoken)
You are meticulous, committed, adaptable, inquisitive, creative, respectful, collaborative and confident.
Excellent numeracy skills, including intermediate or better familiarity with Microsoft Excel.
Competence with information management tools - SAP (ECC, CC), salesforce, Sharepoint, or similar analytical and information management applications.
Demonstrable ‘critical thinking’: i.e. ability to analyze complex deal issues, make decisions and problem solve self-sufficiently, without requiring ongoing direction setting.
Excellent interpersonal and customer oriented communication skills.
Experience in a role demonstrating excellent time management, able to analyze workload and prioritize time based on changing priorities.
Highly desirable skills:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a numerate or business field
Minimum 2 years Order Management (or similar) experience in this sector
Knowledge of revenue recognition rules/requirements related to software/services
Familiarity with Sequel, Alteryx and/or SalesForce reporting.
A proven ability to build strong, trust based relationships with business partners across the organization
Good knowledge of operational quote to cash business processes
Exposure to contract negotiation/drafting, including Legal and Financial Governance

title: Sales Operations Analyst
full description:
Sales Operations Analyst

Based in Dublin, our client is renowned for their continuing advancements in online technologies that have changed the world. An ambitious, fast paced forward thinking company with very creative culture.

Our client is currently conducting all interviews online and are onboarding all new workers remotely.

They require a Sales Operations Analyst with 4+ years of experience in data analysis. Joining on an 11-month contract, the successful candidate will support revenue reporting and insights for sales leadership as well as operational and strategic programs in the region.

Job Reference: BBBH 19414

What will a Sales Operations Analyst do?
Contribute to preparation of regular Rhythm of Business activities including revenue reporting and qualitative insights/analysis to provide context around KPIs and revenue metrics for senior sales and leadership team
Routinely provide ad hoc revenue analysis (revenue performance, product adoption, market trends, etc.) that will be used to support leadership business decisions and make clear recommendations based on analysis to senior leadership team to drive discussions with sales on areas for investment or improvement.
Support ad hoc data requests and identify opportunities for reporting, analytical or operational efficiencies across the region
Contribute to forecasting initiatives to accurately forecast our business at an EMEA level, using multiple data sources to accurately predict future sales performance
Work with large data sets & complex infrastructure
Work within the wider Business Planning & Operations team to support global or regional operational and strategic projects

What does the Ideal Candidate look like?
5+ years of experience in business analysis
Experience in sales/business operations or consulting
Analytics and data skillset is a must have
Proficiency in Tableau and familiarity with big data
Experience in SQL would be a bonus

Benefits?

Competitive Salary.
Work Laptop, phone (most roles) and latest tools and technologies.
25 days annual leave (pro-rata) plus paid bank holidays.
Expanding workforce with options for permanent positions and career progress ion for top performers.
The experience of working with a company that will make your CV stand out from the crowd.

title: Data Analyst
full description:
The primary purpose of this position is to research, analyze, interpret, transform and present reference data for fixed income securities as well as reference data pertaining to those issuers themselves that bring fixed income debt to market. The focus of this position is to perform this work with documents in English.

The incumbent must successfully complete a three month training program that centers on building enough subject matter expertise and the utilization of the database(s) of record such that the incumbent can independently analyze legal and financial documents associated with securities containing less complex fixed income structures. During training, the incumbent must master all of the subject matter and will be required to pass a series of quizzes and tests as well achieve the accuracy and timeliness metrics that were established for trainees.
The training curriculum for the Data Analyst contains high level overviews of the complex structures worked on by more senior personnel as well as reference data client use cases so that the incumbent can differentiate between legal and financial language that is relevant to and required by our client base versus jargon describing information that is not required and, so that the incumbent can identify new financing techniques that come to market. The incumbent must then apply this foundation of knowledge via a logical sequence of decision making events to determine relevancy of said information to our clients for any of their use cases and if deemed relevant, determine the appropriate next steps to ensure high client satisfaction levels.
The fixed income market consists of over two million active securities and the reference data provided by ICE Data Services for said securities is used by our clients to make trading decisions, settle trades, make investment decisions, manage portfolios, analyze risk, create security master files, create client statements and conduct other back office functions. Our reference data is also used by internal stakeholders such as the Evaluated Pricing, Index and Analytics groups said reference data plays an integral role in determining evaluated prices, determining whether or not a security should be added to or deleted from an index or indices, the weighted average of a security within an index and, performing a series of analytical calculations that are used both internally within ICE and externally by these stakeholder’s clientele.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Analyze, interpret, collate and transform reference data provided in a variety legal and financial documents, third party reports and vendor information while ensuring that the reference data provided in ICE’s products and services accurate, comprehensive and in a timely manner, namely best in class
Make sound, subjective decisions when interpreting legal and financial information by utilizing subject matter expertise to infer, deduce and ultimately draw the right conclusions
Provide customer support for users of ICE products by resolving inquiries in a timely manner
Craft external facing responses for those clients that submitted customer inquiries containing a meaningful, well-thought out, well-constructed answer that includes a restatement of the challenge or question, the analysis completed to satisfy the request and where appropriate, the methodology used to determine the solution
Procure required documents and/or trusted content utilizing creative internet searches and by conducting direct outreach to issuers, underwriters, fiduciary agents and bond counsel
Apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative work-flow efficiencies and process improvements resulting in increased accuracy levels, time to market and productivity
Help identify trends and causation of inaccurate and/or incomplete data
Participate in ad hoc projects to optimize processes and/or improve the quality of the data set.
Create charts, graphs and presentations for leadership teams
Use excel functions to organize, analyze and create reference data

PERSON SPECIFICATION

Business Level English
BA/BS in Finance, Economics or equivalent practical experience
Demonstrated, relevant work experience directly working in fixed income reference data operations or customer service
Ability to work in a fast paced, high pressured, fluid environment
Ability to distill large amounts of information into specific takeaways
Excellent attention to detail and high degree of demonstrated decision-making and problem solving skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills with proven ability to craft client-ready correspondences
Eagerness to learn and collaborate with others
Strong excel skills required

title: Business Analyst
full description:
The Opportunity

We are going through a period of rapid growth and the finance team is recruiting and expanding their team to meet these demands and scale for future growth. As part of a large-scale transformation programme, we are looking for an experienced and highly motivated person to join eShopWorld as a Business Analyst.

The successful candidate will have a high understanding of Excel and VBA, with a vision to automate and structure large amounts of data through Excel, VBA, RPA or other technologies. The candidate will be responsible for structuring current reporting models to enhance, automate and create inter-relational data structures between tasks and departments. This position requires a close working relationship with key stakeholders to understand their specific data requirements and developing the necessary documentation to support the team across the development and support after implementation.

Key Responsibilities:

Transformation activities:

Ability to analyse and document in relevant detail business processes and user requirements.
Design reporting models and processes in Excel, and define required automations
Structure data flows and inter-relationships between processes and departments
Produce both process and data flow maps as required identifying timings, functional responsibilities etc.
Effectively translate stakeholders' problems or demands into solutions. Map and document the desired outcomes to show the `To be' processes against the processes which can be supported by a technical solution or package
Continually critically analyse development requirements in terms of solution design, dependency, and value / outcome
Effectively engage with stakeholders to ensure clarity of expectation and outcome to reduce iteration cycles or misinterpretation
Define resource allocation and priority of activities in collaboration with stakeholders
Assist stakeholders in reviewing functionality outcomes to ensure in line with original scoping and assisting where outcome is not in line with expectation (successful UAT of data related solutions)
Ensure full alignment between various internal and external teams to confirm and gain agreement to the desired outcomes
Ability to facilitate information gathering sessions to capture key Business Requirements
Ability to self-manage the business analysis activity through to completion

Technology based activities:

Identify best technology to use for each solution implementation
Identify improvements and enhancements by applying different technologies
Define required formulas or VBA solutions to simplify and automate data models
Define implementation process using RPA and/or Alteryx
Lead User Acceptance Testing as part of our go-live preparation
Maintain a high level of knowledge about all products, systems and procedures that relate to each of the implementations
Foster and lead a continuous improvement culture. Identify process improvements and process re-engineering, to help to improve business practices
Participate in architectural process reviews as part of project and strategic initiatives
Data Management Governance
Manage Ad hoc projects and tasks as assigned from time to time
Prioritize, schedule and complete development and testing required for multiple applications with overlapping schedules

 Essential Qualifications & Experience:

Highly analytical with strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Minimum of 5 years' business analysis experience across a variety of functions or domains
Proven experience designing and architecting solutions in Excel, VBA, Power Pivot and Access/SQL
Knowledge of RPA (UiPath preferred), Alteryx, automation tools and other automation technologiesBachelor's degree in a Business/Technology/Engineering or related degree
Technical experience; for example with business intelligence platforms database knowledge (i.e.Looker, PowerBI)
Experience working in an Agile environment
Excellent facilitation & critical analysis skills
Strong communication & translation of requirements skills.
Process and Data mapping experience
You should want to work in a fast-paced eCommerce business
Ability to influence and manage multiple stakeholders
Excellent operational organisation skills
High level of initiative and desire to get things done
Willingness to introduce change and challenge existing processes and procedures
eCommerce and or logistics industry experience is highly desirable

What's on offer?

Career growth – tailored learning & development, tuition assistance and professional certification.
Health & Wellbeing – dental & health insurance, reduced corporate gym membership, paid sick leave.
Work Life Balance – 25 days annual leave, flexible working, sports & social club.
Family – paid maternity & paternity leave, life assurance, income disability cover.
Financial – competitive salary, pension, stock option scheme, bike to work, travel TaxSaver, relocation assistance.

About us

Founded in 2010, eShopWorld powers cross-border ecommerce for the world's best-known brands, creating safer, simpler, and faster shopping experiences for consumers all around the globe. ESW's powerful combination of technology and human ingenuity optimizes the entire shopper journey, from site development to demand generation to checkout, through shipping, customer service and returns.

With configurable end-to-end solutions in more than 200 markets worldwide, we fully manage payments, compliance, data security, fraud protection, taxes and tariffs, helping clients enter new markets in as few as 6 weeks, and dramatically improve results in current markets. Bringing together more than 400 experts across multiple disciplines, the ESW team delivers profitable growth for retailers and brands worldwide.

title: Media Reporting Analyst
full description:
The role: Media Reporting Analyst
We are looking for a Reporting Analyst to join our Marketing Effectiveness team based in our Dublin office.
Are you are next star player?
We are building a new Marketing Effectiveness team, and we’re looking for individuals with big ideas and the ability to think creatively and outside of the box. You will become part of a company that gives you everything you need to create winning moments to push your own boundaries and build the best experience for our millions of players around the world.
Why we need you:
We are seeking a highly analytical and data-centric Reporting Analyst to join the team. We would like to hear from individuals who are passionate about data, visualising data and turning data into business value. Enjoy using data to tell a story.
The role will involve conducting in-depth reporting and analysis to identify meaningful insights and making recommendations that will influence the direction of the business.
You will be responsible for:
Compiling and populating Performance marketing set of reports and distributing to the wider business.
Post campaign analysis across all campaigns and verticals – collaborating closely with channel owners and responsibility of the analysis and performance review of each campaign.
Working with the relevant channels to prioritise business and information needs and evaluate brand and top of funnel campaigns.
Leveraging data and working with the Digital teams to understand tracking and acquisition performance across all acquisition channels.
Identify and investigate trends, patterns, anomalies, spikes and other occurrences in data sets that will help drive intelligent planning and decisions.
Collaborating with the wider team and business partners to building innovative reporting and insight solutions using existing and external tools. Identifying any gaps in coordination with the Marketing Effectiveness roadmap
Advise internal team with regards to patterns and relationships in the data. Working with the team to recommend campaign direction
Maintaining excellent communication with all channel leads and ensure they are well-informed regarding key performance indicator trends
Work with cross-functional teams to build reports and interactive experiences for data delivery and easily understood presentation to executives.
Who we’re looking for:
An individual with proven experience in delivering reports and presentations through visualisation tools e.g. PowerBI, Powerpoint, Tableau etc.
SQL coding ability and proven experience in ETL process and procedures
Someone who is skilled in problem solving and has excellent analytical skills and ability to provide impactful insights from data.
What’s in it for you?
Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus. And we provide advice and dedicated assistance to those moving to Dublin.

Your package will include:
health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address)
a personal interest allowance to let you learn something new or pursue a hobby
the option to join our company pension scheme
looking to extend your family? You will receive a cash gift of 1,000 EUR for your new addition whilst working for us
in-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career
free fresh fruit, snacks and drinks in the office
access to an onsite gym.
What happens next?
If you’re what we’re looking for, next up will be a Zoom interview.
The Group
PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange, which brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.
We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.
We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact: talent@starsgroup.com.

title: Product Analyst
full description:
As a Product Analyst, you are a member of a global team of data-driven influencers, setting the standard for how data and analytics is used at HubSpot, and inspiring our product teams to action.

Product and Engineering use multiple sources of data (user event data, NPS, and transactional data, etc) to discover what is going well for our customers, where we can improve, and what to build next. Product Analysts - individuals with high data literacy, intellectual curiosity, and communication skills - are at the center of these analyses and decisions; we work side-by-side with Product Management, User Experience, and Engineering leadership to inform and build better solutions for our customers.

In this role, while you operate with a high degree of autonomy, you benefit from the support of the Product Analytics community - sharing ideas, debating approaches, and receiving feedback to deliver more effective analyses and develop in your career.

General responsibilities:

Be a driving influencer on the use and application of analysis; deliver what's needed, and show what's possible
Partner with product stakeholders to understand your team's data and business needs; become an expert in translating these needs into specific analyses with actionable insights
Conduct quantitative analysis of user behavior to uncover issues or opportunities to improve the our customers' experience
Inform the design and analyze the outcomes of in-app tests and experiments
Collaborate across UX teams and business functions to infuse strategic, open ended research with quantitative insights
Communicate insights to your stakeholders with a data-driven point of view and plan for action

Examples of common projects:

Define (or redefine) leading indicators of success for your team. Serve as the expert for these metrics by understanding how data collection is instrumented in the product, how it flows through our ETL pipeline and is aggregated, and how metrics are defined in our analytics platform. Construct the core dashboards, visualizations and analyses to help stakeholders monitor product health and make better decisions
Perform ad hoc analyses into user behavior to inform specific, near-term experiment designs or product decisions or longer term product strategy
Partner with engineering and other internal operations teams to enable a high level of data integrity, consistency and clarity across cross multiple internal databases and reporting systems
Be a voice within your teams to educate, elevate and advocate for the continual value of leveraging analytics to inform decision making

From our Product and Engineering Blog: How HubSpot's product analysts transform the customer experience

Minimum Qualifications:

Academic or professional experience with a heavy quantitative, analytical focus
Practical experience in a business environment influencing decision making with data
Experience working with large datasets; particularly data mining, manipulation and exploration
Ability to write performant, complex SQL queries combining multiple sources of data
Comfortability with data analytics and statistical tools such as R or Python
Confidence using a variety of analytical and statistical techniques
Passionate about the role of data in helping solve complex questions
Excellent communication, storytelling, and collaboration skills

Above and Beyond Qualifications:

Knowledge of analytical development tools such as Amplitude, Looker, Git and dbt
Demonstrated passion for building products that delight customers and drive their success
Experience working at, or strong understanding of, a SaaS business.

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don't hesitate to apply — we'd love to hear from you.


About HubSpot

HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers' needs at any stage of growth. We're also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work through. If that sounds like something you'd like to be part of, we'd love to hear from you.

You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #4 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2021, and has been recognized for award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.

Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees work across the globe in HubSpot offices and remotely. Visit our careers website to learn more about culture and opportunities at HubSpot.


By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot's use of your personal information.

title: EMEA Analytics Solutions Analyst
full description:
Position Overview:

As part of the EMEA Analytics & Insights Capabilities Team you will enable our partners to make decision with connected data/Advanced Analytics solutions and establish metrics that drive business outcomes. The Analytics Solutions Analyst will help translate strategic business questions into scalable metrics and drive analysis based on findings & optimization. You will partner with our Analytics and Insights teams to pilot and prototype Advanced Analytic solutions. You will use your technical skills, modeling abilities, and digging into the data and delivering key insights that can help enable connected data and advance our data maturity. A team-player attitude is crucial, we value collaboration, willingness to learn, curiosity, purpose, and diversity as part of our culture.
Function Related Activities/Key Responsibilities:
You will be responsible for leveraging our data to create analytics that can support current and future needs, driving analytical maturity, new capabilities, partnering with data architecture, governance, solutions and Platform Service center Data and IT teams.
Design systems and processes to document data & Analytical Solutions across business functions
Adding intelligence with AI/ML where it matters to create new efficiencies and new value
Problem-solve with product and business teams, advise executive team how to leverage Advanced Analytics across the company.
Foster the cross-system connectivity to each other within the function, with other business functions and any other Enterprise functions
Align with peer Analytics Solutions Leads to build shareable/reusable solutions and eliminate silos
Identify common data & Advanced Analytics needs vs exclusive needs
Study current data systems & Advanced Analytics solutions in place and problems need to be addressed
Cross share functional learnings with the peer Analytics Solutions Leads and with Capabilities Team to drive deployment of global solutions and standards
Education Requirements:
Master’s or PhD in Quantitative field, (ML/AI , Computer Sc./Advanced Analytics, Econometrics).
Advanced Programming skills VB, Python, R, SQL, (GAMS and Java a plus)
Bayesian Statistics knowledge is a plus
Related Work Experience:
Minimum 3 years’ experience in similar role.
Experience using Agile delivery methodologies
Experience on MS DevOps and Azure Databricks.
Experience building Forecasting Tools
Experience building Geolocation Data Analytics Tools is a plus
Experience applying Dynamic Optimization methods is a plus
Experience in Big Data and Cloud solution implementation is a plus
Functional Skills:
Strong team player
Analytical & communication skills
Demonstrated track record of capability development that has led to improved business results
A passion to learn/develop and bring in emerging trends/technology that drive further insight value
The mindset of an entrepreneurial thinker and is a self-starter, displaying proactive thinking
Our Purpose and Growth Culture:
We are taking deliberate action to nurture an inclusive culture that is grounded in our company purpose, to refresh the world and make a difference. We act with a growth mindset, take an expansive approach to what’s possible and believe in continuous learning to improve our business and ourselves. We focus on four key behaviors – curious, empowered, inclusive and agile – and value how we work as much as what we achieve. We believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years. Visit Our Purpose and Vision to learn more about these behaviors and how you can bring them to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. When we collect your personal information as part of a job application or offer of employment, we do so in accordance with industry standards and best practices and in compliance with applicable privacy laws.

title: HCM Project Coordinator and Analyst
full description:
Our client, a tech multinational based in Dublin is looking for an individual with experience with Human Capital Management software, abscence mangagment tracking and time tracking for a 6 month contract. Within this role, you will be invovled in mapping out processes, gaining business requirements, wokring with project teams, and acting as a go to relationship manager between People Teams and Engineering Teams. This role is ideal for someone wtih a background in Human Resources, HCM software, and who have stepped in to an analytical role.
About the Team
The Global People Operations team strives to create and deliver a seamless and positive employee experience across the entire employee lifecycle. Leading with care and empathy, we develop efficient and simple people processes, systems, policies, and programs. We deliver data that is useful and accurate to create People-related strategies across the business. We manage people knowledge and provide expertise on how HR systems are connected.Our work also ensures the company remains protected and compliant. We strive to ensure employees feel heard and given the resources and support they need during the most important moments during their careers.
About the Role:
We are seeking a HCM Super user to assist in delivering technology solutions for HR programs. The ideal candidate will question common assumptions, rethink existing processes, and see every challenge as an opportunity for improvement. We're looking for an execution focused individual, who can look at the big picture from a user experience, technology and business standpoint but also connect this to the HR need. This role supports process and technology on a global scale.
Responsibilities
Identify and support transformative cross-functional initiatives to improve business outcomes for HR.
Support shared vision across the HR and business functions by partnering with key internal business stakeholders.
Acts as primary project contact to establish key stakeholder requirements and project objectives. Creating business requirements artifacts, including process designs, test scripts, and user stories.
Development of process documentation, stakeholder presentations and associated artifacts. Support project and process change management activities.
Maintain effective communication with project relevant stakeholders including creation of project plans and facilitate resolution of all issues to reach project goals.
Coordinate project activities across engineering and HR teams, define and track key project milestones and deliverables.
Analysis of data and metrics to inform product and process roadmaps.
Requirements:
4+ years experience implementing customer-facing technology solutions
4+ years experience driving small to medium technology initiatives
Experience creating business requirements artifacts, including process designs
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Excel and data analysis skills
Proven relationship and partnership building skills
Demonstrated experience leading global technical projects end-to-end with multiple stakeholders
Experience with Agile, Scrum, BABOK, SDLC or similar project management methodologies
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Proven track record of effectively interacting with internal and external stakeholders
Demonstrated experience working in a fast-paced environment with stakeholders and users
Familiarity with Workday HCM including Absence and Time Tracking as either a super-user or configurator.
Familiarity with Salesforce Service Cloud
Experience leading change management initiatives
Morgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Agency and references to pay rates are indicative.
BY APPLYING FOR THIS ROLE YOU ARE AGREEING TO OUR TERMS OF SERVICE WHICH TOGETHER WITH OUR PRIVACY STATEMENT GOVERN YOUR USE OF MORGAN MCKINLEY SERVICES.

title: Business Analyst - Sales Programs
full description:
What is the role about?
As a Business Analyst you will be joining the Planning & Operations team of one of the largest Technology multinationals in Ireland, supporting with revenue reporting and insights for sales leadership as well as operational and strategic programs across EMEA regions. Your main goal is to assist in business planning and resource management activities by providing accurate, timely and thorough data analysis and insights to support business decision-making processes. Other responsibilities may include program management support of ongoing initiatives in the region.
This is an 11 month contract through RECRUITERS
What are the main Responsibilities?
Put together the revenue reporting and qualitative insights/analysis to provide context around KPIs and revenue metrics for senior sales and leadership group.
Provide revenue analysis (revenue performance, product adoption, market trends, etc.) that will be used to support leadership business decisions and make clear recommendations based on analysis to senior management to drive discussions with sales on areas for investment or improvement.
Support ad hoc data requests and identify opportunities for reporting, analytical or operational efficiencies across the region
Contribute to forecasting initiatives to accurately forecast at an EMEA level, using multiple data sources to accurately predict future sales performance
Work with large data sets & complex infrastructure
Work within the wider team to support global or regional operational and strategic projects

Who is the ideal candidate?
The ideal candidate has excellent Tableau and excel skills and is capable of working with large, complex data sets from varying data sources. Other requirements as follows:
Has a track record of initiating and completing data-centric analyses leading to recommendations
Has 5+ years of work experience in an analytical role supporting EMEA regions.
Experience with SQL, and delivering Powerpoint presentations
Experience with end-to-end execution of projects and program management, managing multiple concurrent projects, and driving initiatives in a cross-functional environment

title: People Analyst, Reporting and Insights
full description:
Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: London, UK; Dublin, Ireland
Minimum qualifications:

Experience managing learning design projects from analysis through launch and evaluation, across a multitude of modalities (online, mobile, virtual, in-person) in global organizations.
Experience advising executive stakeholders.
Experience in adult learning, change management, instructional design, and/or leadership development.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience designing for rollout of new processes or HR transformation, such as performance management, career development, or related topics.
Comfortability with ambiguity and frequent changes in client needs and contexts.
About the job
At Google, data drives all of our decision-making, and our HR organization is no exception. The People Analytics team acts as an internal innovation lab, using analytical approaches to make sure Google continues to be a great place to work. The team provides critical support to the business around issues of organizational health and is responsible for not just taking the pulse of our Googlers, but harnessing Googler feedback to drive change for the better. As an analyst you'll be detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and curious. You're a strong problem-solver, who uses both quantitative and qualitative methods to get things done. And on top of it all, you're someone who wonders "What if?" and then seeks out the solution.

As a People Analyst, you'll work within the People Analytics Reporting & Insight (R&I) team where our mission is to empower business leaders and Business HR with data and insights to understand their organizations and drive people strategy. As a key point of contact (POC) you'll be an internal analytical consultant aligned to our geographically aligned HR partners (Market HR).
Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.
Responsibilities
Combine information from different sources to create analytical plans that address client/stakeholder needs, and execute them. Act as a thought partner to design and measure the impact of surveys, experiments and interventions.
Manipulate and analyze large datasets to distill insights from data, and convey findings to executive audiences. Create effective, scalable, and easy to understand reporting solutions (e.g. dashboards).
Build relationships and collaborate with teammates, business leaders, and HR clients to solve organizational problems.
Prioritize work to manage multiple workstreams, challenging situations, and new information.
Work through ambiguity (e.g., create structure from nothing, develop deadlines), and connect disparate ideas into cohesive, well-grounded recommendations, using creative, structured and analytical thinking.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

title: Market Surveillance Analyst
full description:
Overview
This role will report to the Senior Market Surveillance Analyst of FRTSIL. The FRTSIL Compliance team is responsible for assisting the business manage and mitigate regulatory and compliance risk. It is an independent function within Refinitiv and reports through the Refinitiv General Counsel Team. Refinitiv Compliance supports a variety of businesses within Refinitiv globally ranging from regulated activity to activity that has regulatory touch points.
Role Summary
The Market Surveillance Analyst role will be located in Dublin, Ireland and this individual will provide first class market surveillance expertise and advice to ensure Refinitiv’s operations, as well as regulated and unregulated activities are conducted in compliance with regulatory expectations. The role predominantly interacts with our FX MTF, FXall, Matching and Dealing platforms.
Key Responsibilities / Accountabilities
· Monitor for improper trading behaviour such as price manipulation, spoofing, insider dealing, insider information violations, and general market abuse
· Review platform trading activity for any violations with Refinitiv rulebooks, operating procedures, and/or market regulations
· Manage surveillance platform alert output. Discern which alerts require further escalation. Present alert findings to Surveillance Review Team. Ensure alert risks are mitigated in a timely manner.
· Create cases associated with questionable alerts. Own alert case lifecycle from inception to completion.
· Work with the broader surveillance team to help build, create FRDs, beta test, and implement new alerts.
· Assist with alert calibration for new and existing modules.
· Engage in risk assessment and risk mitigation planning specifically related to Refinitiv trading platforms.
· Work closely with the business to develop pragmatic market surveillance solutions and opportunities while remaining cognizant of regulatory rules, obligations and expectations.
· Work seamlessly and in partnership with other members of the Refinitiv Compliance team globally, establishing and maintaining an effective colleagueship.
· Leveraging and partnering with other colleagues within Refinitiv, which include but are not limited to: IT, Onboarding, Operations, and the BU.
· Prepare management information reports for both internal and external regulatory reporting purposes.
· Assist with developing, maintaining and updating relevant regulatory policies, processes and procedures. Assist with ensuring and enforcing compliance with all aspects of these policies, processes and procedures. Assist in any other Compliance work as and when request
Technical Skills:
· Knowledge of FX products, Spot, Fwd, Swaps, NDFs, and Options or equivalent Equities or Fixed Income Knowledge.
· Knowledge of FX Trading Venues (or other product asset classes) /ECNs
· Knowledge and understanding of regulated activity, in particular MiFID and EU MAR
· Experience working with monitoring and surveillance programs or Investigative Analysis
· Proficiency in the Microsoft Suite (Excel, Word, Power Point etc.)
Interpersonal Skills:
· Excellent verbal and written communication
· Attention to detail
· Excellent planning and organization abilities
· Excellent time management and delivery skills
· Able to analyse and provide solutions
· Able to communicate and interact effectively at all levels with excellent interpersonal and team skills, together with excellent presentation skills
· Able to project manage and ensure issues are resolved or escalated effectively
· Able to work independently and as part of a team
· Process change management
Aptitude:
· Proactive
· Able to work with different cultures and nationalities
· Able to negotiate and resolve issues with meaningful solutions both internally and externally
Desired Skills:
· Knowledge of regulations/market practice in other countries – Europe, US, Asia
· Business and commercial awareness
· Knowledge of global securities laws
We care about benefits too.
We support our colleagues’ wellbeing with inclusive benefits. So that's support for physical, financial, mental and environmental health, paid time off to volunteer, consumer discounts & savings and so much more.
