title: Business Analyst
full description:
The Opportunity

We are going through a period of rapid growth and the finance team is recruiting and expanding their team to meet these demands and scale for future growth. As part of a large-scale transformation programme, we are looking for an experienced and highly motivated person to join eShopWorld as a Business Analyst.

The successful candidate will have a high understanding of Excel and VBA, with a vision to automate and structure large amounts of data through Excel, VBA, RPA or other technologies. The candidate will be responsible for structuring current reporting models to enhance, automate and create inter-relational data structures between tasks and departments. This position requires a close working relationship with key stakeholders to understand their specific data requirements and developing the necessary documentation to support the team across the development and support after implementation.

Key Responsibilities:

Transformation activities:

Ability to analyse and document in relevant detail business processes and user requirements.
Design reporting models and processes in Excel, and define required automations
Structure data flows and inter-relationships between processes and departments
Produce both process and data flow maps as required identifying timings, functional responsibilities etc.
Effectively translate stakeholders' problems or demands into solutions. Map and document the desired outcomes to show the `To be' processes against the processes which can be supported by a technical solution or package
Continually critically analyse development requirements in terms of solution design, dependency, and value / outcome
Effectively engage with stakeholders to ensure clarity of expectation and outcome to reduce iteration cycles or misinterpretation
Define resource allocation and priority of activities in collaboration with stakeholders
Assist stakeholders in reviewing functionality outcomes to ensure in line with original scoping and assisting where outcome is not in line with expectation (successful UAT of data related solutions)
Ensure full alignment between various internal and external teams to confirm and gain agreement to the desired outcomes
Ability to facilitate information gathering sessions to capture key Business Requirements
Ability to self-manage the business analysis activity through to completion

Technology based activities:

Identify best technology to use for each solution implementation
Identify improvements and enhancements by applying different technologies
Define required formulas or VBA solutions to simplify and automate data models
Define implementation process using RPA and/or Alteryx
Lead User Acceptance Testing as part of our go-live preparation
Maintain a high level of knowledge about all products, systems and procedures that relate to each of the implementations
Foster and lead a continuous improvement culture. Identify process improvements and process re-engineering, to help to improve business practices
Participate in architectural process reviews as part of project and strategic initiatives
Data Management Governance
Manage Ad hoc projects and tasks as assigned from time to time
Prioritize, schedule and complete development and testing required for multiple applications with overlapping schedules

 Essential Qualifications & Experience:

Highly analytical with strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Minimum of 5 years' business analysis experience across a variety of functions or domains
Proven experience designing and architecting solutions in Excel, VBA, Power Pivot and Access/SQL
Knowledge of RPA (UiPath preferred), Alteryx, automation tools and other automation technologiesBachelor's degree in a Business/Technology/Engineering or related degree
Technical experience; for example with business intelligence platforms database knowledge (i.e.Looker, PowerBI)
Experience working in an Agile environment
Excellent facilitation & critical analysis skills
Strong communication & translation of requirements skills.
Process and Data mapping experience
You should want to work in a fast-paced eCommerce business
Ability to influence and manage multiple stakeholders
Excellent operational organisation skills
High level of initiative and desire to get things done
Willingness to introduce change and challenge existing processes and procedures
eCommerce and or logistics industry experience is highly desirable

What's on offer?

Career growth – tailored learning & development, tuition assistance and professional certification.
Health & Wellbeing – dental & health insurance, reduced corporate gym membership, paid sick leave.
Work Life Balance – 25 days annual leave, flexible working, sports & social club.
Family – paid maternity & paternity leave, life assurance, income disability cover.
Financial – competitive salary, pension, stock option scheme, bike to work, travel TaxSaver, relocation assistance.

About us

Founded in 2010, eShopWorld powers cross-border ecommerce for the world's best-known brands, creating safer, simpler, and faster shopping experiences for consumers all around the globe. ESW's powerful combination of technology and human ingenuity optimizes the entire shopper journey, from site development to demand generation to checkout, through shipping, customer service and returns.

With configurable end-to-end solutions in more than 200 markets worldwide, we fully manage payments, compliance, data security, fraud protection, taxes and tariffs, helping clients enter new markets in as few as 6 weeks, and dramatically improve results in current markets. Bringing together more than 400 experts across multiple disciplines, the ESW team delivers profitable growth for retailers and brands worldwide.

title: Media Reporting Analyst
full description:
The role: Media Reporting Analyst
We are looking for a Reporting Analyst to join our Marketing Effectiveness team based in our Dublin office.
Are you are next star player?
We are building a new Marketing Effectiveness team, and we’re looking for individuals with big ideas and the ability to think creatively and outside of the box. You will become part of a company that gives you everything you need to create winning moments to push your own boundaries and build the best experience for our millions of players around the world.
Why we need you:
We are seeking a highly analytical and data-centric Reporting Analyst to join the team. We would like to hear from individuals who are passionate about data, visualising data and turning data into business value. Enjoy using data to tell a story.
The role will involve conducting in-depth reporting and analysis to identify meaningful insights and making recommendations that will influence the direction of the business.
You will be responsible for:
Compiling and populating Performance marketing set of reports and distributing to the wider business.
Post campaign analysis across all campaigns and verticals – collaborating closely with channel owners and responsibility of the analysis and performance review of each campaign.
Working with the relevant channels to prioritise business and information needs and evaluate brand and top of funnel campaigns.
Leveraging data and working with the Digital teams to understand tracking and acquisition performance across all acquisition channels.
Identify and investigate trends, patterns, anomalies, spikes and other occurrences in data sets that will help drive intelligent planning and decisions.
Collaborating with the wider team and business partners to building innovative reporting and insight solutions using existing and external tools. Identifying any gaps in coordination with the Marketing Effectiveness roadmap
Advise internal team with regards to patterns and relationships in the data. Working with the team to recommend campaign direction
Maintaining excellent communication with all channel leads and ensure they are well-informed regarding key performance indicator trends
Work with cross-functional teams to build reports and interactive experiences for data delivery and easily understood presentation to executives.
Who we’re looking for:
An individual with proven experience in delivering reports and presentations through visualisation tools e.g. PowerBI, Powerpoint, Tableau etc.
SQL coding ability and proven experience in ETL process and procedures
Someone who is skilled in problem solving and has excellent analytical skills and ability to provide impactful insights from data.
What’s in it for you?
Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus. And we provide advice and dedicated assistance to those moving to Dublin.

Your package will include:
health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address)
a personal interest allowance to let you learn something new or pursue a hobby
the option to join our company pension scheme
looking to extend your family? You will receive a cash gift of 1,000 EUR for your new addition whilst working for us
in-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career
free fresh fruit, snacks and drinks in the office
access to an onsite gym.
What happens next?
If you’re what we’re looking for, next up will be a Zoom interview.
The Group
PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange, which brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.
We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.
We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact: talent@starsgroup.com.
Please note we cannot accept general applications; this inbox is just for providing support to those who need it.

title: IT Regional (Deskside) Support and Digital Experience Analyst
full description:
This role is a dual 50/50 role offering both Deskside support for the Dublin site and Digital Experience Analysis for our Global IT service.

This hybrid role is aimed at Deskside Support staff who have an interest in support processes, managing relationships between users and global support groups, and support service problem solving and data analysis.

The Deskside support section of this role will focus on standard IT support for Dublin based users. Working within a Global IT department to deliver best in class support to our local users, including significant Senior Leadership presence.
The Digital Experience analyst section of this role will be asked to bring predictive analysis and tools to improve our end user digital experience. They are focused on building the systems and processes we need to help us monitor and improve how our systems are experienced by our users.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Regional Services/ Deskside Support
Handling Helpdesk enquiries, interpreting requests, educating customers.
Investigate and support complex business applications and systems.
Day to day management, monitoring and troubleshooting of IT systems with the defined area of responsibility.
Deliver incidents, requests and projects to the agreed targets, SLAs and KPIs.
Deploy and troubleshoot the IT environment using extensive knowledge of Microsoft and associated operating systems and software
Work alongside team members in other countries, regions, to deliver various ongoing I.T. projects
Maintain up-to-date patching practices, records, policies and procedures as and when required
Display a focus on user satisfaction through strong interpersonal and communication skills
Digital Experience lifecycle management
Work with the User Experience team to build a Digital Experience Service which views users experience of our IT systems from issue detection to employee engagement to resolution
Investigate and build expertise in the Digital Experience tools in use.
Develop structures, reports and process which create the most value from this service.
Make best use of the tools provided and experience as a user of IT to refine the process over time.
Work with the various user groups to build relationships throughout the business.
Engage users in active conversations to understand negative experience, it’s context and where required send targeted communications
Define user profiles and groupings in order to better monitor and improve IT services
Actively work with IT groups to translate Digital Experience insights into system improvements.

Skills and Experience

1-2 years’ experience in supporting IT systems
Knowledge and experience of Windows 10
Ability to manage Desktop Devices (hardware, software and connectivity) incidents through to resolution.
Experience with the remote management of Desktop Devices using appropriate tools.
Ability to support, manage, optimize and maintain the configuration and installation of the Desktop, to include, but not limited to, patch updates, hardware replacements, with spares provided by vendor.
Ability to analyze Helpdesk calls for Desktop Devices and incident data to identify and advise users of any potential user training requirement.
Some history in, or experience of, VIP-type support for Desk side issues.
Good to have – experience of user and object management in AD.
You should be comfortable with supporting users of various levels of seniority with a mature, friendly attitude.
You should be an active problem solver, not just seeing a problem, but able to develop solutions.
Ability to quickly build relationships with users and other IT support staff and understand and predict users’ requirements.
Motivated, flexible and confident.
Experienced with some level of data analysis and communicating insights.
Ability to build and deliver presentations and reports where required.
Good oral and written communication skills

About Ardagh Group

Ardagh Group is a global leader in metal and glass packaging solutions, producing packaging for the world’s leading brands. We trace our roots all the way back to the Irish Glass Bottle Company, founded in 1932. Since then we have grown rapidly to a team of more than 16,000 people with revenues of almost $7 billion. Today we have a presence across Europe and the Americas.

Our modern Dublin office is located in the Central Business Park in Sandyford. Our Dublin team has almost one hundred employees working in finance, IT, procurement, and HR.

Did you know that Ardagh produce many of the beverage cans and bottles you drink your favourite beverages from?
Did you know we produce metal and glass packaging which are permanent materials, meaning they can be infinitely recycled without any loss of quality?
Did you know we produce more than 160 million containers per day?

Ardagh is passionate about sustainability and have a reputation for innovation. We push the boundaries of what’s possible, pioneering new production methods, new design techniques and new ways to recycle and save energy. Our aim is to reduce any negative environmental impact whilst remaining economically sustainable and socially responsible.

We believe that the success of our business depends on the success of our people. We strive to create working environments where our employees feel valued, can work to their full potential, and where their achievements are celebrated.

Here at Ardagh, we offer exciting and rewarding opportunities for talented and creative people. If you have ambition and want to make an impact with your career, come and join our team, you’ll enjoy the journey!

Click here for more information about our careers or click here for more information about Ardagh Group.

title: Business Analyst
full description:
Job Description
Leveris Whitelabel apps are whitelabel iOS and Android native apps that are pre-integrated into the Leveris Platform. They come bundled with Leveris 3rd parties and app specific providers (analytics, logging etc.) out of the box. The apps are highly customisable, giving tremendous value to our customers.
We are looking for a talented Technical Business Analyst to join our mobile development team. The successful candidate will possess excellent technical analysis & documentation skills, will be able to navigate multiple teams and will have a strong interest in mobile front ends.
So if you’re interested in working on an awesome product set, with a fantastic and passionate team, supporting multiple clients on one codebase, then this job is for you.
Who we are
We are LEVERIS. We build banks. We build them so that financial providers can offer services quickly, differently and more beautifully than ever before. Our headquarters are in Dublin with development centres in the Czech Republic and Belarus. That’s over 150 minds working together to create banking that works better for everyone. Before we found our calling here, some of us were engineers, salespeople, analysts and even rocket scientists. While our backgrounds may vary across banking, business and tech, we’ve one key thing in common – we’ve all been customers.
Responsibilities

Create manage and maintain end-to-end process flows and API sequence diagrams for exciting banking features
Assessing and validating APIs & other integration types for suitability
Assess and compare mobile technologies and partners
Create, manage, deliver and iterate user stories
Liaise with product owners, analysts and designers for cross-team initiatives


Requirements

Knowledge of the following (or equivalent) tools: Jira, Lucid chart, Postman
3+ years experience as a Technical Business Analyst
A keen understanding of data flows and how systems hang together
Ability to take initiative and engage with senior stakeholders
Excellent communication and people skills
Strong organisational and time-management abilities
Eligible to live and work in EU


Bonus Skills

Knowledge or experience in app development
A strong interest or prior work in fintech


Benefits

Help shape one of Europe's most up-and-coming fintechs
Learn cutting-edge technology with global application
See your work in the hands of millions of people
Access to senior management
Collaborative and fun work culture
Opportunity to travel and work with colleagues and clients in other countries when it is safe to do so

title: Senior IT Business Analyst
full description:
Senior IT Business Analyst- Head Office


GET TO KNOW US

We’re a retail world built on iconic firsts. Famed for the creativity that touches our brands, buildings and experiences. We’re always challenging ourselves to make every experience more special and unique for our customers and our people. We are committed to equality, diversity and inclusion in the workplace and are proud to have received bronze accreditation from the Irish Centre for Diversity as a result of successfully demonstrating the effective D&I policy’s that we have in place. Supported by strong family foundations that inspire us to create something that lasts, because we care about the tomorrow we’re carving out.

KNOW THE ROLE

Our IT department are looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join their team.
Ability to design technical solution requirements and specification based on requests from the business.
Create tech specifications and requirements based on the business requirements to enable definition of user stories
Identify system dependencies and where/when changes are required in order to facilitate requirements - Perform system analysis on software programs, applications, and web services.
Responsible for initial feasibility assessment of projects/features which requires technical input
Close collaboration and assisting our Vendors with the delivery of the development tasks
Close collaboration with the delivery team to guide and advise on design and technical implementation of the solution in line with the client requirements
Ensure technical quality and good design principles are followed
Experience working in an agile multi-project environment, with multiple parallel projects developing new functionality
Understanding of high-level architecture, and how it integrates with other architectural components
Perform root cause analysis of any productions issues that may arise
Utilize systems and data to resolve business challenges in the most effective, innovative, and productive manner.
Serve as subject matter expert providing direction to less experienced staff.
Ensuring end-user proficiency with new systems, programs, and applications across departments.
Determining system efficiency and functionality by liaising with internal departments and end-users.
Efficiently integrating new systems, programs, and applications with business operations and services.
Ability to create and action regression/progression Test scripts.
Identify upstream and downstream impacts of a business or system change and work closely with teams across the organization to ensure process continuity and integrity.
 Manage and report on workload to your manager in a professional and clear way, to ensure steady delivery of tasks on time, while maintaining work life balance.
Take responsibility for documenting your output to a high professional standard, building time into your estimates to make sure this is always done.

KNOW WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

University degree or 5+ years of similar experience
Technical experience working across multiple inter-connected applications
Technical experience with XML & SQL.
Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, prioritization and decision-making skills.
Ability to address both technical and business requirements in solving problems.
Demonstrated experience in business process analysis, modelling, and re-engineering; background in process to system mapping, modelling, and implementation.
Experience creating technical documentation, activity and sequence diagram.
A detail-oriented and can-do approach
Additional Advantageous Knowledge
Experience in API and back end integrations, ERP, Order Management Systems, Payment gateways, Stock management tools, Salesforce commerce cloud, Salesforce marketing cloud, Business Manager
Retail knowledge preferable
KNOW HOW WE WORK
We act with authenticity, honesty and integrity in everything we do. Encouraging working environments where everyone can use their creativity to drive the business forward in an ever changing retail environment. Our teams are passionate about creating an authentic and unique experience for all our customers. Brown Thomas and Arnotts prides itself on working as one business and two brands. We share our knowledge and support others to be successful in achieving individual and company goals. We deliver results and celebrate success!

KNOW WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU

Our City Centre based stores are close to all forms of transport and surrounded by many shops, parks and beautiful restaurants.
Team discount is offered to all team members across Brown Thomas Arnotts and our Concession partners.
Wellbeing initiatives at BTA include but are not limited to;

EAP Scheme, Tax Saver Commuter, Bike to Work, Local Discounts, Sports & Social Club.

title: Client Experience Analyst
full description:
We are looking for an exceptional Client Experience Analyst to join our EMEA Business Planning and Operations (BP&O) Small Business Group team .
You should be someone who is passionate about delivering superior customer experience, a person who thinks and acts globally but understands the importance of market nuance and a desire to serve our small businesses.
The ideal candidate will be as comfortable working with data and logic as well as having a client centric lens providing the business with focused insights on our client experience and journey.
You will require a high level of empathy for small business owners, understanding of sales structure and a keen eye for identifying process and workflow improvement opportunities. Success in this position requires strong critical-thinking and problem-solving skills; attention to detail; the ability to thrive in a dynamic and changing environment; and a passion for helping others achieve results.
You will be able to demonstrate high levels of enthusiasm, motivation and dedication and an ability to manage communication and relations with multiple stakeholders both internal and external, including teams from Sales, Quality Assurance, Training and our outsourcing partners.
Responsibilities
Understand data and deliver holistic insights utilising operational data such as: AHT; pitch-rates and action-rates (revenue);
Understand how to map these signals to Voice of the Customer data and Quality Assurance data to identify, through root-cause analysis, the agent behavioural levers driving operational performance across multiple programs, regions markets and verticals.
Leverage and unify multiple customer listening posts (surveys, customer verbatim, focus groups, social media, etc.) to create a more reliable and sensitive customer feedback signal.
Develop and assess customer experience through direct contact interactions and trend analysis, ensuring strong reporting capability on contact centre agent performance, understanding and communicating the narrative to internal and external stakeholders through a robust set of metrics, data visualization and presentation.
Create specific recommendations and action plans to drive product, people and process improvement strategy across multiple customer touchpoints and work with cross-functional partners to identify and implement optimal solutions.
Create detailed project plans and clear communication strategies to drive effective change.
Minimum Requirements
4+ years of relevant experience in business operations, sales excellence, process redesign, a consulting role, quality assurance or customer experience.
Experience with SQL, tableau, data analysis & visualization tools.
Strong operational background and project management skills with experience running strategic projects with cross-functional teams.
Fluency in English, both oral and written
Excellent business acumen, passion for solving problems, and strong analytical skills.
Self-motivated, entrepreneurial, and dealing with ambiguity.
A love for change and an ability to ruthless prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Strong desire to collaborate, share, drive best practices cross-functionally and globally.
Innovative and creative in finding solutions/ designing improved methods, systems and processes.
Attention to detail and ability to deep dive, identify root causes of variances; further execute solutions once identified.
Morgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Agency and references to pay rates are indicative.
BY APPLYING FOR THIS ROLE YOU ARE AGREEING TO OUR TERMS OF SERVICE WHICH TOGETHER WITH OUR PRIVACY STATEMENT GOVERN YOUR USE OF MORGAN MCKINLEY SERVICES.

title: Business Analyst, Transportation Execution
full description:
BA or BS in Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science or another technical field
5+ years in delivering and influencing business processes using data analysis
Experience with IT-based root cause analysis and process design.
Strong project management skills, highly organized to ensure a timely implementation.
Experience with statistical analysis, regression modeling and forecasting, time series analysis, data mining, financial analysis, and demand modeling
Experience in Statistical Software such as R, SAS, SPSS, MINITAB
Able to write SQL scripts for analysis and reporting ( SQL, MySQL)
Experience using one or more of Python, VBA, MATLAB, Java, C++ programming languages
Excellent communication skills and ability to simplify complex topics for broad audiences.
Fluency in English. Further additional EU languages also beneficial
Sound business judgment, proven ability to influence others, and strong analytical thinking skills are critical to success in this position

At Amazon we believe that every day is still day one. A day to take the first step and a day to look forward to new challenges. And, today is that day for you. It's your day to be part of something great. A day to make your ideas come to life and your day to join a company that redefines itself every day. A day to make history. That's the energy and passion behind Amazon.

The Transportation Execution Business Analyst works across the EU in a cross-functional environment with operations and analytics teams to support the teams to monitor, report, and predict impacts to our transportation network.

The successful candidate will have strong data mining and modeling skills and is comfortable facilitating ideas and working from concept through to execution. This role will also build tools and support structures needed to analyze data, dive deep into data and present findings to business partners to drive improvements.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Defining the project roadmap and coordinating the implementation based on the analytical results.
Understanding of analytical simulations and assessments. Must be able to quickly understand the business impact of the trends and make decisions that make sense based on available data
Reporting and analysis through tools, portals and reports; following solution-driven approach to systems and processes, using advanced computer literacy (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Word) and manipulating/mining data from database tables (Redshift, Oracle, Data Warehouse)
Pull and report data from numerous databases (using Excel, Access, SQL and / or other data management systems) and to perform ad hoc reporting and analysis as required
Communicate with external customers (Carriers, Vendors / Suppliers) and internal customers (Finance, Fulfillment Centers, Supply Chain)
Implement new processes and methodologies across the organization
Master’s degree or equivalent in Logistics / Supply Chain / Mathematics / Science / Engineering / Business Development
Experience developing and growing a business / start-up / association
Proficiency with TABLEAU, Microsoft Excel to include making charts, data manipulation, pivot tables, creating macros, and visual basic knowledge.
Fluency in German, French, Polish, or other European languages

title: Sr. Risk Analyst
full description:
The Position:

The Senior Risk Analyst, Global Mortgage Group role encompasses Capital and Risk Management, Portfolio Management and Financial Reporting along with other analytical support responsibilities across Arch Capital Group Ltd.’s (ACGL) Global Mortgage Segment. The candidate will report to the Chief Actuary of ACGL’s Mortgage Segment.
Arch Mortgage is a growing mortgage insurance company with a strong and global parent – Arch Capital Group Ltd. If you’re interested in joining a dynamic company and working with a team of motivated, high caliber people, apply today and come grow with us!
Job Responsibilities:

Capital and Risk Management
Production of quarterly stress testing analysis, working closely with business units and other team members to ensure accuracy of incoming data and a timely production schedule.
Provide support and guidance for Own Risk and Solvency Assessment (ORSA) activities across the Segment.
Analysis of capital requirements for the Segment under Rating Agency, Regulatory and internal capital consumption frameworks.
Conduct analysis and evaluation of risk transfer solutions across the Segment.
Support the production of Solvency II Technical Provisions.
Portfolio Management and Financial Reporting
Prepare quarterly transaction level profitability, Return on Equity (“ROE”) and embedded value analyses.
Production of data and analysis to feed into quarterly financial forecasting process for the Mortgage segment.
Other Analytical Support
Prepare risk and financial reporting dashboards and presentations for quarterly business review meetings.
Maintain and enhance existing management information metrics and reports that will deliver timely and accurate information on:
Delinquency, default, repossession, claim and claim severity levels for the portfolio of in-force Mortgage Insurance exposures;
Insurance and Risk in force by geography, product type, borrower type, lender, etc.
Develop and maintain a database of direct mortgage loan performance information for the purposes of further developing and refining the Mortgage Segment’s forecasting models.
Provide analytical support to business units around the Group as required, with a particular focus on business units outside of the US, with a view to promoting consistency and best practices.
Keep abreast of mortgage lending industry developments including, regulatory, lenders, products and related economic issues.
Required Skills/Experience:

Knowledge & Skills:
In-depth understanding of credit risk from an insurance and/or banking perspective.
Strong mathematical, analytical, communication and time management skills.
Fluency with Microsoft packages, at least one programming language such as SAS, SQL, Visual Basic and database management systems such as SQL Server.
Familiarity with business intelligence platforms such as Power BI.
Abilility and desire to take ownership of own workload and work independently as required.
Ability to organize and prioritize demanding workload according to volume and urgency.
Desired Skills/Experience:

Education:

Education & Experience:
Required knowledge & skills would typically be acquired through a Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, finance or actuarial science and a minimum of 5 years of mortgage/non-life (re)insurance or banking experience.
An Actuarial or CFA designation is not a requirement, but candidates should be able to demonstrate very strong mathematical and analytical skills and experience relevant to the role.
Working Conditions/Environment & Physical Demands:
Normal office environment
Occasional travel required.
Disclaimer
Incumbent may be asked to perform other duties as required.
The Company:

Arch Capital Group Ltd. is a Bermuda-based company which provides insurance, reinsurance and mortgage insurance on a worldwide basis. Arch Capital Services Inc. provides support and expertise to entities across ACGL to help them operate effectively and efficiently. Arch is committed to helping its associates create what’s next by providing access to a variety of programs supporting your professional development and a culture that encourages innovation, collaboration and professional growth. We seek talent that thinks innovatively, values collaboration and will go the extra mile to serve our customers and develop our company.

title: Sales Operations Analyst
full description:
The Business Planning & Operations group is to maximize business performance by being an objective and trusted function within this company.

Our client is seeking an analytical and detail-orientated business analyst to join the Business Planning & Operations team in EMEA to support revenue reporting and insights for sales leadership as well as operational and strategic programs in the region.
The main function of a business analyst is to assist in business planning and resource management activities by providing accurate, timely and thorough data analysis and insights to support business decision-making processes.
Other responsibilities may include program management support of ongoing initiatives in the region. This business analyst will be expected to have excellent Tableau and excel skills and be able to work with large, complex data sets from varying data sources.

Responsibilities
Contribute to preparation of regular Rhythm of Business activities including revenue reporting and qualitative insights/analysis to provide context around KPIs and revenue metrics for senior sales and BP&O leadership
Routinely provide ad hoc revenue analysis (revenue performance, product adoption, market trends, etc.) that will be used to support leadership business decisions and make clear recommendations based on analysis to senior BP&O leadership to drive discussions with sales on areas for investment or improvement.
Support ad hoc data requests and identify opportunities for reporting, analytical or operational efficiencies across the region
Contribute to forecasting initiatives to accurately forecast our business at an EMEA level, using multiple data sources to accurately predict future sales performance
Work with large data sets & complex infrastructure
Work within the wider Business Planning & Operations team to support global or regional operational and strategic projects
Requirements:
BA/BS in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Math, Finance, Physics, Engineering), or equivalent practical experience
5+ years of work experience in an analytical role, preferably in consulting, technology, investment banking or similar
5+ years experience with Excel and SQL, Powerpoint
Excellence in Tableau
Experience with end to end execution of projects and program management
Experience working independently, managing multiple concurrent projects and driving initiatives in a cross-functional environment
Proven analytical ability and business judgement; Proven problem-solving skills
Track record of initiating and completing data-centric analyses leading to recommendations
Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, and resource allocation; strong ability to apply accounting and mathematical principles to work as needed
Strong ability to work independently and manage one's time.
Morgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Agency and references to pay rates are indicative.
BY APPLYING FOR THIS ROLE YOU ARE AGREEING TO OUR TERMS OF SERVICE WHICH TOGETHER WITH OUR PRIVACY STATEMENT GOVERN YOUR USE OF MORGAN MCKINLEY SERVICES.

title: Operational Risk Analyst
full description:
My client is a global top tier asset manager looking to hire an operational risk analyst for their Dublin team. The firm manages a range of strategies—including equity, fixed income, quantitative and multi-asset class, private equity, real estate and hedge funds—on behalf of institutions, advisors and individual investors globally.
The Role:
As Operational Risk analyst you will be responsible for supporting the on-going management, maintenance and embedding of the Operational Risk Management framework.
The operational risk analyst will be responsible for identifying and investigating operational risk events, ensuring root cause analysis and control assessments are undertaken. This will involve understanding deep dive reviews on significant and complex events, to provide recommendations to enhance the control environment.
The operational risk analyst will identify process/control weaknesses, raise issues, and take associated actions where required. Assist and maintain the annual risk & control self-assessments across the business. Maintain the Operational Risk register and support the development of scenario analysis.
As Operational Risk Analyst, you will also get involved in Operational Resilience tasks, such as - working on developing and implementing local business continuity plans and assist with the development of the business impact analysis program.
Risk rate critical and significant third parties; oversee the business due diligence process.
Ideal Candidate:
Ideally looking for candidates with operational risk management experience; experience working with in a financial services environment, ideally within an Asset Management environment.
In addition to being committed to building a career within Operational risk – candidates must have excellent communication skills.
Be able to articulate complex issues to various audiences and build relationships with colleagues at all levels and across offices. They must be able to have excellent writing skills and a fine eye for detail and data management.
 Next Steps:
If you would like to schedule a confidential conversation about this role, please email me your CV to nm@barclaysimpson.com
Please note* Candidates must be eligible to work in the EU. No sponsorship is provided. Candidates must have operational risk experience within financial services, in order to be considered.

title: Business Analyst
full description:
Our client in Dublin is currently seeking an experienced and highly motivated Business Analyst.

This will be a 11 month position.
The Global Business Group (GBG) contributes directly to our client’s mission by connecting businesses with customers and helping them to maximize the return for their investment on our platforms. Within this, the Business Planning & Operations group is to maximize business performance by being an objective and trusted function within the organisation.

Our client is seeking an analytical and detail-orientated business analyst to join the Business Planning & Operations team in EMEA to support revenue reporting and insights for sales leadership as well as operational and strategic programs in the region. The main function of a business analyst is to assist in business planning and resource management activities by providing accurate, timely and thorough data analysis and insights to support business decision-making processes. Other responsibilities may include program management support of ongoing initiatives in the region. This business analyst will be expected to have excellent Tableau and excel skills and be able to work with large, complex data sets from varying data sources.

Responsibilities
Contribute to preparation of regular Rhythm of Business activities including revenue reporting and qualitative insights/analysis to provide context around KPIs and revenue metrics for senior sales and BP&O leadershipRoutinely provide ad hoc revenue analysis (revenue performance, product adoption, market trends, etc.) that will be used to support leadership business decisions and make clear recommendations based on analysis to senior BP&O leadership to drive discussions with sales on areas for investment or improvement.Support ad hoc data requests and identify opportunities for reporting, analytical or operational efficiencies across the regionContribute to forecasting initiatives to accurately forecast our business at an EMEA level, using multiple data sources to accurately predict future sales performanceWork with large data sets & complex infrastructureWork within the wider Business Planning & Operations team to support global or regional operational and strategic projects

Minimum Qualifications:
BA/BS in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Math, Finance, Physics, Engineering), or equivalent practical experience5+ years of work experience in an analytical role, preferably in consulting, technology, investment banking or similar5+ years experience with Excel and SQL, PowerpointExcellence in TableauExperience with end to end execution of projects and program managementExperience working independently, managing multiple concurrent projects and driving initiatives in a cross-functional environmentProven analytical ability and business judgement; Proven problem-solving skillsTrack record of initiating and completing data-centric analyses leading to recommendationsKnowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, and resource allocation; strong ability to apply accounting and mathematical principles to work as neededStrong ability to work independently and manage one’s time.Clear and succinct verbal and written communication skills and attention to detail
Benefits:
Competitive salary, with great onsite benefits including canteen with all meals, drinks and snacks included.
Healthcare contribution and inclusion in company pension scheme
Work laptop and phone
State of the art modern offices
25 days annual leave (pro-rata) plus paid bank holidays
Expanding workforce with potential for career progression for top performers
Working with a company that will make your CV stand out.

title: Senior Risk & Governance Analyst
full description:
Role: Senior Risk & Governance Analyst
Reporting to: Director of Privacy & Risk
Role Description
The Senior Risk & Governance Analyst will be responsible for performing risk evaluation and ongoing monitoring of Fenergo’s Risk Management requirements, against contractual commitments. Working with a wide-range of stakeholders, the role-holder will identify, manage, and mitigate operational, technology, and enterprise-level risks.
This role requires experience in Risk Management and Governance Reporting, along with an understanding of the risks inherent in SaaS/Cloud environments and outsourcing requirements.
Main Responsibilities:
Perform Risk reviews of Fenergo internal processes and create client-facing reports.
Create and maintain an internal control framework.
Track and disseminate global regulatory guidance relating to outsourcing, cloud computing and best practices in enterprise risk management.
Maintain the internal risk register and prepare monthly reporting packs for senior stakeholders.
Promote awareness of Risk Management across the business.
Develop a Risk Culture across the business.
Additional duties/tasks as assigned.
Requirements
Experience, Skills & Education
5+ years within a dedicated risk management role within a regulated institution.
Able to demonstrate prior experience creating control statements, and ongoing monitoring of mitigating controls.
Experience in creating annual risk plans and reporting against progress.
Ability to identify solutions that satisfy relevant risk requirements while executing sound business judgement.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with proven ability to explain complex concepts in a crisp, clear, concise, and graphic rich style.
University degree required.
Recognised compliance or risk qualification advantageous
Other Desirable skills
Self-starter who drives to succeed.
Demonstrate strong analytical and problem-solving attributes and be solution focused.
The successful candidate must be confident at interacting with stakeholders at all levels.
Stakeholder management, influencing and facilitation.
Organised, with excellent attention to detail.
Benefits
Opportunity to work with clients and colleagues on a global scale
Buddy system for all new starters
Collaborative working environment
Extensive training programmes, classroom and online, through ‘Fenergo University’
Opportunity to work on a cutting edge Fintech Product, using the latest of tools and technologies
Defined training and role tracking to allow you see and assess your own career development and progress
Active sports and social club
State of the art new offices in the heart of Dublin’s Docklands with great facilities, canteen and games area
Competitive company benefits, such as flexible working hours, work from home policy, bike to work scheme, private healthcare, pension, sports and social committee, weekly fitness and sports classes and much more

title: Data Operations Analyst II
full description:
Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet
We are at a transformational moment in our company journey - and we’re so excited about it. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture, and to accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our purpose is to help customers improve business performance with Dun & Bradstreet’s Data Cloud and Live Business Identity, and we’re wildly passionate and committed to this purpose. So, if you’re looking to make an immediate impact at a company that welcomes bold and diverse thinking, come join us!
The Role: As a Data Operations Analyst II, you will be working as part of an agile team, hands on with source data through to end Product. you will be responsible for the analysis, operation and maintenance of the Data Management processes, creation of new data processes to meet business data requirements, ingestion of new sources of data and delivery against data quality standards.
Your focus will be across the end to end lifecycle of data management. Proactively driving and governing our data’s accuracy, integrity, completeness, conformity and consistency. You will be passionate about the power of modern Cloud native services and the potential to harness the scale and automation opportunities they present. The role will include continuous improvement as a measure of success and drive to deliver improvements across our data lifecycle management.
The role involves operating a new, cutting edge cloud native platform designed to accumulate, derive meaning from, and apply stewardship to, large, diverse datasets. The candidate will bring a DataOps mindset to the platform share KPIs and collaborate closely with internal Data Owner teams, Technology Cloud Ops and SRE teams as well as engage directly with external source data providers and partners.
Key Responsibilities:
Key part of a team responsible for the end to end operational management of cloud data platform, adhering to required data management and governance practices
Lead the business decision-making by retrieving, aggregating datasets from multiple sources into actionable format and tools
Create documentation, reports and dashboards to support the effective management and operation of the data supply chain
Manage the provision of data sets and tools for business data analysis and analytics
Develop a variety of database query and visualization tools to identify and understand platform issues or events
Provide technical expertise in extraction, integration, and analysis of critical data
Own test case scenarios, prepare test data and perform Data Ops User Acceptance testing as platform functionality evolves
Key Requirements:
3+ years of experience within a similar position
Strong SQL knowledge is a minimum requirement
Knowledge of DataOps methodology and approach preferred
Passionate and curious about data with the ability to query and analyze datasets in order to drive fact- based decisions
Data visualization experience
Candidate should have a working knowledge of cloud data pipelines & processing, including but not limited to AWS, Snowflake
Knowledge of data transformation processes, exposure to standard and complex datatypes
Experience working in agile teams and SCRUM methodology
Robust data knowledge preferably around business data sets with proven analytical and quantitative skills
Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science field, Information Systems, Computer Science, Mathematics or similar
All employees and contractors working in D&B should be aware that they have responsibilities in relation to the Company’s Business Management System. This relates to information and its security, quality, environment and health and safety both during and post-employment with D&B.
Dun & Bradstreet is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, genetic information, protected military and veteran status, ancestry, marital status, medical condition (cancer and genetic characteristics) or any other characteristic protected by law.

We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with Dun & Bradstreet and need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website or to apply for a position, please send an e-mail with your request to TalentAcquisitionTeam@dnb.com. Determination on requests for reasonable accommodation are made on a case-by-case basis.
Please note that all Dun & Bradstreet job postings can be found at https://dnb.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/Careers and all communication from Dun & Bradstreet will come from an email address ending in @dnb.com.

Glofox is on a mission to build a healthier world. We are a venture backed product led SaaS company that is in hyper growth. Along with our ever-growing client base that spans over 60 countries, our team is dedicated to powering the fitness industry with digital solutions.

We are one team at Glofox consisting of honest, moral & ethical individuals who are heard and valued! We hold ourselves accountable- delivering on expectations & celebrating each other for the great work we do!

At Glofox, we love entrepreneurs because we are entrepreneurs. We know how much determination it takes to start your own business and grow it into something that lasts. We roll our sleeves up, we act fast, and we learn together. We're looking for people that will do the same.

title: Sales Strategy Analyst
full description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Sales
Job Details
Salesforce.com is the global leader in customer relationship management (CRM) software. We pioneered the shift to cloud computing, and today we’re delivering the next generation of social, mobile and cloud technologies that help companies revolutionize the way they sell, service, market and innovate – and become customer companies. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World’s Most Innovative Company according to Forbes and one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For. Our more human, less corporate culture is built around doing work that matters, winning as a team and celebrating success.


About The Position


The Analyst will play a critical role in the Sales Strategy team. The candidate will identify and report on key indicators of sales performance and market opportunity, using those findings to set the strategic agenda and drive projects for the sales organisation, and presenting recommendations to the sales leadership. Projects will include business planning, market segmentation, pipeline analysis, coverage optimization, and ongoing performance measurement. Deliverables range from robust analytic models, custom performance analysis, tactical business initiatives, and the packaging of findings into presentation-ready content for Salesforce executives.


The successful candidate will possess a passion for creating innovative analysis, the ability to develop findings and recommendations that transcend the numbers as well as the energy to contribute to projects impacting and transforming the business.


Ideally, this person will have worked or interned in a sales strategy & operations environment, management consultancy, or in a comparable environment that requires business acumen combined with analytical skills, and will feel comfortable interacting with senior management on a regular basis.


Responsibilities:
Support our business units with ongoing analysis and recommendations
Drive improvements in our sales process and coverage model through scalable analytics
Work cross-functionally to establish reporting standards
Assist in developing and delivering presentations for senior executives and inform decisions on a daily basis
Assist the business through each stage of the fiscal year planning cycle in the design and implementation of planning models, sales territories and sales quotas
Take part in key strategic initiatives to transform and shape the business for delivering growth
Interact regularly with different functions including Sales, Marketing, Finance and IT

Desired Skills/Experience:
Bachelors Degree, preferably in an analytical discipline such as engineering, science, economics, computer science etc.
Several years of experience in a similar field preferable
Strong data analysis and logical reasoning skills with experience analysing complex datasets using Excel, Google sheets, Tableau or SQL
Ability to balance priorities and work productively in a fast paced environment
Solid self-starter behaviour: Curious, innovative, problem solving & autonomous
Accommodations
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
Posting Statement
At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.
Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesfore.com or Salesforce.org.
Salesforce welcomes all.

title: Data Analyst
full description:

Data Analyst - Dublin City Centre

Great new opportunity for a data analyst to join an exciting Irish-owned Logistics company. You will work across a range of projects analysing and creating MI reports, combining data across multiple platforms and business areas to identify trends and ultimately strengthen the business.
You will work on improving and standardising reports, develop models using statistical ltechniques and visualisation, present findings and reccommend actions to senior management and ultimately have a key role in business decisions.

Degree with a quantitative focus
Excellent analytical and problem - solving skills

This role comes with an excellent package. Market leading salary, pension, healthcare, travel concessions, study scheme, subsidised lunches, flexible and remote working, performance management scheme and more!

title: Supply Chain (SAP) Data Analyst
full description:
Job Overview

Job Title: Data Analyst - Supply Chain/Procurement

Location: Dublin or Cavan

Duration: Permanent

Salary: Negotiable
Role Summary:

Reporting to Head of Procurement and Supply Chain, the role is key to utilising the ERP system to its potential, within the Procurement and Supply chain environment. Working with various groupwide functions, the Procurement and Supply Chain Analyst leads the development of best-in-class Procurement function across the group.

You will lead the co-ordination, process management, reporting and quality management of all Procurement and Supply Chain processes.

The role offers a great opportunity to gain experience and exposure to our global Procurement function and processes, while working with a wide range of people and disciplines.

Primary Accountabilities:

Delivery SAP planning and forecasting processes which drive excellent procurement practices.
Own full SAP utilization of Procurement and Supply Chain processes, while driving continuous improvement in all areas, including planning, forecasting and inventory management.
Review, evaluate and recommend key planning attributes within SAP during the product lifecycle.
Introduce and own inventory management, reporting and analysis.
Represent plant Procurement team on the clients Master Data projects.
Procurement representative and lead on SAP role out teams throughout the group.
Assist with preparation of annual budgeting and ongoing tracking.
Maintain and own Procurement compliance Policy and control documents and procedures.
Lead ongoing data accuracy review with Procurement and Logistic teams, driving continuous improvement.
Assist in development of new reports to support the team.
Assist team in all areas of Procurement and Supply Chain when and where required.
Assist with development of and the monthly preparation of KPIs.

Qualifications\Requirements:

Experience working with Enterprise, Resourcing, and Planning (ERP) Systems - SAP a distinct advantage
At least 2 years minimum' experience working in a Procurement, Supply Chain and Inventory role.
Bachelor's degree in IT/business or equivalent preferred, with a proven ability for excellence in numeracy and strong attention to detail.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills & data expertise
A strong ability to make informed decisions through business intelligence & data gathered
Proven track record in SAP Procurement with an ability to introduce change.
Advanced understanding of Procurement and Supply chain SAP functionality.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively in a cross-functional environment
Energetic and flexible - capable to meet deadlines and ad-hoc requests. Strong interpersonal and leadership skills
Occasional Travel.

title: Sr. Product Analyst-M&A
full description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Products and Technology
Job Details
BT M&A Sr. Product Analyst
Grade 6


Business Technology is looking for an experienced M&A Sr. Product Analyst with an extensive background in building scalable and innovative solutions for Mergers & Acquisitions Go-to-Market Integration projects. This role will join the product group dedicated to supporting the M&A organization here at Salesforce. Our ideal candidate enjoys working in dynamic and high-growth environments and is experienced in managing complex projects in support of an overall M&A philosophy and strategy. This individual must have deep Salesforce platform and application experience, specifically in the area of Sales, Marketing, Quote to Cash, Finance, and Post-Sales functions.


Responsibilities
Conduct Fit-Gap Analysis, Risk/Impact analysis, document “As is” process documentation for the acquisition.
Define Future state business processes, product roadmap and strategy for the acquisition integration.
Gather requirements and create detailed functional specifications to deliver strong business value.
Prioritize, track, coordinate and communicate on M&A integration projects, issues and tasks with cross-functional stakeholders and the leadership team.
Work closely with Systems Specialists and Engineering Scrum teams to execute and deliver on project goals.
Build customer empathy through in-depth client interview and other market research techniques.
Support the implementation of change management activities.
Partner with the BT and support organizations to provide knowledge transfer, support and technical assistance to end users
Assists with backlog grooming of new enhancement requests.
Participate in Agile scrum team as the central subject matter expert.
Skills and Qualifications:
3+ years of similar experience in product management or a combination of product, engineering, and data roles.
Ability to quickly establish credibility and rapport with both business and technical professionals.
Excellent communication and presentation skills. Ability to craft and deliver messages at all levels of granularity, from executive pitches to functional architecture diagrams and implementation requirements.
Experience gathering customer-centric requirements and writing functional design specification documents
Superior analytical, interpersonal, and project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Preferred:
Salesforce certified professional.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations and drive actions

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

title: Reporting Analyst (Asset Management)
full description:
Exciting opportunities for experienced Reporting Analysts to support the business as it goes through a vast period of growth. We are currently recruiting for two dynamic individuals to join our team. The overarching goal is the development and production of high-quality management information to the Asset Management teams. We’re looking for experienced Reporting Analysts to help produce and implement data management, data quality, control and data standards across the function. To support both our internal colleagues and external client requirements. This role is ideal for someone who excels and enjoys working in a challenging and fast paced Asset management environment.
This role will be based at our Dublin office with some home working. Due to the current Pandemic this will initially be a home-based role.
What will you be doing?
Clean and check quality of data files received from third-party providers ready for database imports
Build checks required across different data sources to ensure consistency and completeness
Proactively drive third-party providers to improve data output, both in terms of quality and accuracy
Promote data governance and strive to continuously improve data quality including availability, usability, and consistency
Consult, influence and build relationships with all key internal and external contacts
Ad hoc analysis and reporting on the investment level including requests from the business and client
Modelling scenario analysis
Gain understanding of the portfolios and underlying assets
Provide a critical bridge between third-party providers, Asset Management teams and the client
Understand and prepare weekly and monthly performance reports to support business planning and day-to-day management of the portfolio
Maintain dialogue and work closely with Asset Management teams and the client, understanding and predicting requirements
Assist the development and implementation of effective and consistent systems, as required

Is this you?
Extensive knowledge of data quality issues, data transformations. Best practice in data manipulation and cleansing
Excellent understand of working in an Asset Management business and interpreting data.
Strong analytical skills and numeracy, with high levels of accuracy under pressure
Ability to understand complex data and present it in a clear and understandable way
Able to manage and organise large volumes of information, absorbs detail easily with strong, accurate recall
Ability to link different data sources and come up with an overall/overarching story
Proven ability to mine and manage large populations of data from multiple and diverse systems
Able to plan all action steps to conclude assignments on time
Structured approach to problem solving
Strong critical thinking skills, intuitively curious and an ability to diagnose data issues
Advanced MS Excel skills (Power Pivot, Power Query, VBA)
S Automation (SSRS, SSIS) and QL knowledge is desirable
Experience with data visualisation / reporting tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc)
Experience of dealing with senior management and stakeholders
Experience of working in a fast paced, changeable environment

Why Mars Capital?
Mars Capital puts the customer at the heart of everything we do by seeking to understand the circumstances of our borrowers and help them, using all reasonable means available, return to long term financial stability. Mars Capital is also part of the Arrow Global Group. Which is a leading European investor and asset manager in the non-performing and non-core assets sector. Operating in five different geographies and servicing over 9 million customer accounts. Our Purpose – building better financial futures.
We offer a competitive salary and attractive benefits package and we pride ourselves on rewarding success with our excellent bonus scheme and incentive package. We also have interactive subsidised events, colleague engagement teams, employee recognition and development programs and the opportunity to work collaboratively with multiple European countries.
Please note – we are an equal opportunities employer and CBI regulated company. We will conduct credit, fraud, criminal record and 5-year reference checks as part of our pre-employment screening.
(Strictly No Recruitment Agencies Please)

title: Junior IT Business Analyst
full description:
Organisational Environment:
Mercury is an Irish based European Contractor.
Mercury is a European Contractor that builds and manages complex engineering projects that reimagine how people work and live in the built environment. Our determination and focus enable us to deliver leading-edge construction solutions across a range of key sectors including Enterprise Data Centres, Advanced Technology & Life Sciences, Hyperscale Data Centres, Fire Protection, Technical Support Services (TSS), Data Centre Facility Management, Healthcare & Building Services. Mercury employs over 2,600 people across over 10 locations in Europe and had an overall turnover of €1bn in 2020. Mercury employs the best people, invests heavily in training and education and ensures that the highest standards of health, safety and governance are applied throughout the organisation.

Key Responsibilities of the Role:
Support the process of business change, improvement and efficiency by working with business leaders, process owners and relevant stakeholders to understand business requirements
Map end to end processes, highlighting business challenges and pain points
Review the performance of processes
Identify root cause problems of where processes breakdown
Identify opportunities for process improvement
Understand the intended outcome of proposed initiatives
Deploy problem-solving methodologies and tools to diagnose and solve operational problems
Perform analysis
Work with BA colleagues and relevant business stakeholders to identify solutions and assess them for technical and business suitability
Complete research on market to locate suitable products and solutions and present options to business stakeholders
Identify potential IT partners as needed
Elicit, define and document the requirements
Break complex business problems into clearly articulated requirements
Assist business stakeholders in prioritising the right business requirements
Under guidance, assist in the development of project documentation such as RFI, RFP, business case, UAT scripts creation etc
Participate in producing implementation plans including any infrastructure requirements, testing regime, UAT and training
Involvement in the support of full project life cycles
Scheduling of meetings and workshops
Participate in project review meetings
Document and collate project data including minute and actions taking as well as maintenance of any project related trackers and registers
Identify and advise on business and IT resources required to support any proposed projects
Assist in completion of QA and UAT planning and test cycles
Assist IT Adoption Analyst on change management aspects of project delivery and user awareness & provision of knowledge transfer
Assist post-process improvement benefit analysis
Present product / solution demonstrations to stakeholders
Validate solution meets needs and expectations of the business and stakeholders
Upon completion of a project, hand-off of project to relevant managers and business owners
Support senior analyst colleagues with the delivery of more complex projects
Software & Partner Contracts & Agreements
Assist in analysis of business needs for licencing requirements for new software and IT partners
Assist in renewal process through analysis of usage, assessment of business requirements and identifying suitable alternative options where suitable
Liaise with providers and/or partners to obtain appropriate quotations
Raise requisitions on ERP system to ensure IT partners are issued with PO for payment
Know the Business, Know the Industry
Build an in-depth knowledge of our business and forge strong working relationships across the full suite of departments, business units and sectors
Develop knowledge and understanding of technology trends and techniques
Attend relevant meetings and events (such as conferences, webinars and seminars)
Remain current on legislative changes which would impact the business
Develop strong understanding and appreciation of cyber security practices
Participate in cyber security initiatives lead by the team
Promote the role of the BA and Business Applications Team throughout the organisation
Support Group IT activities and strategy as required

Essential Criteria for the Role:
1-2 years’ experience in a similar business analysis role
A self-starter with the ability and experience in working independently with general supervision
Proven experience in development of documentation (such as business case, RFI, RFP)

Desirable Criteria:
Exposure to conducting UAT cycles an advantage
Effective time management skills, with the ability to work on multiple tasks simultaneously, prioritising tasks, shifting priorities, fluctuating workloads, deadline pressures
Good understanding of current technology trends and techniques, with an awareness & active interest in new & emerging technologies
Solid grasp of enterprise architecture, on-prem and cloud IT environments an advantage
Ability to think on your feet, work independently and also proactively with others to find solutions to issues
Excellent interpersonal skills, interacting appropriately with technical & business resources, driven but courteous
Creative thinking to deliver proposed solutions to meet new or changed business requirements
Willing to take ownership of tasks and driven to constantly go the extra mile to see them completed successfully

Mercury is an equal opportunities employer.

title: BI Developer
full description:

BI Developer, Azure, SSRS

We have an exciting opportunity to get involved in a great team with our client, a global Insurance company based in Dublin.
