title: FP&A Analyst
full description:
Company Description
ServiceNow is making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud‑based platform and solutions deliver digital workflows that create great experiences and unlock productivity for employees and the enterprise. We're growing fast, innovating faster, and making an impact on our customers' and employees' lives in significant and important ways. With over 6,900 customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2020 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies.®

We're looking for people who are ready to roll up their sleeves and help us build on our incredible momentum, our diverse, engaged workforce, and our purpose to make the world of work, work better.

Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.
Job Description
What you get to do in this role:
Contribute to the financial planning process, helping to develop the annual operating plan, budgeting and quarterly forecasting
Lead forecasting processes (monthly and quarterly forecasts, scenario modeling)
Partner with teams to manage headcount, Opex, and Capex forecasting
Work with partners and Accounting to track financial results
Analyze financial results and communicate messages to senior management optimizing our performance
Create analysis and presentations to help communicate strategic plans across the organization
Work with the Functional leads to provide management reporting, accounting and compliance guidance / understanding of global and local operational plans
Support our businesses with financial insights and development of performance metrics
Qualifications
To be successful in this role you have:
3+ years' experience
Curiosity beyond the "what" as to the "why"
Experience in Product FP&A, equity research, investment banking, or similar background that understands both financial and operational metrics
Financial modeling and reporting abilities
Excel and PowerPoint skills
Experience working in large datasets and identifying trends / anomalies against expectations
Experience with Anaplan, BPC, SAP, Business Objects, Tableau, or other BI tools preferred
FD21
Additional Information
ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at +1 (408) 501-8550, or [email protected] for assistance.
For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government.

title: Analytic & Insights Analyst
full description:
The role: Analytic & Insights Analyst
We are looking for a Lead Analytic & Insights Analyst to come be part of our ever growing & dynamic Marketing Effectiveness team in our Dublin office.
Are you our next star player?
This role reports into the Department Head of Marketing Effectiveness, serving as a senior member of the team who will relish ownership opportunities to work closely with the operational marketing teams to deliver insight and deliver the ‘why’ analysis.
Why we need you:
Your role will include:
Work with the Head of Department and team lead to deliver reporting & marketing efficiency measurement to the business
Application of data to areas such as A/B testing and return on investment analysis
Extracting and analysing very large and multi-dimensional data sets
Supporting the marketing evaluation team with access to and provision of data and analysis
Supporting the modelling team with data & insights as required, including data auditing, sense checking model outputs, providing business context, developing new analysis and visualisations to support the modelling efforts
Work with agency partners & internal partners to ensure that company standard is followed with regards request for & delivery of data and reporting on media asset delivery to enable analysis
Who we’re looking for:
Ideally have a Degree qualification in a quantitative (STEM) field with experience with SQL/Oracle, Excel, PPT and PowerBI (or equivalent data viz tool) It's an advantage to have exposure with data analysis application e.g. R, python, SAS, etc. a bonus. Knowledge of the online Poker / Casino / Sportsbook industries would be an asset.
Your experience:
Previous marketing analytics experiences are an advantage and working with media agencies
Will need technical & data literacy within a commercial environment
Have a love for BOTH data analytics and data science
Have an outstanding desire to build value from data and information
Ability to measure marketing and understand what drives business performance. Experience working with linear through to digital channels
Have experience of delivering MMM programs and marketing effectiveness measurement. Data modelling is an advantage.
Your behaviours:
Resilience: Resilient and confident under pressure, comfortable in dealing with ambiguity and running multiple simultaneous projects
Quality obsessed: gets it right first time and has an outstanding attention to detail
Partner management and influencing skills: comfortable operating at pace to a high standard, despite requiring the involvement of multiple partners across multiple countries to deliver results. Actively builds a network of effective relationships across Flutter. Can get things done both through formal channels and informal networks
Fast learner: Learns quickly when facing new situations. Experiments to find and craft new solutions. Pursue the challenge of unfamiliar tasks and extracts lessons learned from failures or mistakes
Comfortable both in detail and in stepping back to consider long term strategy
What’s in it for you?
Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus. And we provide advice and dedicated assistance to those moving to Dublin.
Your package will include:
health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address)
a personal interest allowance to let you learn something new or pursue a hobby
the option to join our company pension scheme
looking to extend your family? You will receive a cash gift of 1,000 EUR for your new addition whilst working for us
in-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career
free fresh fruit, snacks and drinks in the office
access to an onsite gym.
What happens next?
We will aim to get back to you as soon as possible. If you meet the criteria, we’ll contact you to arrange a Zoom interview.
The Group
PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange, which brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.
We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.
We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact: talent@starsgroup.com.

title: Financial Analyst
full description:
About the Company


Founded in 2016, Ekco is a global innovator in cloud solutions, working with customers and partners to deliver a comprehensive suite of end-to-end managed IT services via local teams located across a number of regional offices in the United Kingdom, Netherlands, and Ireland.


We help companies embrace the cloud revolution, transforming the way IT professionals operate by managing their systems and data securely. By leading their IT resilience, we guarantee peace of mind and the foundations to scale business with a fully managed support system.


Ekco is built on integrity and a personal approach with customers which offers a true partnership. Likewise, our team members enjoy a culture which promotes collaboration in a family friendly working environment, as well as supporting personal autonomy, self-development, and a commitment to our shared goal of delivering market leading IT services.


About the role


At Ekco our people and culture come first, second only to our customers! We have grown at a fast pace over the past year & are highly acquisitive. Due to our continued expansion in 2021 we are now searching for a talented Financial Analyst to join the finance team. As this role has been created from an internal promotion there will be a period of transition which will involve a structured on boarding plan to ensure the candidate is successfully integrated.

Job Duties / Requirements of Role
As a Financial Analyst, you will play a key role in
Producing and continually improving the monthly reporting packages that are issued to budget owners. You will drive reporting capabilities and process efficiencies across the group.
Preparation, communication and delivery of annual revenue and cost budgets.
Managing the revenue forecasts to ensure full year projections are accurate. This will involve liaison with sales functions to ensure closed deals are captured and fully considered from a margin standpoint.
Financial model design to support Senior Management in their commercial decision making.
Working with data source providers to ensure that key financial decision data is accurate, automated and delivered in a timely fashion.
Developing and maintaining operating metric reports that help Management understand business performance and resource utilisation.
Assist on M&A work across the Group including due diligence modelling requirements.

Key Skills and Qualifications

Qualified Accountant (or, in process of working towards an Accounting qualification)
Knowledge of close and consolidation process.
Demonstrable experience with emphasis on analysis, modelling and business partnership
Advanced in Excel
Experience with building complex and detailed financial models.
Proficient verbal and written communication skills.
Highly motivated self-starter with strong initiative and the ability to work independently.
Excellent interpersonal skills, and the ability to work well with partners at all levels of the organization.
Experience working in a high-growth SaaS environment (desirable, however not essential).
The ability to build strong and trusting relationships with Senior Management teams across the group.
Highly numerate, analytical, possess the ability to work to demanding and tight timescales


Ekco is an equal opportunities employer. For information on our Recruitment Privacy Policy, please refer to this link: https://www.ek.co/sites/default/files/content-files/Ekco%20Recruitment-Privacy-Notice.pdf

title: Manager Smart Factory Technology – Manufacturing Operations Solutions
full description:
Closing date for applications is 6th May 2021.
Manager Smart Factory Technology – Manufacturing Operations Solutions
Pfizer Digital Manufacturing is creating a Digital Hub at our Grange Castle manufacturing site, one of the largest integrated biopharmaceutical plants in the world. The Digital Hub will be the base for up to fifty talented colleagues from Analyst to Director level. These roles will be part of the broader Digital Manufacturing Team located globally. If you have experience in Manufacturing & Engineering digital solutions and application delivery in a GxP environment, you have an opportunity to join this digital hub.
The Digital Manufacturing Operations Solutions team supports the design, development, delivery and digitization of PGS Manufacturing and Engineering processes. Focus Areas (Systems) include: Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT), Enterprise Data Historians, Manufacturing Operations Solutions (Manufacturing Intelligence, EAMS Maintenance Mgmt & Calibration, Capital Mgmt, Permit to Work, OEE/RTE, Engineering systems) and Manufacturing Innovative Technologies.
The Digital Manufacturing Operations Solution Engineer will spearhead development of solutions that drive operational discipline with a focus on increasing process robustness, yield improvements & product quality, while increasing asset utilization and manufacturing attainment. An idea candidate will have a technical background with strong business process understanding across Manufacturing.
ABOUT THE ROLE
Solution Engineering for Digital Manufacturing Operations Solutions
Industry 4.0 solutions
Automated warehousing solutions
BIM – Building Information Modelling
Design and implement overall solution architecture and required infrastructure components
Ensure the entire stack is designed and built for speed and scalability
Ensure data architecture standards are designed up front
Provide Technical GxP process support, while ensuring all solutions are complaint from an Audit and Change Management perspective.
Development & Technical Resource Capacity Planning
Act as a thought leader on emerging digital technologies with a strong understanding of control systems/automation.
Release Planning and Impact Assessment
Design, Dev/Config, Testing
Own DevOps & Continuous Delivery Integration across all solutions
Deployment Hypercare Support with BTAMS
Vendor Support Escalation
Solution Archival Strategy & Performance Management
Technical Solution Roadmap & Governance
Disaster Recovery Planning & Testing
Collaborate with key stakeholders across PGS, Digital and Strategic Partners
Spearhead AR/VR business use case development. Research platforms
Evaluate and recommend related technologies, extensions and APIs for use cases.
Finalize the Manufacturing and CORE
Create and maintain MOS development and delivery guidelines to improve team efficiency and solution quality. (Unleash the power of our people)
ABOUT YOU
Bachelor’s BS in Information Technology, Engineering or related discipline.
Minimum 5 years project management experience
Strong presentation skills
Experience with Agile, (SAFe preferred)
Experience within Pharmaceutical Space
Background in control systems, automation and related technologies
Experience with Manufacturing & Engineering Solutions
Strong written and communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate to colleagues at all levels including executive levels
Ability to train colleagues on innovative technologies and experiences
Experience in all stages of solution delivery lifecycle from value analysis, business case development, solution deployment through value realization

title: Microbiology Analyst, Cell Therapy
full description:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’sPrivacy Noticeand Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.
Job Description
JOB PURPOSE:
The QC Microbiology Analyst is responsible for performing environmental monitoring (EM) and microbiological/analytical test methods on critical utilities, raw materials, in-process intermediates and varying stages of drug products under minimal supervision and within cGMP guidelines, to support manufacturing of Alofisel biologics product at Takeda Ireland Ltd, Grange Castle. The Microbiology laboratory is based in the P3 production building.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Timely facilitation of incoming sample receipt
Execute microbiological and/or analytical methods to facilitate in-process testing and final release testing such as Endotoxin, Mycoplasma, and Sterility supporting the release of Alofisel biologics product.
Execution of method validation/suitability
Perform environmental monitoring sampling and testing of facilities, equipment, and critical utilities supporting the manufacture of Alofisel biologics product.
Evaluate completed assay validity, calculate and summarize results, analyse data per expected or specification ranges.
Compilation and verification of trend analysis reports.
Monitoring and control of laboratory supply and critical reagent inventories.
Perform growth promotion of media and microbial identification testing.
Exhibit proactive communication upon occurrence of compliance risks and deviations from laboratory procedures; perform initiation of investigation records within required timeframes.
Provide input support to the progression of test method validation, investigations, technical studies, and method transfer protocols.
Perform other responsibilities as deemed necessary
Oversee aseptic practices (gowning, monitoring, cleaning and related training).
Develop and maintain excellent communication and collaboration between the Microbiology laboratory and operations.
Training of other microbiology analysts where necessary
Ensure that testing schedules are achieved and manage laboratory resources (instruments and personnel) to provide a comprehensive analytical service for testing of all samples.
Participate in the technical transfer / validation of microbiological testing procedures including Mycoplasma, Sterility testing and Endotoxin testing
Participate in root cause analyses (RCA) as part of investigations into any non-conformance, instrument malfunction, accident or other abnormal occurrence.
Ensure that any Out of Specification (OOS) or Out of Trend (OOT) analytical results are managed as per SOP.
Prepare and review documents as required.
Prepare for, and support, internal and external audits (e.g. HPRA, FDA, corporate).
Actively support projects, quality initiatives and continuous improvement programmes within the Quality department and in other functional areas.
Implement and maintain standards of safety to ensure a safe working laboratory. Ensure that the laboratory is kept clean, tidy and safe at all times.
GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Participate fully in any cross functional training initiatives.
Drive and promote the corporate values of Takeda-ism within the workplace.
Actively foster, in cooperation with other TIL staff, an ethos and culture of safety awareness where safety is accepted as an integral part of the overall business.
Ensure that Accident Reports / Near Miss Forms are completed in a timely manner after an event.
Ensure timely completion of all SOP, reading, training and assessment.
Other duties as required and directed by the relevant Manager or other Officer appointed by the Board of Directors.
EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
Degree in Microbiology or other relevant field.
RELEVANT EXPERIENCE:
 1 - 2 years’ experience working in Microbiology in the pharmaceutical industry, preferably in a Biologics company
Strong knowledge and practical experience in aseptic techniques and working in Grade A/B facility
Experience of microbiology testing including Sterility, endotoxin, mycoplasma and Environmental Monitoring
Knowledge of GMP and current FDA & EMEA regulations
Knowledge and experience of Lean Laboratories is preferable
SKILLS/COMPETENCIES:
Excellent organizational, communication, interpersonal and report writing skills
Good Microbiology knowledge
Ability to adapt to changing priorities
Ability to work independently and meeting established timelines.
Knowledge of cGMPs.
Successful track record in achieving goals as part of a team within a growing, dynamic environment
Demonstrated adaptability and flexibility to support a growing organisation.
Self-motivated and ability to work under pressure
###
Locations
Grange Castle, Ireland
Worker Type
Employee
Worker Sub-Type
Regular
Time Type
Full time

title: Junior IT Business Analyst
full description:
Organisational Environment:
Mercury is an Irish based European Contractor.
Mercury is a European Contractor that builds and manages complex engineering projects that reimagine how people work and live in the built environment. Our determination and focus enable us to deliver leading-edge construction solutions across a range of key sectors including Enterprise Data Centres, Advanced Technology & Life Sciences, Hyperscale Data Centres, Fire Protection, Technical Support Services (TSS), Data Centre Facility Management, Healthcare & Building Services. Mercury employs over 2,600 people across over 10 locations in Europe and had an overall turnover of €1bn in 2020. Mercury employs the best people, invests heavily in training and education and ensures that the highest standards of health, safety and governance are applied throughout the organisation.

Key Responsibilities of the Role:
Support the process of business change, improvement and efficiency by working with business leaders, process owners and relevant stakeholders to understand business requirements
Map end to end processes, highlighting business challenges and pain points
Review the performance of processes
Identify root cause problems of where processes breakdown
Identify opportunities for process improvement
Understand the intended outcome of proposed initiatives
Deploy problem-solving methodologies and tools to diagnose and solve operational problems
Perform analysis
Work with BA colleagues and relevant business stakeholders to identify solutions and assess them for technical and business suitability
Complete research on market to locate suitable products and solutions and present options to business stakeholders
Identify potential IT partners as needed
Elicit, define and document the requirements
Break complex business problems into clearly articulated requirements
Assist business stakeholders in prioritising the right business requirements
Under guidance, assist in the development of project documentation such as RFI, RFP, business case, UAT scripts creation etc
Participate in producing implementation plans including any infrastructure requirements, testing regime, UAT and training
Involvement in the support of full project life cycles
Scheduling of meetings and workshops
Participate in project review meetings
Document and collate project data including minute and actions taking as well as maintenance of any project related trackers and registers
Identify and advise on business and IT resources required to support any proposed projects
Assist in completion of QA and UAT planning and test cycles
Assist IT Adoption Analyst on change management aspects of project delivery and user awareness & provision of knowledge transfer
Assist post-process improvement benefit analysis
Present product / solution demonstrations to stakeholders
Validate solution meets needs and expectations of the business and stakeholders
Upon completion of a project, hand-off of project to relevant managers and business owners
Support senior analyst colleagues with the delivery of more complex projects
Software & Partner Contracts & Agreements
Assist in analysis of business needs for licencing requirements for new software and IT partners
Assist in renewal process through analysis of usage, assessment of business requirements and identifying suitable alternative options where suitable
Liaise with providers and/or partners to obtain appropriate quotations
Raise requisitions on ERP system to ensure IT partners are issued with PO for payment
Know the Business, Know the Industry
Build an in-depth knowledge of our business and forge strong working relationships across the full suite of departments, business units and sectors
Develop knowledge and understanding of technology trends and techniques
Attend relevant meetings and events (such as conferences, webinars and seminars)
Remain current on legislative changes which would impact the business
Develop strong understanding and appreciation of cyber security practices
Participate in cyber security initiatives lead by the team
Promote the role of the BA and Business Applications Team throughout the organisation
Support Group IT activities and strategy as required

Essential Criteria for the Role:
1-2 years’ experience in a similar business analysis role
A self-starter with the ability and experience in working independently with general supervision
Proven experience in development of documentation (such as business case, RFI, RFP)

Desirable Criteria:
Exposure to conducting UAT cycles an advantage
Effective time management skills, with the ability to work on multiple tasks simultaneously, prioritising tasks, shifting priorities, fluctuating workloads, deadline pressures
Good understanding of current technology trends and techniques, with an awareness & active interest in new & emerging technologies
Solid grasp of enterprise architecture, on-prem and cloud IT environments an advantage
Ability to think on your feet, work independently and also proactively with others to find solutions to issues
Excellent interpersonal skills, interacting appropriately with technical & business resources, driven but courteous
Creative thinking to deliver proposed solutions to meet new or changed business requirements
Willing to take ownership of tasks and driven to constantly go the extra mile to see them completed successfully

Mercury is an equal opportunities employer.

title: Total Rewards Analyst
full description:
Description
Your Role:
Responsible for the planning, design, implementation and administration activities related to compensation & benefit plans and programs in company locations around the world. Provide leadership and internal client support for a variety of global compensation and benefits programs.
Your Opportunity:
Design, implement, communicate and administer global compensation and benefit programs that attract and retain high-performing talent and that are fair, equitable, competitive, and cost effective

title: CRM Data Analyst
full description:
Ryanair is Europe’s favourite airline, carrying over 116m p.a. on more than 1,800 daily flights from 84 bases, connecting 200 destinations in 31 countries on a fleet of 330 Boeing 737 aircraft, with a further 350 Boeing 737’s on order, which will enable Ryanair to lower fares and grow traffic to 180m p.a. by FY24. Ryanair has a team of more than 10,000 highly skilled aviation professionals delivering Europe’s No.1 on-time performance, and has an industry leading 31-year safety record.
Travel Labs is a state of-the-art digital & IT innovation hub based in Dublin, Wroclaw and Madrid, creating Europe’s Leading Travel Experience for customers.
The Role
This role is critical for the business to help understand the behavior of our customers through converting the data produced into insight and communicating it to senior stakeholders across Ryanair.

Your responsibilities as a CRM Data Analyst will include
Understand the key metrics that the CRM and Marketing team generate and support the delivery of reporting and performance analysis.
Work with the CRM, marketing and technical teams (BI, Data Science, Marketing Ops) to develop measurement frameworks, metrics and models to drive business performance.
Reporting directly to the CRM Manager, and supporting Data Analyst Lead, CRM and marketing managers, and other stakeholders with ad-hoc data analysis requests.
Query datasets from different sources, turn data into information, information into insight and insight into customer and business recommendations.
Develop quantitative analysis to drive business decisions and strategy within CRM and marketing.
Provide analytical support for day-to-day insight queries and help the CRM and marketing team become more data literate.
Build dashboards and ongoing reports.
Requirements
3+ years of experience in a CRM analytics role
A/B testing experience is required
Experience with large datasets and proficient in using SQL to derive insights
Experienced in using visualisation tools to produce insightful charts that support insight narrative
Ability to scale and automate insights through reports and dashboards (e.g. PowerBI/Tableau)
Experience with Python and/or R is a plus.
Knowledge on data structure and data set management in Google Cloud Platform is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in English is a must.
Ability to relay technical knowledge to stakeholders with various levels of technical knowledge
Attention to detail and good time management and prioritisation skills a must
Qualifications:
Bachelor or Masters degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or equivalent work experience.
Benefits
Competitive salary and airline benefits.

title: Lead Analytic & Insights Analyst
full description:
The role: Lead Analytic & Insights Analyst
We are looking for a Lead Analytic & Insights Analyst to join our lively & dynamic Marketing Effectiveness team in our Dublin office.
Are you our next star player?
The role reports into the Department Head of Marketing Effectiveness, serving as a senior member of the team who is responsible for working closely with the operational marketing teams to deliver insight and deliver the ‘why’ analysis.
Why we need you:
Your role will include:
Work with the Head of Department and the Marketing/Channel Heads to plan and execute optimum strategies consistent with the brands wider commercial and marketing activities
Lead the team’s timelines, projects, presentations and research, presenting these to each department with the view to seeking to alignment and optimisation with all internal partners as well as establishing new ways of working in order to achieve the brand outcomes and vision most efficiently
Work with SLT, marketing, verticals and channels to produce efficient reports which are data led and which establish measurement frameworks against our objectives.
Where required take ownership for overseeing critical metrics for the teams and reporting on these to other departments.
Project Management of any other tasks related to market planning. Align with partners to ensure we get to a firm outcome that delivers business ambition within deadline for these tasks
Who we’re looking for:
Have an excellent grasp of Marketing funnel metrics and how to influence them. Working knowledge of budget allocation and the fundamentals to investment planning. Be flexible, pro-active and an ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment
Your experience:
Previous marketing and planning experiences are required. The ideal candidate will possess teammate qualities with the ability to cultivate good working relationships.
Will need technical & data literacy within a commercial environment
Have a love for BOTH data analytics and data science
Have an outstanding desire to build value from data and information
Ability to measure marketing and understand what drives business performance. Experience working with linear through to digital channels
Have experience of delivering MMM programs and marketing efficiency measurement
Your behaviours:
Resilience: Resilient and confident under pressure, comfortable in dealing with ambiguity and running multiple simultaneous projects
Quality obsessed: gets it right first time
Partner management and influencing skills: comfortable operating at pace to a high standard, despite requiring the involvement of multiple partners across multiple countries to deliver results. Actively builds a network of effective relationships across Flutter. Can get things done both through formal channels and informal networks
Fast learner: Learns quickly when facing new situations. Experiments to find new solutions. Encourages the challenge of unfamiliar tasks and extracts lessons learned from failures or mistakes
Comfortable both in detail and in stepping back to consider long term strategy
What’s in it for you?
Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus. And we provide advice and dedicated assistance to those moving to Dublin.
Your package will include:
health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address)
a personal interest allowance to let you learn something new or pursue a hobby
the option to join our company pension scheme
looking to extend your family? You will receive a cash gift of 1,000 EUR for your new addition whilst working for us
in-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career
free fresh fruit, snacks and drinks in the office
access to an onsite gym.
What happens next?
We will aim to get back to you as soon as possible. If you meet the criteria, we’ll contact you to arrange a Zoom interview.
The Group
PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange, which brings together outstanding brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.
We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.
We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact: talent@starsgroup.com.
Please note we cannot accept general applications; this inbox is just for providing support to those who need it.

title: Sr. Financial Analyst
full description:
BA/BS degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Engineering or similar discipline with analytical bias
3+ years of relevant experience in positions that require analysis and reporting financial results
Demonstrated financial acumen and analytical experience delivering forecasting, budgeting, and variance analysis, and data interpretation of business impact and results
Strong technical background including Excel, Cognos, SQL, Essbase, and Oracle
Fluent in English

Finance is all about the numbers…unless you work at Amazon; it’s knowing the numbers and so much more. Enthusiasm helps us deliver new ideas, and solutions. Do you view problems as treasures, and are you willing to dive deep to develop those solutions and deliver results? Will you seek to challenge the status quo, and accept that your ideas and mechanisms may be tested daily? At Amazon, we move with purpose and speed, and this requires we work with a dynamic network of Operations, HR, Tech and Retail partners. Our Financial Analysts work with multiple sites, they help others understand financial decisions and are *the* trusted business advisor. They employ every facet of data and communication to ensure our partners and our leaders have the most up to date and reliable information to help them make the best possible decision. Come teach us a few things, and we’ll teach you a few things as we navigate the most customer-centric company on Earth.

This is a perfect position for someone who knows how to work fast and smart. You will also provide the business with big leadership bringing a deep knowledge and a proven record of accomplishment. You already know how to make sense between which details that make all the difference, and those that don’t add value. You know the difference between investing wisely, and money wasted.

Job Responsibilities include:

Manage the financial control of Global Special Fulfillment (GSF) operation across several locations in multiple countries
Produce all FC financial operational metrics and work with data source providers and technology teams to ensure that key decision data is accurate, automated and timely
Recommend, develop, and implement policies and programs that guide the organization in maintaining and improving its competitive position and profitability
Partner with your team and develop all weekly and monthly financial close activities, all planning, forecasting, and reporting models while overseeing their continuous innovation and communication to both your operations & other business partners

Key Characteristics:

Proven expertise evaluating, analyzing quickly and creating meaningful business reporting
Proven ability to develop strategic relationships with your finance and business partners – you influence the decisions. You can root cause issues quickly and uncover core issues using data, then assist, consult with, and teach the teams how decisions affect efficiency, scalability, costs and create new mechanisms as they are needed
Proven ability to deal with ambiguity & provide level-headed guidance during unexpected events
MBA and/or Professional certification (CPA/CMA/Qualified Accounting certificate) + relevant experience
Strong operational business understanding, including potential impact of business decisions on various internal/external stakeholders
Ability to meet deadlines while managing multiple projects in a fast paced environment
Highly analytical, detail oriented and strong business sense; proven ability to manage new ideas and creative solutions
Manage and prioritize workload and achieve effective results in a fast-paced, growing and ambiguous environment
Previous experience within a Manufacturing, Distribution Center or Logistics processes and systems a plus
Career progression and willingness to relocate for advancement opportunities

title: Sr Analyst Deal Desk and Deal Strategy
full description:
Sr Analyst Deal Desk and Deal Strategy
Finance | Dublin, Ireland

Our agreement with employees
DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what's right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you'll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.

The team

Our Finance team plays a critical role in ensuring accurate financial reporting, optimal financial management, and efficient operations across DocuSign. The team consists of Accounting, Financial Planning & Analysis, Revenue Operations, Investor Relations, and Business Operations. The Finance team partners across all organizations in DocuSign to appropriately allocate resources, inform key business decisions, and facilitate the execution of our operational plans.

This position
The Senior Analyst Deal Desk and Deal Strategy position plays a crucial role in supporting the company's growth in EMEA. More specifically, this role will assist the EMEA SMB team with their complex and/or high value deals. This role may also assist Deal Desk Managers in deal approvals or deal structuring across other sales functions. This entry level role represents a tremendous growth opportunity for individuals seeking to build a career in the SAAS space and have an interest in understanding the operations behind Sales, Sales Strategy, Revenue Operations, Pricing Strategy and Legal. This position supports the Deal Desk Senior Manager and the Sr Director of Business Practices by performing data analysis, pricing analyses, approval analyses and assisting in the development of sales deal training materials. This role enables one to have the understanding and background to move into a variety of other roles including Deal Desk, Rev Ops, or Sales Operations

This position reports to the Senior Manager of Deal Desk – EMEA

Responsibilities

Conduct deal approval analyses and provide recommendations for improvement
Conduct pricing or deal analyses for complex strategic deals
Develop complex data analyses in Excel
Assist Deal Desk managers in deal review and approvals
Coach and enable sales on deal strategy

Basic Qualifications
4 year university degree required
Strong analytical background with strong problem-solving skills
Experience in Excel
Knowledge of Salesforce systems and building reports and dashboards
Highly effective communication skills
Ability to build relationships and work collaboratively to drive results
Must be detail oriented

Preferred Qualifications
Previous analyst or consulting experience
Previous SAAS experience in an operational or data analyst role
Bilingual proficiency will be considered a plus

About us
DocuSign® helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, hundreds of thousands of customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. Plus, we save more trees together! And that's a good thing.

DocuSign is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the discussion and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.

title: Senior Analyst (CRU)
Vice President, Cyber Risk
full description:
Our professionals balance analytical skills, deep market insight and independence to deliver solid, defensible analysis and practical advice to our clients. As an organization, we think globally. We create transparency in an opaque world, and we encourage our people to do the same. That means when you take your place on our team, you’ll discover a supportive and collaborative work environment that empowers you to excel. If you’re ready to share your perspective with the world, then you can make a real impact here. This is the Duff & Phelps difference.

Kroll is the leading global provider of risk solutions. For more than 45 years, Kroll has helped clients make confident risk management decisions about people, assets, operations and security through a wide range of investigations, cyber security, due diligence and compliance, physical and operational security and data and information management services.

Kroll is a division of Duff & Phelps, a global advisor with nearly 3,500 professionals in 28 countries around the world. Our clients include publicly traded and privately held companies, law firms, government entities and investment organizations such as private equity firms and hedge funds. We also advise the world’s leading standard-setting bodies on valuation and governance best practices.

At Duff & Phelps, your work will help protect, restore and maximize value for our clients. Join us and together we’ll maximize the value of your career.

Manage European e-discovery cases and build e-discovery process flows.
Subject Matter Expert for e-discovery search and review. Train additional reviewers as required.
Support the Regional Managing Director (Cyber Risk) through additional process definition, case management, and billing.
Making sure all client expectations are met within the deadlines with high quality and efficiency.

Experience within leading complex and varied e-discovery cases.
Previous experience in managing a team of analysts and investigators.
Strong knowledge of legal review processes in support of litigation.
High degree of personal and team organisation.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills that help represent diverse communities.
Experience working with diverse teams.

In order to be considered for a position at Duff & Phelps, you must formally apply via careers.duffandphelps.jobs
Duff & Phelps is committed to equal opportunity and diversity, and recruits people based on merit.

title: Product Insights Analyst
full description:
Ryanair Labs is a state of-the-art digital & IT innovation hub based in Dublin and Wroclaw, creating Europe’s Leading Travel Experience for customers. As a result of our continued expansion, we are opening an new office in the heart of Madrid City Centre and we want to hear from the best IT developers Madrid has to offer to join our Travel Labs.
The Role
This role is critical for the business to help understand the behavior of our customers through converting the data produced into insight and communicating it to senior stakeholders across Ryanair.

Your responsibilities as a Product Data Analyst will include
Understand the key metrics that the Product team generate and support the delivery of reporting and performance analysis.
Work with Product team and technical teams (IT, BI, Data Science) to develop measurement frameworks, metrics and models.
Reporting directly to the Head of Product, and supporting Product Owners, and other stakeholders with ad-hoc data analysis requests.
Through data mining and in-depth analysis, formulate and implement hypotheses and recommendations that will improve the product experience for our customers.
Develop quantitative analysis, KPIs, and reports to drive product and business decisions and strategy.
Provide analytical support for day-to-day product related queries and help the product team become more data literate.
Requirements
3+ years of experience in a CRM analytics role
A/B testing experience is required
Experience with large datasets and proficient in using SQL to derive insights
Experienced in using visualisation tools to produce insightful charts that support insight narrative
Ability to scale and automate insights through reports and dashboards (e.g. PowerBI/Tableau)
Experience with Python and/or R is a plus.
Knowledge on data structure and data set management in Google Cloud Platform is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in English is a must.
Ability to relay technical knowledge to stakeholders with various levels of technical knowledge
Attention to detail and good time management and prioritisation skills a must
Qualifications:
Bachelor or Masters degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or equivalent work experience.
Benefits
Competitive salary
Flight ticket discount
Fresh workplace environment

title: Senior Software Engineer .NET
full description:
Job Posting End Date: May 27
Unum Carlow is an ambitious, innovative Technology Centre working as a global team to drive digital transformation. Unum is one of the world's leading employee benefits providers, helping millions of people gain affordable access to benefits that help them protect their families, their finances and their futures.
Are you an asker of questions, a solver of problems, and a challenger of the status quo? Our mission is to provide a differentiated customer experience and exceed the expectations people have of technology at any company — not just insurers.
We are seeking individuals to join our team of talented IT professionals who share never-ending passion and an unwavering focus on our customer experience. Team members comfortable working in an agile, fast-paced, and delivery-focused environment thrive in our environment where we value an entrepreneurial spirit and those who challenge the status-quo.
Unum is changing, and we’re excited about what’s next. Join us.
General Summary:
The Senior Software Engineer is responsible for all design creation, implementation, and review in the development team and at a consultancy level with various business areas. This is a hands on role where the individual with be an equal contributor on the team being assigned work through agile stories. The successful candidate will have over 10 years industry experience, ideally distributed across multiple companies thus bringing new ideas to the team. This will be a person that likes to dig into the code, find ways to make improvements, think proactively and not reactively. The work will be a combination of greenfield work, enhancements to existing systems, troubleshooting, design, architecture, prototyping, mentoring and most importantly getting the work done to a very high standard. Having experience working with distributed enterprise systems will certainly be an advantage but if you have a strong aptitude for code and logic you will be able to navigate the complex map of systems. The team love to hear new ideas, especially when they can be turned into solutions that save time and bring efficiency. This software engineer should ideally have full stack skills, but the greater emphasis will be on the serverside including DB & API modeling. The candidate must have advanced knowledge of Git and Azure DevOps build and release pipelines.
The role will be a challenge for any senior seasoned developer but there is lots to learn and lots to teach the team if you are the right person.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities
This team is responsible for delivering a wide range of new Solutions that will transform the way Unum does business with its customers. Solutions covering Intranet, Extranet, Internet systems as well as REST API design and ETL as part of a middleware stack. Given the nature of the business; security and data integrity are core to everything we do.
The team build, test, deploy and support all our own applications to the highest standard and there is a strong focus on automation and continuous improvement.
Core Duties and Responsibilities of the role also include the following:
Provides technical leadership and direction for all solutions delivered
Contributes to architecture roadmap for business area through leading and participating in Proof of Concept (POC)/prototyping initiatives
Provides ongoing and appropriate mentorship for Software Engineers
Plays an active role in improving collaboration between business and IT
Responsible for application solution quality from design and implementation to deploy and run. Participates in definition and maintenance of software standards
Responsible for the design, implementation, and maintenance of new and existing solutions for the existing portfolio of applications for a business area
Responsible for communication and collaboration with key stakeholders in the delivery of solutions
Design, codes, unit tests, maintains, and documents software deliverables using agreed upon standards, patterns, and tools
Participates in sizing and estimation activities within the agile team
Communicates daily team manager and the Agile team on progress made and planned progress for the coming day and reports any impediments that are blocking their progress
Participates in code reviews and sprint retrospectives; ensuring their ideas for team continuous improvement are communicated so that the overall process and team can improve sprint by sprint and readily receives feedback for self-improvement
Focuses on always delivering business priority and value
Demonstrates an interest in software architectures and seeks to design solutions in alignment with Company stated architecture and standards
Participate in Proof of Concept work and prototyping when necessary
Collaborates with Business Analysts to confirm understanding of business requirements relating to solutions to be delivered and to help the Business Analyst define requirements that can be delivered from a technical perspective
Collaborates with User Experience (UX) designers to ensure designs produced can be translated efficiently into working solutions for feature delivery
Collaborate with Test Engineers as to ensure that software meets the definition of done, ensuring successful transition of work to the next stage of production during the sprints
Ensures an innovation culture in the team by continuous improvement of deliveries and participates in evaluating new processes and technologies that can be applied to future solution delivery
Always thinks with the mind of the end customer, ensuring solutions seek to improve the customer experience and drive efficiency by reducing manual touch points
Job Specifications
 Must Have (core skills that will be focused on as part of daily job)
Computer Science or equivalent Engineering Degree or higher is a must
Over 10 years industry experience as a software developer covering, design, architecture, Db modelling, unit testing, utilization of design patterns, ORM.
The stack is .NET based so advanced knowledge of ASP.NET MVC and Web API in .net framework and CORE is an essential.
On the DB side RDBMS including SQL Server/ Aurora.
Industry experience with setup/configuration of Azure DevOps including GIT and build & release pipelines and Octopus Deploy, these are essential to daily activities on the team.
Ability to illustrate designs through sequence flow diagrams, ERD, physical and logical architecture design, UML or other modelling practices are essential for the role
Web Server – experience with IIS
LAN and Network Topology understanding (DNS, FW, Load Balancing, DMZ, Gateways)
Takes a logical, analytical approach to problem solving and pays close attention to detail
Knowledge of Agile development/methodologies
Self-motivated and results oriented; able to motivate others
Takes an innovative approach to problem solving
Demonstrates strong focus on quality delivery and delighting customers; holds self to high standards of delivery
Demonstrates excellent oral and written communication skills, experience leading groups of people through discussions, technical or otherwise
Strong team player; able to lead and work effectively within a team and more broadly with people from a variety of backgrounds and areas across the organization.
Nice to Have (additional skills that can be applied on certain projects)
Front end knowledge of frameworks like Angular, REACT, NodeJS etc. would be an advantage.
Commercial experience with XAAS using AWS covering Docker, Kubernetes, Lambda, Cloud Formation Scripts, Containers, and other AWS components including cloud security would be an advantage.
NoSQL DB such as MongoDB/DynamoDB
Unum and its family of businesses offer competitive pay and an excellent benefits package, world-class training and development, and a culture built on employee ideas. Unum is an equal opportunity employer, considering all qualified applicants and employees for hiring, placement, and advancement, without regard to person’s race, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status, family status, membership of the travelling community, gender or sexual orientation. Come join us if you’re interested in working in an exciting and challenging environment for a company that is on the move!
Company:
Unum

title: HRIS Manager
full description:
As the HRIS Manager, you will manage a team of HRIS analysts with a focus on ensuring high quality customer service is provided. You will drive optimal system usage through best practices, training, and system functionality.
Adopting a strategic approach, you will solve business and customer problems while looking globally at the business and HR needs, as well as at IT capabilities and constraints. Adapting to changing priorities, you will build effective and credible working relationships with senior management, and HR customers and partners.
With the autonomy to explore your curiosity, you will learn new software and technology, seeking and actively learning new skills, keeping up to date with new requirements and functionalities.
Understanding customer requirements and pain points will be your passion, providing thought leadership to ensure a world class user experience.
Your Role
Support the use of Workday including HCM Workflows, Self Service, Compensation, Talent Management, Absence, and Reporting & Analytics.
Supervise Workday global HRIS analysts.
Oversee system maintenance activities, with a focus on continuous improvement and uptake of new functionality.
Identify organization change management needs for ongoing user training and engagement. Implement tools to meet change management and training needs including tool kits and job aids.
Identify and execute on continuous improvement to HCM based on new functionality, business needs, and user feedback.
Partner with COEs on system functionality, configuration and documentation.
Maintain master data governance. Assess and validate data quality through reporting and routine data certification programs.
Develop and govern policies, procedures and standards relating to database management.
Collaborate with other functional areas and external vendors to identify process improvements, systems enhancements and issue resolutions.
Report global Workday metrics on a regular schedule and provide insight on health of system usage.
Your Background
Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Information Systems, Business Administration or a related field
Management experience in related environment and knowledge of Workday or other SaaS HRIS systems.
Strong understanding of system design, structure, and administration; system configuration and workflow; user interface design.
Experience with various Human Resources processes, particularly in the areas of payroll, talent acquisition, performance management and compliance.
Proficient in Microsoft Office products.
Extensive knowledge in Microsoft Excel; familiar with advanced functionality such as complex formulas, pivot tables, vlookups, etc.
Production Support experience using incident management system
Aptiv Rewards & Advantages
Competitive compensation package including; Bonus Potential, Healthcare, Pension & TaxSaver schemes.
Learning, professional growth and development in a world recognized international environment.
Access to internal & external training, coaching & certifications.
Recognition for innovation and excellence.
Opportunities to give back to the community.
Meaningful work that makes a difference in the world
Some see differences. We see perspectives that make us stronger.
Diversity and Inclusion are sources of innovation and creativity, both of which are essential to Aptiv’s success. Everyday our diverse team comes together, drives innovation, pursues solutions, and meets challenges using their unique abilities, perspectives and talents, changing what tomorrow brings. When you join our team, you’ll get encouraged to think boldly, express your viewpoint and innovate as a matter of habit.
Some See Technology. We See a Way to Make Connections.
At Aptiv, we don’t just see the world differently; we work to change reality. That means developing technology that rewrites the rules of what’s possible in the pursuit of making transportation safer, greener and more connected. Today there are more than 180,000 of us globally, located in 44 countries, and united by one mission. Join the movement and together, let’s change tomorrow.
#LI-SL1

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Senior Total Rewards Analyst
full description:
Because you belong at Twilio.

The Who, What, Why and Where

Twilio is growing rapidly and is seeking a Senior Total Rewards Analyst to be a data driven, process aware, subject matter expert of all things related to compensation and benefits. This role will join our Total Rewards team and be responsible for contributing to the successful administration of our compensation and benefits policies and programs. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Total Rewards EMEA and APJ, this position will be critical to ensure that Twilio remains competitive in the continuously evolving tech environment.


Who?

Twilio is looking for an analyst who lives the Twilio Magic and has a demonstrated ability to quickly analyze large amounts of data, synthesizing findings in easy to understand concepts and presentations.

5+ years of reward experience across multiple locations, ideally in a rapid growth technology company
Working knowledge of job evaluation or job grading methodologies and career architecture frameworks
Knowledge of Radford or other published surveys
Adept at understanding and interpreting data so that data is transformed to workable insights
Able to educate and influence senior business stakeholders with Reward advice to ensure an attractive and consistent offering across multiple job families and locations
Knowledge of end-to-end processes for implementing and renewing benefits such as Private Medical Insurance, Life assurance etc
Must be attentive to detail and able to juggle many tasks at once
Must be a self starter with plenty of initiative yet understands the need to work within wider Total Reward frameworks
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Working knowledge of equity for a public company
Workday experience is preferred
Excel master
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required
CCP qualification or equivalent experience


What?

As a Senior Total Rewards Analyst, you will you will live the Twilio Magic values:

WRITE IT DOWN: Analyze market data and create compensation ranges and refresh as needed; includes monthly equity exhibit and Job evaluation
DRAW THE OWL: Identify market trends with comparisons against various internal analytics
BE AN OWNER & BE BOLD: Provide consultative recommendations on promotions and offers
EMPOWER OTHERS: Interact across functional teams for Compensation planning and administration through Workday
NO SHENANIGANS: Ensure the consistent exercise of appropriate judgment and discretion in evaluating requests


Why?

The Total Rewards team is central to Twilio's relevancy as employer of choice. In leading all aspects of identifying, evaluating, and analyzing our compensation programs, we want to ensure that we attract, reward, and retain the best and brightest Twilions and future Twilions.

Twilio is a company that is empowering the world's developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.


Where?

This position will be based in Dublin, Ireland. We employ diverse talent from all over the world and we believe great work can be done anywhere. Around the world, Twilio offers benefits and perks to support the physical, financial, and emotional well being of you and your loved ones. No matter where you are based, you will experience a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; seeks well-rounded talent to ensure a full perspective on our customers' experience, understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture that empowers everyone to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.


About us:

Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world's communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world's largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.

title: Web Developer (Marketing Platforms)

Responsible for frontend code and building web/app features.Directly support our marketing team and help deliver success in conjunction with the website manager, email marketing specialist, CRO specialist and data analyst, by implementing practical solutions to marketing initiatives.Work with stakeholders throughout all areas of the business to determine new feature requirements, produce visuals with the design team, develop frontend code, integrate into the application, test and deploy.Work with the rest of the IT and development team to produce new advanced functionality and integrate with third-party tools.Help implement and work with enterprise marketing tools such as Intercom, Marketo, Optimizely and more.Job DescriptionDigital Marketing Institute is hiring a Web Developer for our IT team in Blackrock, Dublin. title: Senior D365 Business Analyst
full description:
We are looking for a Senior D365 Business Analyst to join our company.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a long and established and successful company, operating in a rapidly growing market.

You will work with key business stakeholders cross several industries to define and document business processes and requirements. What’s in it for you?

Work with great people in a fun, entrepreneurial, rewarding environment, delivering cutting edge solutions, where employees are not only provided with competitive compensation and benefits, but are also recognized for their outstanding character,integrity, excellence and results.

Responsibilities

Assist the business teams in modelling as-is & to-be processes and in identifying issues and opportunities for improvement
Work with Business owners, the Business Analyst Team and technical IT Development teams to understand fully the business requirement and document accordingly.
Liaise with business owners, business analysts and the development team to resolve functional and non-functional questions arising from the requirements
Play a part in User Acceptance Testing, Regression testing and post Go-Live testing.
Manage and measure solution benefits mapped to the business case
Ensure systems and changes are smoothly transitioned into operation including, supporting documentation and required user training


Essential Experience

High level understanding of technical concepts – including data modelling
Experience in preparing and conducting business analysis workshops
Management of the full life cycle of a project and multi-disciplinary teams
Very good working knowledge of the Microsoft business systems stack, specifically Dynamics CRM, Dynamics ERP and SharePoint.


Desired Experience

Ideally the successful candidate will have some or all of the following:
Qualification in Computer Science/Business Information Systems, or a comparable qualification with the corresponding professional experience.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies.


Skills/ Behavioral Competencies

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills.
Results focused; competitive drive and ability to work under pressure
Ability to prioritise and multi-task within the role.

title: Senior Commissioning Manager
full description:
Senior Commissioning Manager - (161356)
Description

About Us

At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.

We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward.

HDR and HDR | Andrew Reid specializes in bringing buildings to life by following a robust and thorough commissioning process which is recognized as best practice across the globe. Whether managing or validating the commissioning work, the core process is consistent and remains at all times transparent and auditable to clients.

We are currently seeking a Senior Commissioning Manager to join our team in Dublin, Ireland. HDR focuses on a variety of building types ranging from healthcare, science, technology, workplace and civic facilities.

Typical Duties
Managing the entire building commissioning process.
Developing commissioning plans, schedules, reports, checklists, and test scripts.
Development and third party by into project certification strategies.
Recording of detailed progress pre-requisites.
Routine population and management of data in our project management software.
Undertaking and reporting of inspections and tests.
Assisting in the development of design and commissioning documentation for tender and construction purposes.
Attending project and internal meetings as needed.
Being able to look ahead with a view of arranging test instrumentation.
Assisting in the development of tender submissions.
Supporting projects during client discussions of a technical nature.
Reviewing technical papers/reports before publication.
Working closely as part of a general contractor’s team in developing commissioning strategies and processes which align fully with project objectives.
Undertaking technical assessments of project schedules, drawings, manuals and technical submittals.
Managing detailed recording of meetings.
Providing routine progress reporting and final project close out report.
Managing attendance and reporting of factory tests.
Arranging third party sign off as necessary.
Providing technical advice to clients in respect of project and operational risk.

Primary Responsibilities
Providing professional delivery of the project in full accordance with our appointment to include technical and commercial compliance.
Being able to commercially manage project change.
Accountability for the quality of service, delivery and management of client expectations.
Responsibility for project related safety as it relates to our work.
Providing positive and effective management by setting an appropriate example to other members of the team.
Reporting any performance problems to line management.
Undertaking in staff appraisals and CPD activities.
Being able to accurately forecast staffing requirements to identify recruitment needs and potential candidates.
Being able to work diligently, efficiently, and professionally at all times
Adopting and complying with the company’s projects and internal management and quality systems.
Attending meetings as required.
Working with other members of the professional team in order to evaluate progress, difficulties and costs.
Assisting the development of the company’s management systems and processes.
Taking on a very active role in the winning work process.
Evaluating engineers in order to identify strengths, problem areas, and developing plans for improving performance.
Managing direct reports in respect of time and expense

Additional Information
Being aware of all the current design trends and technologies.
Attending and presenting key information at operations meetings.
Having a thorough understanding and being aware of commissioning industry standards and governance.
Assisting in the development of standard in-house documents and guides
Maintaining regular contact with clients to build/foster relationships outside of a project environment.
Support presentation for new projects and help coordinate all other input.
Developing the technical and managerial skills of current/new staff by contributing to their Personal Development Plans.
Developing your line manager with the technical skills the company needs in order to pursue of new business.
Pursuing sales leads generated by others.
Working with our marketing team to develop/produce external marketing material to enhance our position as industry lead in commissioning services.

Qualifications

Primary Objectives
Acting as a key point of contact with our clients.
Making full use of the company’s management systems in order to achieve the primary objective.
Proactively progress commissioning activities throughout the project cycle in conjunction with the general contractor and vendors.
By diligent management of the commissioning process ensuring that systems are set to work optimally and verified as such, in accordance with the design requirements.
Providing consultative advice in order to determine commissioning and performance requirements, commissioning strategies, programs, scopes of work, and test scripts.
Leading, managing, and mentoring junior staff.

Preferred Qualifications
Ideally 10+ years of industry experience in Project Management/ Commissioning Management.
Certified as a commissioning professional.
Registered Professional Engineer.
NEBB, BCxA, or AABC association or certification to provide commissioning services.
LEED, or LEED AP certified.
Engineering degree or equivalent qualification.

Key Attributes
Ability to efficiently communicate in written and oral forms.
Ability to consistently produce high quality project work.
Ability to work collaboratively.
Ability to problem solve quickly and creatively.
Being task and deadline focused.
Knowledge of Microsoft Office and Microsoft Project.
Detailed technical knowledge of mechanical and electrical building services systems.
Effective leadership and motivational, supervisory and organizational skills.
Individual drive, enthusiasm and a high attention to detail.
The ability to multitask.
Having the ability to be flexible when needed.
Having a sense of curiosity.

Why HDR

At HDR, we know work isn't only about who you work for; it's also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way.

Primary Location: Ireland-Dublin
Industry: Building Engineering
Schedule: Full-time
Employee Status: Regular
BusinessClass: Building Commissioning
Job Posting: Apr 23, 2021

title: Data Analyst
full description:
The primary purpose of this position is to research, analyze, interpret, transform and present reference data for fixed income securities as well as reference data pertaining to those issuers themselves that bring fixed income debt to market. The focus of this position is to perform this work with documents in English.

The incumbent must successfully complete a three month training program that centers on building enough subject matter expertise and the utilization of the database(s) of record such that the incumbent can independently analyze legal and financial documents associated with securities containing less complex fixed income structures. During training, the incumbent must master all of the subject matter and will be required to pass a series of quizzes and tests as well achieve the accuracy and timeliness metrics that were established for trainees.
The training curriculum for the Data Analyst contains high level overviews of the complex structures worked on by more senior personnel as well as reference data client use cases so that the incumbent can differentiate between legal and financial language that is relevant to and required by our client base versus jargon describing information that is not required and, so that the incumbent can identify new financing techniques that come to market. The incumbent must then apply this foundation of knowledge via a logical sequence of decision making events to determine relevancy of said information to our clients for any of their use cases and if deemed relevant, determine the appropriate next steps to ensure high client satisfaction levels.
The fixed income market consists of over two million active securities and the reference data provided by ICE Data Services for said securities is used by our clients to make trading decisions, settle trades, make investment decisions, manage portfolios, analyze risk, create security master files, create client statements and conduct other back office functions. Our reference data is also used by internal stakeholders such as the Evaluated Pricing, Index and Analytics groups said reference data plays an integral role in determining evaluated prices, determining whether or not a security should be added to or deleted from an index or indices, the weighted average of a security within an index and, performing a series of analytical calculations that are used both internally within ICE and externally by these stakeholder’s clientele.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Analyze, interpret, collate and transform reference data provided in a variety legal and financial documents, third party reports and vendor information while ensuring that the reference data provided in ICE’s products and services accurate, comprehensive and in a timely manner, namely best in class
Make sound, subjective decisions when interpreting legal and financial information by utilizing subject matter expertise to infer, deduce and ultimately draw the right conclusions
Provide customer support for users of ICE products by resolving inquiries in a timely manner
Craft external facing responses for those clients that submitted customer inquiries containing a meaningful, well-thought out, well-constructed answer that includes a restatement of the challenge or question, the analysis completed to satisfy the request and where appropriate, the methodology used to determine the solution
Procure required documents and/or trusted content utilizing creative internet searches and by conducting direct outreach to issuers, underwriters, fiduciary agents and bond counsel
Apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative work-flow efficiencies and process improvements resulting in increased accuracy levels, time to market and productivity
Help identify trends and causation of inaccurate and/or incomplete data
Participate in ad hoc projects to optimize processes and/or improve the quality of the data set.
Create charts, graphs and presentations for leadership teams
Use excel functions to organize, analyze and create reference data

PERSON SPECIFICATION

Business Level English
BA/BS in Finance, Economics or equivalent practical experience
Demonstrated, relevant work experience directly working in fixed income reference data operations or customer service
Ability to work in a fast paced, high pressured, fluid environment
Ability to distill large amounts of information into specific takeaways
Excellent attention to detail and high degree of demonstrated decision-making and problem solving skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills with proven ability to craft client-ready correspondences
Eagerness to learn and collaborate with others
Strong excel skills required
