title: Project Controls Analyst- Data Center
full description:
Facebook is seeking an experienced individual to join our Data Center Construction team as a Project Controls Analyst. The Project Controls Analyst must be experienced in cost reporting on active and highly complex construction projects. A successful candidate must be detail oriented, have experience maintaining cost databases, and be able to deliver reports timely and accurately. The Project Controls Analyst will provide the vital cost information needed for project managers to take positive action during the construction phase of a data center. The Project Controls Analyst will work closely with various departments, including Construction, Design, Sourcing, Procurement, Accounting and Finance to support all aspects of project cost and document management, vendor invoices and financial forecasting.
The responsibilities of this role will help gather cost data and input it into our electronic database as well as being able to generate reports for monthly meetings and as requested by site management. They will also be in charge of training others how to use our internal cost management systems as needed. This position is full-time and located in our Dublin International Headquarters. However, the project locations will be spread across EMEA. Managing stakeholders located across all these regions and time zones is a significant challenge and is key to the success of the projects.
Assemble, analyze and report on the financial status of construction projects in EMEA region in coordination with Construction Management team for monthly meetings and others as requested.
Manage cost databases by inputting and tracking budgets, commitments, and invoices in an electronic cost database (E-Builder and Oracle).
Preparation & reporting of cash flow forecasting for all Capex cost categories. Analysis and review of yearly, quarterly and monthly forecast vs the actual costs incurred.
Working with general contractors, consultants and vendors on a monthly basis to review and report on spend projections, actual payments, projected final accounts and interim reporting.
Working with cross functional partners on cost database metrics, project budgeting, market analysis and presentation of data collected from projects.
Reconcile accounts to ensure the accuracy of financial information being reported (i.e. between E-Builder and Oracle).
Work with accounting and payment processing teams to track the status of vendor payments.
Raise help tasks to increase purchase order budgets as needed.
Track the status of purchase orders and monitor balance amounts, identify increases that may be required and close out when needed.
Train others in the use of our electronic cost databases (E-Builder and Oracle).
Supervise third party cost management and quantity surveying companies.
Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Quantity Surveying, Accounting, Business Administration or equivalent technical degree and/or 5+ years direct professional experience in managing costs and vendor contracts for large scale construction or development projects (preferably across the Europe)
Experience in database administration, data entry, or data analysis.
Hands-on experience analyzing cost data and reporting results to management.
Familiar with construction industry terms and procedures.
Experience in data center construction or other mission critical projects is preferable.
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely on the financial status of multiple construction sites to construction managers.
Must be knowledgeable in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

title: Manager, Business Analyst
full description:
Applications will close 10 May 2021.
Manager, Business Analyst , Pfizer Global Shared Services Hub in Dublin, Ireland
Are you experienced with digital technology and looking for your next step within a world class business? If so, Pfizer has a permanent full-time opportunity for you in Ireland!
Your role will be part of global Digital Enterprise Platforms & Security (EP&S) team. This team integrates and oversees Pfizer’s global infrastructure; cloud services; information technology operations; cybersecurity, workforce platforms, standards, policies and Digital risk management.
This is an opportunity to join a team that innovates every day on technologies in support of scientific discovery, breakthrough products, and essential partnerships that help change patients’ lives.
What We Offer
Permanent position with Competitive Salary plus Bonus Schemes, Healthcare for you & your family, Pension & Share Purchase Scheme, Long term Income Protection, Life Assurance, Bi-Annual Medical and Tuition Assistance, and Competitive Annual Leave.
Pfizer’s Global Shared Services hub in Ireland is at the heart of Dublin City’s innovation district “Silicon Docks” with ready access to public transport.
Our Culture
Our Culture in Pfizer is hugely important to us. We recognize that people are the cornerstone of Pfizer’s success. We embrace career development & colleague engagement. As a team, together we run our business, so your input and expertise are essential to our success! We are proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion to ensure all colleagues have the freedom to be who they are and to bring their whole self to work.
Our culture is founded on the pillars of Equity, Joy, Courage and Excellence.
Role Summary
The Business Analyst will be part of the team responsible for governing, managing, and operating EP&S business and portfolio processes. The role will steward the EP&S demand intake process, contributing to streamlined and optimized work across the organization. Responsibilities will include providing guidance on the EP&S demand intake process to stakeholders, liaising with requesters to ensure requisite information is provided, guiding requests to governance for review/approval and providing course correction to requesters where necessary. Data presentation skills and the ability to design and develop dashboards will be key to demonstrating process health and enabling identification of improvement opportunities in this role. Essential to the role is the ability to work within existing processes while simultaneously identifying, recommending, and implementing opportunities for improvement and automation.
The Business Analyst will facilitate collection of customer feedback and collate this with process metrics data to propose process improvement recommendations. The role requires strong interpersonal, facilitation and communication skills to ensure effective engagement with a varied stakeholder group both internal to EP&S and external. The role will also contribute to developing and maintaining EP&S strategic plans and the Plan of Record.
Role Responsibilities
 Manage EP&S demand intake ensuring customer requirements are understood and requests route via the optimal path, providing course correction where required
Monitor EP&S Portfolio Governance processes to support fact-based decisions relating to EP&S capacity management and resource allocation
Design and lead review/continuous improvement processes, including gathering customer and stakeholder feedback, documenting output and collating and presenting recommendations
Manage process improvement projects in partnership with process leads and implement resultant process update tasks, ie : documentation, education, and awareness communications
Develop demand request KPIs and manage and monitor these to ensure efficient performance and customer satisfaction, and provide actionable insights
Define, design, develop and maintain the portfolio health dashboard in partnership with the Process Governance Lead
Work with EP&S Portfolio Governance stakeholders to develop and maintain EP&S strategic plans, service roadmaps and Plan of Record
Must be self-motivated, must have an ability to work well in a geographically dispersed, virtual team environment, and must exhibit a positive and professional attitude
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other analytics-related discipline
Exposure to Agile and Waterfall Project Management methodologies and tools (JIRA, etc)
Tableau dashboard design and delivery experience
Non-Standard Work Schedule, Travel, or Environmental Requirements
Domestic and International travel of 10-20%
In order to be considered for this position you need to be legally eligible to work in Ireland.
Pfizer is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.
Pfizer Global Business Services is passionate about building a diverse work environment where all employees feel respected in their uniqueness. We are proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion to ensure all colleagues have the freedom to be who they are and to bring their whole self to work. Together, we continue to build a culture that encourages, supports and empowers our employees.
#LI-PFE
Additional Information
In order to be considered for this position in Ireland you need to be legally eligible to work in Ireland.
Please note there is no relocation support available for this position
How to apply
Make a difference today, all suitable candidates should apply with CV below. We are looking forward to hearing from you!
Purpose
Breakthroughs that change patients' lives ... At Pfizer we are a patient centric company, guided by our four values: courage, joy, equity and excellence. Our breakthrough culture lends itself to our dedication to transforming millions of lives.
Digital Transformation Strategy
One bold way we are achieving our purpose is through our company wide digital transformation strategy. We are leading the way in adopting new data, modelling and automated solutions to further digitize and accelerate drug discovery and development with the aim of enhancing health outcomes and the patient experience.
Equal Employment Opportunity
We believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce is crucial to building a successful business. As an employer, Pfizer is committed to celebrating this, in all its forms – allowing for us to be as diverse as the patients and communities we serve. Together, we continue to build a culture that encourages, supports and empowers our employees.
Information & Business Tech

title: TTS Last Mile Transformation Senior Business Analyst
full description:
Citi’s Treasury and Trade Solutions (TTS) group is built on the power of our network. TTS provides transaction and banking services to Citi’s Institutional Clients, and is truly a global organisation, having a presence in over 100 countries. TTS is one of the strongest businesses at Citi, delivering consistent quarter-on-quarter profitability and growth.
As part of the strategic effort to rationalize and clean up country specific application and vendor estate within TTS, the Last Mile Transformation (LMT) program aims to decrease total cost of ownership, increase stability, enhance Risk & Controls, and increase alignment with Citi standards. The TTS Last Mile Transformation team is focusing heavily on enhancing its overall engineering practice, and this role is critical in delivering that initiative.
We are looking for a senior business analyst who will work with the development team to deliver the transformation of Citi’s TTS application landscape across the EMEA region.
Key Responsibilities:
Create requirements approach to identify and solve business problems/ needs.
Create and Manage requirements artifacts in the form of requirement documents/ product backlog/ feature catalogues.
Present findings and authored requirements artifacts and documentations to ALL stakeholders.
Create periodic status update reports for senior stakeholders.
Gather requirements through facilitating and fact finding interviews.
Work with designers to review high level designs. Work with testers to review test plans and cases.
Liaising between various stakeholder teams such as technology, business, operations, production support, etc., to manage and deliver requirements for complex projects.
Identify possible risks and their impact and drive requirements change through proper change control processes.
Coordinate and manage requirements/ changes with different teams in the bank to deliver Payments/Cards/data/liquidity/channel/In Country projects.
Skills and Experience:
At least 5 years of experience in requirements analysis, documentation and management.
At least 2 years of experience in working in agile/ creation and maintenance of user stories.
Should have business analysis experience in Banking or financial services.
Should be a good team player and should be able to contribute to the team’s knowledge.
Business analysis certification (such as CBAP) is preferred.
Agile certification such as ‘Product owner’ certification is preferred.
Should be able to quickly understand abstract and structurally complex problems.
Should be able to present complex problems and solutions clearly and pictorially.
Should be proficient in MS office suite of applications including MS Excel, PowerPoint, Visio,
Should be proficient in JIRA.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (in Business, banking, Mathematics, Computers, information technology)
Professional certifications in Business analysis, Agile/ scrum methodologies are preferred. Knowledge and on the job experience is treated as substitute.
What We Offer:
Opportunity to work in a diverse and inclusive environment
Collaboration with a high-calibre team, which will motivate and inspire you to do your best
Exposure to senior leaders and internal stakeholders, creating an opportunity to strengthen your business knowledge
Flexible working environment
Top-tier employee benefits

Full time

title: Finance Analyst
full description:
Degree and relevant professional experience
Ability to effectively communicate in English
Intermediate to advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel
MS Office

Have you ever ordered a product on Amazon and, when the box arrived, wondered how it got to you so fast? Have you wondered where it came from and how much it cost Amazon to deliver it to you?

Our Customer Fulfillment network is renowned for being world-class, delivering packages to customers across the world. Our Finance teams don’t just manage our books; they help drive the company forward by partnering closely with global cross-functional teams to support the growth of this rapidly expanding network; driving controllership, innovation, productivity, and cost-effective operations across the network in a fast paced environment. You’ll employ data analysis to ensure your partners and leaders have the most up to date, reliable information, working collaboratively to make the best possible financial decisions. You’ll make a huge impact, not just on the bottom line performance of your Fulfilment Centre, but on the overall customer experience, making history whilst having fun along the way!

We are looking for Financial Analyst that is excited to join a tech company that is constantly improving and reimagining the logistics industry. You should be passionate about using data to solve big, complex and ambiguous problems. Be eager to continuously learn and improve your skills. You should be attentive to which details make all the difference. Do you want to contribute shaping the new standard of shopping? If so, come and join the Customer Fulfillment Finance Team.

As part of the Customer Fulfillment Finance team, you will join a team that is passionate about numbers, data, and how to use them to generate insights and improve our business. We support and influence the organization by providing a holistic and financial perspective, we are the trusted business advisors. We collaborate with our partners to ensure leaders have the most up to date and reliable information, and work with them to make sure we are making the best possible decisions.

Responsibilties:

Leverages Customer Fulfillment metrics to identify cost out opportunities by linking up operations and financials and understands the details of the cost structure to make thoughtful judgement calls in ambiguous environments where data may be difficult to procure.
Earn trust of your business partners to influence and support tactical and strategic business decisions that lead to business improvements and cost reductions
Owns the Financial and operational planning processes to produce a challenging/stretch/bold yet solid operational plan as well as all Month-end procedures including variance analysis between scenarios (actuals, plan, forecast...)
Proactively supports knowledge-sharing within the team and across your division, while looking to standardize processes across EU teams
Works independently: Proactively partners with manager to prioritize and focus on high-impact activities and to deprioritize those which are unlikely to drive material improvement

Learning Opportunities:

Autonomy to innovate and deliver new approaches that impact the bottom and the top line
Grow and collaborate in a fast-pace environment where every day is day one
Being surrounded by inspiring and diverse individuals
Learn from people and cooperate with a wide variety of professional backgrounds
Ability to develop new skills and opportunities through lateral, geographical or functional moves
SQL or any large-scale data mining and reporting tools (or willingness to learn)
An eye for detail and a passion for data with the ability to accurately summarize the relevant details
A self-starter with the ability to prioritize
Understand, own and explain key drivers behind the story
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills and an ability to provide creative simple solutions to complex problems
Prioritize and work towards multiple deadlines

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
full description:
Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative/technical field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering)
1+ years of relevant experience in one of the following areas: Data engineering, business intelligence or business analytics
Hands-on experience in writing complex, highly-optimized SQL queries across large datasets
1+ years of experience in scripting languages like Python, Bash etc
Experience in data modeling, ETL development, and Data warehousing Experience with Oracle, Redshift etc.
Sharp analytical abilities, proven design skills, excellent communication skills
Experience mentoring and training others on complex technical issues

The goal of Amazon Logistics is to build a world class last mile operation. Amazon aims to exceed the expectations of our customers by ensuring that their orders are delivered as quickly, accurately, and in the most cost effective way as possible. This role is based out of our Luxembourg corporate office and is for an passionate, dynamic, analytical, innovative, hands-on, and customer-obsessed analyst.
The ideal candidate will have experience working with large datasets and distributed computing technologies. The candidate relishes working with large volumes of data, enjoys the challenge of highly complex technical contexts, and, above all else, is passionate about data and analytics. He/she is an expert with data modeling, ETL design and business intelligence tools, has hand-on knowledge on columnar databases such as Redshift and other related AWS technologies. He/she passionately partners with the customers to identify strategic opportunities in the field of data engineering. He/she is a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big (while paying careful attention to detail) and enjoys working in a fast-paced team that continuously learns and evolves on a day to day basis.


1+ years of experience as a Business/Financial Analyst or Systems Analyst in a company with large, complex data sources
Experience with AWS services including S3, Redshift, EMR and Apache Spark
Experience with software coding practices is a strong plus
Experience using Linux/UNIX to process large data sets

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
full description:
Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or related field
Strong data analysis skills – e.g. database query construction, data warehousing, regression modelling, forecasting, data mining and experience in market and business analysis
Experience solving complex problems – you must be able to think laterally and solve extremely ambiguous problems quickly and comprehensively
Advanced SQL and business intelligence experience
Strong bias for action, highly organized and ability to complete a high volume of tasks and projects with limited guidance and tight deadlines
Experience with Python, R, VBA, or other automation-focused languages
Exemplary verbal and written communication skills, fluent English is required
Impeccable attention to detail, passion for processes, systems and data mining
High levels of integrity and discretion in handling confidential information

Job Description
Over 2 million Selling Partners list their products for sale on the Amazon Marketplace. Selling Partners are a critical part of Amazon’s ecosystem to deliver on our vision of offering the Earth’s largest selection and lowest prices. These Selling Partners offer hundreds of millions of unique products providing a broad and diverse inventory of products from Books, Electronics and Apparel to Consumables and beyond. In our vision to build a global marketplace, we will enable Selling Partners to list, make their selection available to customers globally while optimizing their inventory placement across multiple countries.

You have a passion for using data in order to drive business actions. You are keen to improve current reporting solutions or innovate by creating new and simpler ones and provide the Marketplace business with robust automated insight. You thrive at analyzing and modelling very large data sets, diving below the surface to identify the root cause and the “so what” rather than just superficial trends. You love participating in cross-functional projects that will directly impact the commercial performance of the business.

Responsibilities include:

Performing deep-dives to derive actionable insights
Creating models to predict outcomes and optimize business processes
Building self-service reporting tools and dashboards
Providing SQL support and delivering trainings (SQL, Tableau, etc.)
Participating in and driving cross-functional projects in collaboration with BI teams across Europe and US
Advanced Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or related field
Familiarity with AWS services such as S3, Redshift, EMR, Athena, etc.
Experience with Machine Learning projects

full description:

5+ years in delivering and influencing business processes using data analysis

Global Mile is a team of highly experienced logistics professionals, carrier specialists, and program managers focused on improving the speed and reliability of Amazon’s cross-border logistics capabilities.
The Global Logistics Services team within Global Mile is responsible for executing the timely movement of freight from global manufacturing hubs cross-border into Amazon’s international marketplaces for Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA) sellers and retail direct import vendors. Leveraging the capabilities of world-class logistics providers and internal Amazon supply chain solutions, Global Logistics Services increases selection and lowers cost for our customers.

We are looking for a talented and experienced Business Analyst who will deliver research to drive insights and prioritization. As a member of this team, you will have an opportunity to be a thoughtful leader in Amazon and work with a group of program managers, product managers and business leaders to design the Amazon network of the future. The ideal candidate will have experience working with large datasets and enjoys the challenge of highly complex technical contexts, and, above all else, is passionate about data and analytics. They passionately partner with customers to identify strategic opportunities in the field of data engineering. They are a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big (while paying careful attention to detail) and enjoys working in a fast-paced team that continuously learns and evolves on a day to day basis.


Master’s degree or equivalent in Logistics / Supply Chain / Mathematics / Science / Engineering / Business Development
Experience developing and growing a business / start-up / association
Proficiency with TABLEAU, Microsoft Excel to include making charts, data manipulation, pivot tables, creating macros, and visual basic knowledge.
Ability to display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format and to present findings in a clear and concise manner

title: Business Support Analyst
full description:
We are looking to add a business support analyst to join the existing EOT reliability team. You will work in a heavily business focused technology environment managing multiple responsibilities that demand a strong sense of urgency and focus to ensure that the performance and stability of our proprietary trading systems as well as the related hardware is optimized.
You will work closely with Traders, Development, Delivery and Engineering teams to dig into the data available through queries and scripts, in order to resolve issues.
In this role you will:
Address queries and investigate issues from Traders.
Act as primary escalation point for these issues.
Troubleshoot and optimize our proprietary applications.
Real time monitoring - You will look at a number of monitoring applications displaying a live view of the trading environment (both software & hardware), responding if a piece of hardware dies or software crashes to get it back up and running.
Responsible for deploying, reviewing, and testing changes to the production trading environment inclusive of business, software and hardware changes.
Work on both short & long-term projects
Collaborate with Development, Delivery and Engineering teams to deliver new and improved functionalities to the trading environment.

What we're looking for

Degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent industry experience of 3+ years.
Excellent analytical & troubleshooting skills.
Experience with Change Management and Incident Management Procedures.
Experience of technical documentation & support cases.
Financial systems experience.
Could Have:
Experience of working with and supporting a batch scheduling system.
Knowledge of networked application systems to include exposure to technologies such as databases (e.g. Oracle, MySQL) and Server OS (e.g. Windows, Linux).
Knowledge of scripting (e.g. Windows Batch, PowerShell, Python, SQL)
Experience of system monitoring tools, such as Splunk or Check_MK.
Financial Trade Floor experience is a plus but not essential, training will be provided.
Personal Attributes
Candidates must be a self-starters with demonstrated initiative and a drive to deliver outstanding solutions and possess a proven record of seeking continuous improvement and implementing best practice in a technology environment
Strong decision making skills. Candidates must be able to assess situations to determine the risks and options, and effectively communicate clear and timely decisions.
Excellent communication (verbal and written) – possess an ability to convey complex subjects in a clear and concise manner
Candidates must have a proven ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
Excellent attention to detail – thorough in all work carried out
Excellent collaboration and interpersonal skills are key to building strong working relationships. Candidates must have the ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships with all stakeholders in order to achieve results.
Teamwork – working together to meet deadlines
Excellent time management, organization and prioritization skills
Flexibility – all members of the team participate in early morning and out of hours schedules
Desire to learn and improve skills and knowledge

full description:

The Support Data Analyst role will analyse and model data leveraging various tools across a wide range of support metrics to help drive our digital support transformation. The analyst role will bring technical expertise to help ensure the quality and accuracy of that data, allowing them to process and present it in ways that assist Executive Management and Technical Support Leaders make informed and insightful business decisions.

title: Sales Strategy & Operations Analyst
full description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Sales
Job Details
Salesforce.com is the global leader in customer relationship management (CRM) software. We pioneered the shift to cloud computing, and today we’re delivering the next generation of social, mobile and cloud technologies that help companies revolutionize the way they sell, service, market and innovate – and become customer companies. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World’s Most Innovative Company according to Forbes and one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For. Our more human, less corporate culture is built around doing work that matters, winning as a team and celebrating success.


The Strategy and Business Operations team is a high-performance team critical to success for Salesforce. We are the source of growth, passion and drive for the Salesforce Central Europe business covering Germany, Austria and Switzerland.


About the Position


The Analyst will play a critical role in the Sales Strategy team. The candidate will identify and report on key indicators of sales performance and market opportunity, using those findings to set the strategic agenda and drive projects for the sales organisation, and presenting recommendations to the sales leadership. Projects will include business planning, market segmentation, pipeline analysis, coverage optimization, and ongoing performance measurement. Deliverables range from robust analytic models, custom performance analysis, tactical business initiatives, and the packaging of findings into presentation-ready content for Salesforce executives.


The successful candidate will possess a passion for creating innovative analysis, the ability to develop findings and recommendations that transcend the numbers as well as the energy to contribute to projects impacting and transforming the business.


Ideally, this person will have worked or interned in a sales strategy & operations environment, management consultancy, or in a comparable environment that requires business acumen combined with analytical skills, and will feel comfortable interacting with senior management on a regular basis.


Responsibilities
Support our business units with ongoing analysis and recommendations
Drive improvements in our sales process and coverage model through scalable analytics
Work cross-functionally to establish reporting standards
Assist in developing and delivering presentations for senior executives and inform decisions on a daily basis
Assist the business through each stage of the fiscal year planning cycle in the design and implementation of planning models, sales territories and sales quotas
Take part in key strategic initiatives to transform and shape the business for delivering growth
Interact regularly with different functions including Sales, Marketing, Finance and IT
Desired Skills / Experience
Bachelors Degree, preferably in an analytical discipline such as engineering, science, economics, computer science etc.
Several years of experience in a similar field preferable
Strong data analysis and logical reasoning skills with experience analysing complex datasets using Excel, Google sheets, Tableau or SQL
Ability to balance priorities and work productively in a fast paced environment
Solid self-starter behaviour: Curious, innovative, problem solving & autonomous
Must be fluent in both Germany and English.

title: Forecasting and Capital Optimisation Analyst
full description:
Permanent TSB is one of Ireland's leading retail and SME banks, with an innovative range of products and services powered through an evolving digital landscape, our focus is centred on ensuring we deliver what our customers, colleagues and communities need to be successful.

As a Senior Analyst Forecasting and Capital Optimisation, your role is to maintain and further develop the Banks impairment and capital forecasting processes. The impairment (Expected Credit Loss) and capital (Risk Weighted Asset) forecasts underpin the quantification of short to medium term regulatory capital requirements while Pillar 2 capital assists the Bank to assess its internal capital.

Responsibilities:
Produce high quality value-add analysis and insights across portfolios to support the Banks strategy and share with internal partners and external stakeholders.
Analyse results from the forecasting and Pillar 2 models, understand unexpected model outcomes and explain the movement in results from previous recent results.
Identify capital allocation insights and make appropriate recommendations in respect of the capital optimisation strategies where appropriate.
Work in collaboration with numerous internal partners in order to ensure all work undertaken is up to date and that assumptions are aligned between teams where necessary.
Support internal and external stress testing activity.
Additionally, you will effectively communicate findings and insights gathered to the Forecasting and Capital Optimisation management team and internal partners
Support the team through delivery of relevant deep dive analysis and model remediation actions originated from internal partners and external stakeholders (i.e. Model Validation Team, Auditors, Central Bank of Ireland etc.).
Mentor and guide junior analysts to deliver the Banks Credit Risk agenda.

Requirements:
2+ years experience working as a risk analyst, model developer, business analyst, data scientist or data analyst.
2:1 Honours Bachelors Degree (NFQ Level 8) in a mathematical, statistical, computer science or associated subject area.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and communication skills with demonstrated skills in summarising and interpreting large volumes of data and translating into meaningful insights.
Aspiration to become subject matter expert on credit loss quantification.
An interest in developing programming languages experience

This is a Permanent role based in Permanent TSBs St Stephens Green Office.

Is this you?

Please apply online on our website or via the apply link of this role. Your application will be sent through to our Talent Acquisition team and they will be in touch regarding your application.

We reserve the right to draw up a shortlist for interview

We aim to attract, recruit, and retain individuals with diverse backgrounds, skills, competencies and abilities to work collaboratively to enhance the service we provide to all of our customers and the communities we serve.

title: Finance Analyst
full description:
fire.com – Finance Analyst
Open Banking, Payments, APIs and more.
Dublin
What we do?
At fire.com we help businesses access payment services and automate payment processes. With our technology, API and regulatory licences, we deliver solutions that make payments faster, more cost-effective and secure. Businesses may open as many sterling and euro accounts and issue as many debit cards needed. Our accounts support debit cards, bank transfers, direct debits, open banking and FX transfers. The Fire API enables our clients to automate their account, card and payment processes.
What is the role?
We are seeking a Finance Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will report to our Chief Financial Officer and will have the opportunity to work closely with other senior stakeholders from across the company. As a fast-moving fintech business that is changing the way businesses pay and get paid, you will have a significant opportunity to take responsibility, interact, learn and to see how payments and our business works.
The role entails:

Data Analysis - write ETLs (extract, transform, load) to take data from various data sources. Identify and propose solutions constantly making data accurate.
KPIs - collect, store, and analyse complex data sets, build dashboards and provide regular reporting.
Forecast - design, build maintain the company business plan and forecasting models.
Decision Support - gather and transform business requirements, analyse and provide clear insight to aid decision making (cost management, pricing, strategic decisions).
Business Intelligence – seek to continuously improve the data analysis process, to design better workflows, automate processes etc.
What should you have?
2 years’ experience in Finance or Business Intelligence Analysis with a degree in Finance, Accounting, Statistics, or some other related field.
Advanced Excel modelling skills are required.
SQL experience with understanding of relational database systems is essential.
Ability to combine data and research into clear and concise conclusions and recommendations.
Ability to clearly explain information to non-technical audiences.
Some knowledge of accounting is desirable.
Awareness of the fintech and payments landscape would be great.
As a member of the fire.com team you will be contributing to the development of new and innovative fintech solutions – working with an experienced team, you will have the opportunity to make an impact.
What else?
We are an early stage fintech business, with offices in Dublin and London. We have 35 people in our team, all of whom are currently working remotely. In addition to offering a competitive salary we will provide you with a great place to work, learn and take responsibility for delivering compelling financial services products.
Fire Financial Services Limited – trading as fire.com – is regulated by the Central Bank of Ireland as a Payment Institution (No: C58301) and Fire Financial Services Limited (fire-UK) is authorised as an Electronic Money Institution by the Financial Conduct Authority (No: 900983)
For more information on our privacy statement, please refer to https://www.fire.com/privacy-statement-candidates

title: Performance Marketing Data Analyst
full description:
Ding is the world’s leading universal top-up service. Founded in 2006, Ding was born from seeing something that wasn’t there. 6 billion of the world’s mobile phones are prepaid and a quarter of those are out of top-up. We believe mobile phones can change lives and we want to improve people’s lives by helping those with less gain access to more. Our mission is to build and run the safest, simplest most effective and convenient top-up technology, in partnership with the best operators and platforms. We’ll continue to spread joy across the globe helping people everywhere to send little bytes of happiness to their loved ones, keeping our customers connected to their families and friends. Now more than ever we realise the importance of keeping in touch and here at Ding we believe a little goes a long way.


We’re looking for an experienced Data Analyst specializing in Performance Marketing to join our Data Analytics team. This is a key and exciting role where you will support Consumer Marketing; analysing marketing performance and budgets to make recommendations and optimize results, having a real and significant impact on our business and driving growth.


Day to day responsibilities include:

Responsible for analysing marketing activity.
Use statistical knowledge to analyse performance and budgets, informing actions that will maximise business impact.
Continually evaluate, A/B test and optimize customer acquisition strategies to improve the customer experience and increase overall revenue.
Work closely with the Performance Marketing team to execute tests, evaluate large scale campaigns, and maximize ROAS.
Stay up to date with the latest in Paid Marketing industry best practice - especially around attribution and performance analysis.


Key Attributes we’re looking for:

Minimum of 1 years’ experience in a Data or Business Analytics role.
Well-versed in performance marketing, conversion and online customer acquisition.
Strong understanding of attribution modelling and multi-channel analysis.
Strong knowledge of programming languages such as R or Python, as well as SQL.
General knowledge of office software products such as Excel and Word.
Proven track record of strong communication skills – both verbal and written.
Strong mathematical background with a broad understanding of statistics.
Experience using Google Ads and Google Analytics.


About Ding

Ding was founded to change billions of lives by accelerating mobile access.


As the number one international mobile top-up platform in the world, Ding has been keeping people connected since 2006, when it launched this first-of-a-kind service. Today, Ding’s users have successfully sent over 400 million top-ups globally, via the app, online at Ding.com, and in-store at over 600,000+ retail outlets worldwide. In fact, Ding delivers a top-up every second, via 500+ operators, across 140+ countries – helping families and friends around the world to stay connected.


Ding is headquartered in Dublin, Ireland, and also has offices in Barcelona, Bucharest, Dhaka, Dubai, New Jersey and Paris. Ding’s culturally diverse team of more than 200 people reflects our commitment to delivering cutting-edge, potentially life-changing technology to developed and emerging markets alike.


We're always on the lookout for talented people who embody our core values:

We are Customer Curious
We are Thinkers, Linkers & Doers
We Work Better Together
We Seek Out that Spark


Ding’s recruitment privacy notice is available at https://www.ding.com/recruitment-privacy-notice

title: Customer Support Analyst, German Market
full description:
Coinbase has built the world's leading compliant cryptocurrency platform serving over 30 million accounts in more than 100 countries. With multiple successful products, and our vocal advocacy for blockchain technology, we have played a major part in mainstream awareness and adoption of cryptocurrency. We are proud to offer an entire suite of products that are helping build the cryptoeconomy and increase economic freedom around the world.

There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, disrupt ourselves, and expect sustained high performance because we play as a championship team. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people with the desire and capacity to build and share expertise in the frontier technologies of crypto and blockchain, in whatever way is most relevant to their role.
As a bi-lingual (english / german) Customer Support Analyst for the German Market, you’ll join a high functioning team of passionate support professionals who know their performance is critical to Coinbase achieving its mission. At Coinbase we have a high hiring bar and we’re determined to create a productive, progressive, inclusive place to work. If you’re looking to work for a mission driven, employee first organization, please apply today.

We currently have a number of open roles across different operations domains including compliance, payments, fraud, account access, trust and safety, crypto, banking and formal complaints.

What you’ll be doing (ie. job duties):

Responsible for providing support for Coinbase customers in Germany by investigating, troubleshooting and resolving customer issues across multiple channels (email, social and/or chat).
Manage, prioritize, and respond to Tier 2 issues, inquiries, and escalations.
Work with our Legal teams to investigate and respond to formal customer complaints.
Participate in an on-call rotation to handle hi-priority queues and provide daily handovers to global operational teams.
Communicate with internal and external partners in an effective, tactical, and empathetic manner.
Proactively drive impactful changes across workflows, policies and tools by working with internal support teams and vendor partners.
Set a high bar for support analysts within the organization by setting an example through performance and work ethic.

What we look for in you (ie. job requirements):

Motivated by Coinbase’s mission and crafting a flawless support experience for our global customer base.
Must work in a defined shift, as required by the business. Weekend support may be required.
Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in financial services, crypto, technology, and/or customer support.
Experience with different channels of support, including voice, e-mail, social and/or chat.
Phenomenal communication skills in order to operate globally across multiple departments and partners.
Flexible and adaptable to meeting the evolving needs of a high-growth and fast paced organization
Ability to read, write and speak in German and English proficiently

Nice to haves:

Experience with compliance, payments, fraud, account access, trust and safety, or other relevant operational domains.
Advanced understanding of Google apps, JIRA, Salesforce Service Cloud.
Commitment to Equal Opportunity

Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. title: Decision Science Senior Analyst
full description:
Permanent TSB is one of Ireland's leading retail and SME banks, with an innovative range of products and services powered through an evolving digital landscape, our focus is centred on ensuring we deliver what our customers, colleagues and communities need to be successful.

As a Senior Analyst Decision Science, your role is to deliver the bank¿s Credit Risk model development agenda across IRB and IFRS 9. The models underpin the quantification of credit loss for the Balance Sheet and Profit & Loss Statement including regulatory capital requirements and impairment provisions. If you like using programming languages to build and analyse the performance of predictive models, then this is the role for you!

Responsibilities:
Develop and analyse models to quantify credit loss.
Develop data-driven and predictive models across Probability of Default (PD), Loss Given Default (LGD), Exposure of Default (EAD) and State of the Economy (SOE) models.
Utilise traditional statistical techniques and apply mathematical theory/concepts.
Build large datasets that are robust and efficient for use across Decision Science helping to maximise speed of development through efficient coding and automation.
Produce high quality `value-add¿ analysis and insights across data mining and trend analysis and develop optimum segmentation strategies.
Communicate findings and insights gathered through model development to the Decision Science management team and internal partners.
Support the team through delivery of relevant deep dive analysis and model remediation actions originated from internal and external stakeholders (i.e. Model Validation Team, Auditors, Central Bank of Ireland etc.).
Mentor and guide junior modellers/analysts to deliver the Bank¿s Credit Risk model development agenda.

Requirements:
2+ years¿ experience working as a risk analyst, model developer, business analyst, data scientist or data analyst.
A 2:1 Honours Bachelor¿s Degree (NFQ Level 8) in a mathematical/statistical /computer science or associated subject area.
Experience and knowledge of programming languages such as SAS (Base, Guide, Miner), SQL or other advanced statistical/econometric analysis software.
Knowledge of statistical techniques (such as regression, time series, decision trees, scorecards, experimental design etc.).
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and communication skills with proven skills in summarising and interpreting large volumes of data and translating into meaningful insights.
Aspiration to become subject matter expert on credit loss quantification.

This is a Permanent role based in Permanent TSB's St. Stephen¿s Green Office.

Is this you?

title: Senior Project Analyst- ETF
full description:
The Senior Project Analyst- ETF will initiate, organize, drive, and complete small projects or segments of large projects (including global projects) that address business goals and needs. You may participate in any or all phases of the project life cycle and is responsible for execution of project tasks in accordance with standards and best practices.
The Senior Project Analyst gathers requirements, analyzes data, researches issues, and devises solutions for the project. In addition, you may lead/coordinate user acceptance testing, and implementation of new and existing applications as defined in a project or product roll-out plan. You should be results-oriented and understands the impact of the project on the organization as a whole.
Project Management and Execution
Assist Project Manager and Project Sponsor in defining project scope.
Identify business goals and problems in individual business units and across the organization.
Perform assessment of feasible solutions and the range of problems they may solve.
Lead project segment or work stream. Prepare a plan for the work stream, including task assignments, timelines, phases, dependencies, and critical paths.
Work with Project Sponsor to prioritize deliverables and manage resources
Ensure thorough testing of all system changes, including user acceptance testing, regression testing, client testing and parallel/pilot testing as required
Ensure that Business Analysts adhere to strong project execution methodology standards and best practices throughout the project lifecycle
 Data Collection & Documentation
Document and/or review business requirements gathered from business users, sponsors and clients, and obtain user signoff on the requirements
Identify and interview key individuals to gather needed details and direction to define business requirements.
Track and organize open items; understand the time sensitivities of open issues and drive to resolution
Communicate defects to Systems developers. Track delivery dates for defect fixes and maintain status reporting. Escalate appropriately.
Oversee and/or participate in documentation of new or revised procedures or workflows.
Document Change Requests, provide effort estimates and document business requirements for approved Change Requests
 Analysis
Conduct business analysis to determine how changing business needs will affect the system or product; clearly articulate the business need and potential solutions with support of insightful analysis and documented evidence
Demonstrates strong subject matter expertise in the assigned product or discipline, including technical knowledge of associated systems
Design creative solutions that meet the goals and objectives of the project and align with product/discipline strategy.
Lead design sessions, driving to creative, well thought out, viable solutions
Identify gaps between business requirements and existing or proposed design solutions.
Recognize patterns in complex information across multiple projects and identify key issues.
Work with business areas to identify productivity improvements in workflows and procedures.
Work with business areas to identify areas of risk for errors and omissions.
 Communication
Plan meetings, prepare materials, and lead or participate in meetings with business users and sponsors, systems groups, vendors and clients
Prepare project status reporting and other project communications for internal and external stakeholders as needed
 Leadership
Lead work streams or project segments
Lead or participate in client workshops and meetings to identify key issues, requirements, and gaps.
Conduct/lead user/client training when necessary.
Assist in the creation of product announcements and modification of client demonstration materials as needed.
Provide guidance for Business Analysts through coaching, resolving interpersonal conflict, coordinating activity, and assigning work.
Based on lessons learned, offers updates to improve best practices, project documentation and standards as applicable.
Requirements
BS/BA degree
5+ years of related work experience
Experience in ETF area
Background in Custody and Fund Services preferred
Takes ownership and follow through on tasks; results oriented
Flexible and able to handle multiple priorities
Creative thinking, intellectual curiosity
Problem-solving and sound judgment
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong organizational and time management skills
Strong attention to detail
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with all level of audiences
Negotiation and mediation skills.
Experience using established project management principles and methodologies.
Proficiency in MS Office product suite
Full time
Dublin

title: Marketing Data Analyst with GTM
full description:
Desired Skills
Google Tag Manager, Data Analytics, Good Ads

Marketing Data Analyst with GTM

My client, a world leader in e-commerce and digital media are currently expanding their analytics team with a Data Analyst/GTM specialist. This company is growing from strength to strength. You will play a vital role in the planning and development of the tag management platform as well as associated integrations. You will work within a framework of analysts including the Senior GTM specialist and data analysts.
Your Role:
You will work on data analytics and tracking solutions for web and app technologies, ensuring accurate implementation of all trackers and tags.
Understanding business objectives, data questions and site-tagging problems.
You will interpret complex business needs, translating this into data specifications for technical solutions.
Working with technical teams and Business Analysts to create analytics and tracking requirements across multiple levels of the business including product teams, analytics and 3rd party vendors. You will also advise and support the commercial teams in their use of analytics tags.
You will support the automation of Web and Mobile analytics testing processes and procedures.
Experience Required:
Bachelor's Degree in Business or Technology related field or similar experience.

Excellent Communication skills and technical understanding across multiple layers of the business.

title: Supply Chain Business Analyst
full description:
What you need to know

You will work as a Business Analyst for our client, an innovative, growing, and highly successful medical manufacturing company in Co. Westmeath.

As the Business Analyst you will work as part of the supply chain analyst team and you will be responsible for providing business intelligence and ERP system expertise to the supply chain teams. You will coordinate with, participate on, and lead cross functional teams in order to provide automated data solution that enhance end user experience.

This is a permanent job.

This job will offer both remote and office based work.
Your new job

Key duties & responsibilities:

Develop business intelligence capabilities with the global supply chain systems.
Investigate process gaps within supply chain systems, determining root cause, and analyzing options to mitigate risk.
Implement solutions with the supply chain systems in order to enhance global supply chain processes and improve the accuracy of the Master Production Plan.
Establish and track metrics of the supply chain systems.
Manage the item set-up and maintenance process with the ERP system for all planning and related supply chain attributes.
Create opportunities and innovative solutions to improve the user experience.
Provide education/training to the plant/staff in the areas of supply chain management, demand management, or planning tools. Participating on global process improvement teams.

Experience working with ERP, MRP II, MRP, systems.

Project Management experience

title: Senior Data Analyst - Manager
full description:
At Deloitte, we deliver the solutions and insights our clients need to address their most complex business challenges. As the world’s largest global professional services and consulting network, Deloitte Ireland has nearly 3,000 people providing audit, tax, consulting, and corporate finance services to public and private clients spanning multiple industries.
Deloitte’s Consulting Practice is one of the world's leading Management Consulting firms for executable Strategy, Operations, Technology, and Human Capital Advisory services. The consulting practice is built around integrated core capabilities - people, process, technology and industry expertise - the capabilities needed to help clients to tackle their most complex challenges.
Deloitte has exciting career opportunities for Managers within our Analytics & Information Management Team. These are roles within our analytics team who help clients realise value from the business data in their IT systems. Using the latest technologies you will be continually encouraged to devise innovative solutions to help our clients deliver high quality business intelligence from their technology platform. You will develop your technical and business skill set across industry sectors. You will work on diverse and varied projects with our clients to transform or develop their technology strategy. We offer the opportunity to work with a variety of clients across a number of different sectors. We provide a challenging and exciting work environment with scope for personal development and on-going training.
Our analytics team are data enthusiasts, eager to explore and discover hidden insights within data that can provide real value to our clients. Businesses today gather an ever increasing wealth of structured and unstructured data from a myriad of sources but often are not extracting the full value from this information.

Our team build tools, create interactive visualisations, search for patterns and develop predictive models in order to bring actionable insight from the data. Complementing these abilities with deep industry knowledge across the Deloitte network along with technical integration skills and business transformation capabilities provides a complete offering to our clients, allowing value to be realised from data driven insights. As businesses realise the potential value of their data, analytics specialists with skills in data management, visualisation and insight generation will be in high demand.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Supporting client engagement work in a variety of industries, areas and specialisms

Assisting in the scoping and delivery of analytical projects
Envisioning and leading the design and delivery innovative solutions using latest open source and proprietary technologies to meet client needs
Exploiting industry best practices and your experience to create business solutions for our clients
Skills, Experience and Qualifications:
A minimum of a third level degree in Maths, Physics, Engineering, Computer Sciences or a related discipline
Experience leading and delivering data related projects, from the gathering of requirements through to the development of solutions (including comprehensive and detailed analytical reports, using open source and off-the-shelf tools (Tableau, PowerBI etc.)
Experience influencing senior stakeholders, providing quality advice based on leading industry practices
Familiar with best practice project management methods, tools and techniques
Clear and articulate communication style, and a collaborative approach
Experience leading and motivating teams, that ensures the best outcomes
Commercial experience in an information management role
Experience in handling large and complex datasets using statistical programming languages (R, Matlab, Python, SAS etc.) is essential
Basic knowledge of or exposure to machine learning, data mining, data visualisation, and artificial intelligence techniques (clustering, regression, classification, etc.)

We love to speak with professionals about their next career move. If you have a passion for learning from talented people and want to benefit from the support of a global organisation and network, apply online now.

title: Business Analytics Lead Analyst - VP (Regulatory)
full description:
The Business Analytics Lead Analyst - VP is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. Recognized technical authority for an area within the business. Requires basic commercial awareness. There are typically multiple people within the business that provide the same level of subject matter expertise. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Provides advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business. Work impacts an entire area, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family.

Responsibilities:
Gathers operational data from various cross functional stakeholders to examine past business performance
Identifies data patterns & trends, and provides insights to enhance business decision making capability in business planning, process improvement, solution assessment etc.
Recommends actions for future developments & strategic business opportunities, as well as enhancements to operational policies
May be involved in exploratory data analysis, confirmatory data analysis and/or qualitative analysis
Translate data into consumer or customer behavioral insights to drive targeting and segmentation strategies, and communicate clearly and effectively to business partners and senior leaders all findings
Continuously improve processes and strategies by exploring and evaluating new data sources, tools, and capabilities
Work closely with internal and external business partners in building, implementing, tracking and improving decision strategies
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
Experience as an Operations Research Analyst, Analytics Manager, Strategic Business Analyst or related position performing quantitative analytics supporting financial services
Experience analyzing large datasets; applying mathematical, statistical and quantitative analysis techniques to perform complex analyses and data mining
Bachelors/University degree, Master’s degree preferred

title: Anti-Abuse Analyst
full description:
About the role
The Tinder Trust & Safety pod is on a mission to make Tinder the safest way to meet new people. We are looking for an ambitious Analyst to join the growing Anti-Abuse team. This person will work cross-functionally with Product, Design, Engineering and Machine Learning to build and enhance features and tools, and collaborate closely with other departments such as Community Operations, Legal/Policy, Marketing, PR, and Communications to make every initiative a success. The ideal candidate will have a background in a social science, quantitative or technical field and experience working with large data sets and relational databases. You are focused on results, a self-starter, demonstrate deep customer empathy, have superior analytical, computational and interpersonal skills.
What You’ll Do:
Work with partners to identify and prioritize risks to our members’ safety, and leverage in-app product solutions, back-end systems, and processes to effectively reduce prevalence and harm
Develop expertise in the areas of content safety and account integrity, and the burgeoning technologies undergirding the efforts to improve and maintain them
Work with pod, pillar, and company leadership to define the Trust & Safety product roadmap, develop metrics that inform the success of safety efforts, and drive cross-functional efforts across product, design, engineering, policy, community operations, and PR/Comms
Obtain a deep understanding of emerging threats our members face with the end goal of analyzing the costs and benefits of potential solutions by contributing to internal discussions, newsletters, reports and presentations that raise awareness and serve as a call to action
Explore vast amounts of data in search of insights and stories that can be turned into powerful business rules and mitigation strategies
Play an active role in the process of leveraging resources to protect members and advocate for enhancements to the member experience
We’re looking for:
Minimum of 1+ years in a similar role or project experience in Trust and Safety
1+ years of experience with data analysis and proficiency with SQL and R and/or Python
Knowledge of Google Docs suite, including Sheets and Slides
Passion for analyzing, prioritizing, and optimizing anti-abuse countermeasures
Ability to be scrappy and navigate ambiguity with curiosity and zeal in a fast-paced environment
Excellent judgment and communication skills
Superior time management and prioritization skills
Bachelor degree or higher
Bonus Points if:
You have familiarity with privacy and data security issues
Experience with large data sets
Experience with data visualization tools (eg, Tableau, Mode, Amplitude)
As part of our team you’ll enjoy:
Working on a product that has an immediate impact on people’s lives all around the world
Collaborating with a team of creative, fun and driven colleagues
Comprehensive health coverage and competitive salary
No Meeting Wednesdays
Monthly and weekly interactive virtual events


At Tinder, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our product, and our community. We strive to make our workplace an inclusive and diverse environment, giving people from all walks of life the opportunity to have a voice. We champion and encourage those who bring different perspectives, ideas, and creativity to join our team dedicated to bringing people together across the globe. Tinder is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace where we welcome all people regardless of sex, gender identity, race, ethnicity, disability, or other lived experience.

title: Data Operations Analyst II
full description:
Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet
We are at a transformational moment in our company journey - and we’re so excited about it. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture, and to accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our purpose is to help customers improve business performance with Dun & Bradstreet’s Data Cloud and Live Business Identity, and we’re wildly passionate and committed to this purpose. So, if you’re looking to make an immediate impact at a company that welcomes bold and diverse thinking, come join us!
The Role: As a Data Operations Analyst II, you will be working as part of an agile team, hands on with source data through to end Product. you will be responsible for the analysis, operation and maintenance of the Data Management processes, creation of new data processes to meet business data requirements, ingestion of new sources of data and delivery against data quality standards.
Your focus will be across the end to end lifecycle of data management. Proactively driving and governing our data’s accuracy, integrity, completeness, conformity and consistency. You will be passionate about the power of modern Cloud native services and the potential to harness the scale and automation opportunities they present. The role will include continuous improvement as a measure of success and drive to deliver improvements across our data lifecycle management.
The role involves operating a new, cutting edge cloud native platform designed to accumulate, derive meaning from, and apply stewardship to, large, diverse datasets. The candidate will bring a DataOps mindset to the platform share KPIs and collaborate closely with internal Data Owner teams, Technology Cloud Ops and SRE teams as well as engage directly with external source data providers and partners.
Key Responsibilities:
Key part of a team responsible for the end to end operational management of cloud data platform, adhering to required data management and governance practices
Lead the business decision-making by retrieving, aggregating datasets from multiple sources into actionable format and tools
Create documentation, reports and dashboards to support the effective management and operation of the data supply chain
Manage the provision of data sets and tools for business data analysis and analytics
Develop a variety of database query and visualization tools to identify and understand platform issues or events
Provide technical expertise in extraction, integration, and analysis of critical data
Own test case scenarios, prepare test data and perform Data Ops User Acceptance testing as platform functionality evolves
Key Requirements:
3+ years of experience within a similar position
Strong SQL knowledge is a minimum requirement
Knowledge of DataOps methodology and approach preferred
Passionate and curious about data with the ability to query and analyze datasets in order to drive fact- based decisions
Data visualization experience
Candidate should have a working knowledge of cloud data pipelines & processing, including but not limited to AWS, Snowflake
Knowledge of data transformation processes, exposure to standard and complex datatypes
Experience working in agile teams and SCRUM methodology
Robust data knowledge preferably around business data sets with proven analytical and quantitative skills
Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science field, Information Systems, Computer Science, Mathematics or similar
All employees and contractors working in D&B should be aware that they have responsibilities in relation to the Company’s Business Management System. This relates to information and its security, quality, environment and health and safety both during and post-employment with D&B.
Dun & Bradstreet is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, genetic information, protected military and veteran status, ancestry, marital status, medical condition (cancer and genetic characteristics) or any other characteristic protected by law.

We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with Dun & Bradstreet and need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website or to apply for a position, please send an e-mail with your request to TalentAcquisitionTeam@dnb.com. Determination on requests for reasonable accommodation are made on a case-by-case basis.

title: Data Analyst & Space Manager Ireland
full description:
Come and join Mars in Dublin, Ireland!
Data Analyst & Space Manager Ireland
Dublin, Ireland
What are we looking for?
University degree or equivalent in business, preferably in Sales
Ideally relevant experience in category management and sales including analytics
Ability to interact and develop relationships with all levels of associates, including senior management, to influence desired outcomes
Ability to work independently and efficiently, with minimal supervision, in a fast-paced environment in an international team
Excellent communication skills, fluency in English is essential
Strong analytical, planning skills
Experience with computer reporting and analytical tools
What would be your key responsibilities?
Knowledge driver in Space Management – operating as a consultant towards external and internal customers
Define and gap close gaps to Picture of Success across all categories & channels and provide recommendations to customers in collaboration with Category Managers
Drive range reviews in collaboration with Category Managers
Ad-hoc planogram building and technical space management support
Drive space / perfect store opportunities in Customer Collaboration meetings
Analyze customer & market data and provide recommendations internally and externally towards customers
Contribute to engaged category team driven by the best talents in the industry
What can you expect from Mars?
An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including excellent pension.
Pet-friendly offices, where your pets enjoyment, is as high on our agenda as yours.
A company that understands the importance of a work-life balance.
The chance to take hold of your own career, and develop personally and professionally.
