title: Sr. Associate, Data & Analytics Delivery
full description:
Applications will close 10 May 2021.
Sr. Associate, Data & Analytics Delivery, Pfizer Global Shared Services Hub in Dublin, Ireland
Are you experienced with digital technology and looking for your next step within a world class business? If so, Pfizer has a permanent full-time opportunity for you in Ireland!
Your role will be part of global Digital Enterprise Platforms & Security (EP&S) team. This team integrates and oversees Pfizer’s global infrastructure; cloud services; information technology operations; cybersecurity, workforce platforms, standards, policies and Digital risk management.
This is an opportunity to join a team that innovates every day on technologies in support of scientific discovery, breakthrough products, and essential partnerships that help change patients’ lives.
What We Offer
Permanent position with Competitive Salary plus Bonus Schemes, Healthcare for you & your family, Pension & Share Purchase Scheme, Long term Income Protection, Life Assurance, Bi-Annual Medical and Tuition Assistance, and Competitive Annual Leave.
Pfizer’s Global Shared Services hub in Ireland is at the heart of Dublin City’s innovation district “Silicon Docks” with ready access to public transport.
Our Culture
Our Culture in Pfizer is hugely important to us. We recognize that people are the cornerstone of Pfizer’s success. We embrace career development & colleague engagement. As a team, together we run our business, so your input and expertise are essential to our success! We are proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion to ensure all colleagues have the freedom to be who they are and to bring their whole self to work.
Our culture is founded on the pillars of Equity, Joy, Courage and Excellence.
Role Summary
The Service Management function owns and operates platforms that help EP& S and its customers build, deploy, and run leading-edge services on-premises and in the cloud. Service Management platforms support best practices related to the delivery of IT operations and site reliability engineering (SRE) that help customers create and maintain scalable and highly reliable systems, gather data and insights, and manage change, risks, and costs. The service areas included are: Service Management Tools, Environment Monitoring Tools, Service Data Analytics and Insights.
As a Sr. Associate in Service Data and Analytics and Insights function you will use your technical skills and creativity to build data warehouses, automate reporting and generate insights to enable the organization quickly and accurately to determine how key business and processes are performing. As a data-loving member of the team, you'll serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using numbers to help them make better decisions. You will weave stories with meaningful insight from data. You can see different angles and you know how to connect the dots and interact with people in various roles and functions. You will work to effectively turn business questions into data analysis.
Role Responsibilities
Design and implement data transforms to build data solutions
Partner effectively with stakeholders and other on solving business problems through data solutions
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build, and prototype dashboards to provide insights solving for business priorities
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to formulate and complete full cycle analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables, and presentations
Development, support issues, process issues, bug fixes and delivery of enhancements using an agile approach.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in a technical field - computer science, engineering, statistics, or equivalent practical experience
2 to 4 years’ experience in programming and scripting with SQL or similar query language, extracting large sets of data, and design of ETL flows
Excellent analytical reasoning and problem-solving skills
Preferred Qualifications
Ability to visualize business data and metrics through dashboards and other reporting tools such as Tableau, Grafana, etc.
Interest and aptitude in data, metrics, analysis, and trends and applied knowledge of measurement, statistics, and program evaluation.
Ability to translate analysis results into business recommendations.
Excellent problem-solving and written and verbal communication skills
Organisational Relationships
This role will interface with all groups in Enterprise Platform and Security and with strategic project groups across the broader Digital organization
Non-Standard Work Schedule, Travel, or Environmental Requirements
 Standard work schedule with limited travel
In order to be considered for this position you need to be legally eligible to work in Ireland.
Pfizer is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.
Pfizer Global Business Services is passionate about building a diverse work environment where all employees feel respected in their uniqueness. We are proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion to ensure all colleagues have the freedom to be who they are and to bring their whole self to work. Together, we continue to build a culture that encourages, supports and empowers our employees.
#LI-PFE
Additional Information
In order to be considered for this position in Ireland you need to be legally eligible to work in Ireland.
Please note there is no relocation support available for this position
How to apply
Make a difference today, all suitable candidates should apply with CV below. We are looking forward to hearing from you!
Purpose
Breakthroughs that change patients' lives ... At Pfizer we are a patient centric company, guided by our four values: courage, joy, equity and excellence. Our breakthrough culture lends itself to our dedication to transforming millions of lives.
Digital Transformation Strategy
One bold way we are achieving our purpose is through our company wide digital transformation strategy. We are leading the way in adopting new data, modelling and automated solutions to further digitize and accelerate drug discovery and development with the aim of enhancing health outcomes and the patient experience.
Equal Employment Opportunity
We believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce is crucial to building a successful business. As an employer, Pfizer is committed to celebrating this, in all its forms – allowing for us to be as diverse as the patients and communities we serve. Together, we continue to build a culture that encourages, supports and empowers our employees.
Information & Business Tech

title: Looker Data Analyst
full description:
Who we are:

Glofox is on a mission to build a healthier world. We are a venture backed product led SaaS company that is in hyper growth. Along with our ever-growing client base that spans over 60 countries, our team is dedicated to powering the fitness industry with digital solutions.

We are one team at Glofox consisting of honest, moral & ethical individuals who are heard and valued! We hold ourselves accountable- delivering on expectations & celebrating each other for the great work we do!

We strive to be innovative thinkers and doers- always innovating with our customers in mind, our backbone, ensuring they can succeed & receive top class support!

At Glofox, we love entrepreneurs because we are entrepreneurs. We know how much determination it takes to start your own business and grow it into something that lasts. We roll our sleeves up, we act fast, and we learn together. We're looking for people that will do the same.
Who we are:
Glofox is on a mission to build a healthier world. We are a venture backed product led SaaS company that is in hyper growth. Along with our ever-growing client base that spans over 60 countries, our team is dedicated to powering the fitness industry with digital solutions.

We are one team at Glofox consisting of honest, moral & ethical individuals who are heard and valued! We hold ourselves accountable- delivering on expectations & celebrating each other for the great work we do!

We strive to be innovative thinkers and doers- always innovating with our customers in mind, our backbone, ensuring they can succeed & receive top class support!

At Glofox, we love entrepreneurs because we are entrepreneurs. We know how much determination it takes to start your own business and grow it into something that lasts. We roll our sleeves up, we act fast, and we learn together. We're looking for people that will do the same.

What you will be doing:

Develop compelling dashboards and automated reporting for key performance metrics.
Working closely with the team to help identify important questions around metrics definition.
Embed visualizations into Glofox platform.
Develop and expand data models that will be used by a large client base.
Analyse data and support data acquisition via ETL.
Provide insights into best practices around Looker performance and economy.

Our current technical stack is underpinned by:

Looker,
Redshift
Stitch
AWS

What Skills Do I need?

3+ Years of experience in a Data Engineering, Data Analyst and/or Data Science role, with a focus on analyzing large data sets to solve problems
Expert knowledge of SQL
Experience with LookML & visualization using Looker
Excellent communication skills
Ability to take initiative and operate with a high degree of autonomy
Desire to learn and grow your knowledge

What you'll get:

The chance to work at a hyper-growth venture-backed start-up in an exciting industry remotely
The opportunity to feel true purpose in your efforts by powering fitness entrepreneurs, making them successful and enabling them to improve the health of people on a global stage
Competitive compensation with share options
Laptop and equipment for remote working set up
Any support you need to level up your skills - conferences, books, screencasts
We are a diverse bunch of people and we want to continue to attract and retain a diverse range of people into our organisation. We're committed to an inclusive and diverse Glofox! We do not discriminate based on gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, civil or family status, age, disability, or race

title: Data Analyst
full description:
Desired Skills
Data Analyst, SQL, R, Python, Technology

We have a great new opportunity for a Data Analyst to join an exciting Irish-owned Logistics company.

You will work across a range of projects analysing and creating MI reports and combining data across multiple platforms and business areas to identify trends and ultimately strengthen the business.

You will work on improving and standardising reports, developing models using statistical techniques and visualisation, presenting findings and recommending actions to senior management and ultimately have a key role in business decisions.

Your experience should include:
Degree with a quantitative focus
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Experience with SQL (or equivalent)
Some experience with statistical languages such as R or Python
Experience on visualisation tools such as Power BI or Qlik
Ability to communicate complex analysis both written and verbal

This role comes with an excellent package - market leading salary, pension, healthcare, travel concessions, study scheme, subsidised lunches, flexible and remote working, performance management scheme and more!

Get in touch with Eimear Mellotte at Reperio Human Capital on +353 1 571 3000 for a confidential discussion about your job search.

title: Reporting Analyst (Asset Management)
full description:
Exciting opportunities for experienced Reporting Analysts to support the business as it goes through a vast period of growth. We are currently recruiting for two dynamic individuals to join our team. The overarching goal is the development and production of high-quality management information to the Asset Management teams. We’re looking for experienced Reporting Analysts to help produce and implement data management, data quality, control and data standards across the function. To support both our internal colleagues and external client requirements. This role is ideal for someone who excels and enjoys working in a challenging and fast paced Asset management environment.
This role will be based at our Dublin office with some home working. Due to the current Pandemic this will initially be a home-based role.
What will you be doing?
Clean and check quality of data files received from third-party providers ready for database imports
Build checks required across different data sources to ensure consistency and completeness
Proactively drive third-party providers to improve data output, both in terms of quality and accuracy
Promote data governance and strive to continuously improve data quality including availability, usability, and consistency
Consult, influence and build relationships with all key internal and external contacts
Ad hoc analysis and reporting on the investment level including requests from the business and client
Modelling scenario analysis
Gain understanding of the portfolios and underlying assets
Provide a critical bridge between third-party providers, Asset Management teams and the client
Understand and prepare weekly and monthly performance reports to support business planning and day-to-day management of the portfolio
Maintain dialogue and work closely with Asset Management teams and the client, understanding and predicting requirements
Assist the development and implementation of effective and consistent systems, as required

Is this you?
Extensive knowledge of data quality issues, data transformations. Best practice in data manipulation and cleansing
Excellent understand of working in an Asset Management business and interpreting data.
Strong analytical skills and numeracy, with high levels of accuracy under pressure
Ability to understand complex data and present it in a clear and understandable way
Able to manage and organise large volumes of information, absorbs detail easily with strong, accurate recall
Ability to link different data sources and come up with an overall/overarching story
Proven ability to mine and manage large populations of data from multiple and diverse systems
Able to plan all action steps to conclude assignments on time
Structured approach to problem solving
Strong critical thinking skills, intuitively curious and an ability to diagnose data issues
Advanced MS Excel skills (Power Pivot, Power Query, VBA)
S Automation (SSRS, SSIS) and QL knowledge is desirable
Experience with data visualisation / reporting tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc)
Experience of dealing with senior management and stakeholders
Experience of working in a fast paced, changeable environment

Why Mars Capital?
Mars Capital puts the customer at the heart of everything we do by seeking to understand the circumstances of our borrowers and help them, using all reasonable means available, return to long term financial stability. Mars Capital is also part of the Arrow Global Group. Which is a leading European investor and asset manager in the non-performing and non-core assets sector. Operating in five different geographies and servicing over 9 million customer accounts. Our Purpose – building better financial futures.
We offer a competitive salary and attractive benefits package and we pride ourselves on rewarding success with our excellent bonus scheme and incentive package. We also have interactive subsidised events, colleague engagement teams, employee recognition and development programs and the opportunity to work collaboratively with multiple European countries.
Please note – we are an equal opportunities employer and CBI regulated company. We will conduct credit, fraud, criminal record and 5-year reference checks as part of our pre-employment screening.
(Strictly No Recruitment Agencies Please)

title: Business Analyst
full description:
Amach is an industry-leading software automation company located in Dublin. We are currently recruiting a talented Business Analyst to join our team based in North Dublin (Swords). The successful candidate will work with top engineers on challenging and exciting software projects.
Amach is not providing visa assistance for this position, so the candidate needs to be eligible to live and work in Ireland.
The Business Analyst role requires the successful candidate to be responsible for working with the Business Owner to translate the business vision into a compelling digital product that drives user engagement and revenue growth. The successful individual will work with a team of business analysts to define high-level requirements, translate this requirement into user stories, and then work with the digital delivery team to build great products.
You will help drive best practices and support project deliveries. The success of the role will include building relationships within the technology and business teams and communicating effectively to these teams. Building relationships with 3rd party vendors will also be essential to ensure the best outcomes.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
You will engage with key stakeholders, program managers, project managers and other members of the Business Analyst Leadership team.
Assist in adding new features and functionalities to our client's e-commerce platform, creating specification for features and enhancements
You will help define business analysis best practices.
Collaborate with skilled Agile and Waterfall teams
Assisting business users, project managers, and Digital & Mobile leadership in optimising the scope, benefits, and risks of proposed projects.
You will develop detailed requirements specifications to ensure clarity of project scope.
You will analyse the impact of change requests and ensure that the correct procedures are followed to support changes to scope.
Supporting traceability from requirements through to QA.
Work within project timelines and demonstrate a commitment to on-time delivery of key priorities.
Communicating requirements and issues with both external and internal stakeholders to ensure awareness of key business analysis deliverable status at all times.
KEY CRITERIA
IT / Computer Science Third-Level Qualification
Business Analysis / Agile or Project Management Certification
5+ years of experience, running complex programs of work (Waterfall and Agile)
Scope Statement and Business requirements document experience
User Story and Agile ceremony experience
Experience in process design and improvement
Strong influencing skills, particularly with senior executives
Proven ability to drive and manage change
Strong Communication (verbal & written) and interpersonal skills
Excellent organisational and analytical skills with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and documentation skills with the ability to present facts clearly and objectively
Self-motivated with a high level of initiative, commitment, and flexibility
Extensive and experienced strong problem-solving skills.
ESSENTIAL SKILLS:
A technical background is preferred
Knowledge of IT and Digital systems, including experience of development projects involving web-based, mid-range, and integration platforms and applications
Experience in data centre migrations would be an advantage
WHAT WE OFFER:
Competitive salary
Bonus scheme
Health care
Pension
Educational assistance
Flexibility & work/life balance

title: Supply Chain (SAP) Data Analyst
full description:
Job Overview

Job Title: Data Analyst - Supply Chain/Procurement

Location: Dublin or Cavan

Duration: Permanent

Salary: Negotiable
Role Summary:

Reporting to Head of Procurement and Supply Chain, the role is key to utilising the ERP system to its potential, within the Procurement and Supply chain environment. Working with various groupwide functions, the Procurement and Supply Chain Analyst leads the development of best-in-class Procurement function across the group.

You will lead the co-ordination, process management, reporting and quality management of all Procurement and Supply Chain processes.

The role offers a great opportunity to gain experience and exposure to our global Procurement function and processes, while working with a wide range of people and disciplines.

Primary Accountabilities:

Delivery SAP planning and forecasting processes which drive excellent procurement practices.
Own full SAP utilization of Procurement and Supply Chain processes, while driving continuous improvement in all areas, including planning, forecasting and inventory management.
Review, evaluate and recommend key planning attributes within SAP during the product lifecycle.
Introduce and own inventory management, reporting and analysis.
Represent plant Procurement team on the clients Master Data projects.
Procurement representative and lead on SAP role out teams throughout the group.
Assist with preparation of annual budgeting and ongoing tracking.
Maintain and own Procurement compliance Policy and control documents and procedures.
Lead ongoing data accuracy review with Procurement and Logistic teams, driving continuous improvement.
Assist in development of new reports to support the team.
Assist team in all areas of Procurement and Supply Chain when and where required.
Assist with development of and the monthly preparation of KPIs.

Qualifications\Requirements:

Experience working with Enterprise, Resourcing, and Planning (ERP) Systems - SAP a distinct advantage
At least 2 years minimum' experience working in a Procurement, Supply Chain and Inventory role.
Bachelor's degree in IT/business or equivalent preferred, with a proven ability for excellence in numeracy and strong attention to detail.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills & data expertise
A strong ability to make informed decisions through business intelligence & data gathered
Proven track record in SAP Procurement with an ability to introduce change.
Advanced understanding of Procurement and Supply chain SAP functionality.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively in a cross-functional environment
Energetic and flexible - capable to meet deadlines and ad-hoc requests. Strong interpersonal and leadership skills
Occasional Travel.

title: Senior Finance Analyst
full description:
Primary Location  IRE-Leinster-Dublin
Organization  McDermott Laboratories Limited

Senior Finance Analyst - 21000467

At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.
Viatris empowers people worldwide to live healthier at every stage of life.
We do so via:
Access – Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance;
Leadership – Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and
Partnership – Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services.
Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here’s how the Senior Finance Analyst role will make an impact:
Key responsibilities for this role include:
Oversee the execution of tasks, a department or a function; direct work, allocate resources, approve performance and results.
Guide an individual or team to reach stated objectives.
Teach or guide others in order to reach a predetermined standard.
Supports the Treasury and GIS Leadership, through data analysis, to identify business challenges by using & preparing executive reports, dashboards and/or presentations to help influence changes or make decisions.
Identify improvement opportunities (proactive and reactive).
Collecting, classifying and interpreting data to reveal trends, patterns, anomalies, key variables and data relationships while focusing on driving insight and actions.
Utilizes technology to design and develop cross functional analytical tools to analyze data leading to the creation of dashboards.
Leverages creative solutions, analytics and visualization/ reporting techniques to enhance knowledge and drive actionable insights. This could include variance analysis, dashboards/ reporting, power point presentations and root cause analysis.
Manage, attend, and contribute to staff meetings to effectively communicate with all members of the department keeping everyone abreast of current projects.
Perform daily, weekly and monthly reviews and analyses of current processes using operational metrics and reports.
Responsible for day-to-day analytics projects and initiatives such as ad-hoc analyses, dashboard development and other GIS assignments.

The minimum qualifications for this role are:
Minimum of a bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) required; Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Accounting, Finance or related field. However, a combination of experience and/or education will be taken into consideration.
Minimum of 4 years of experience in similar roles with other multinational enterprises is preferred.
Must possess advanced knowledge of Alteryx and Tableau. (Knowledge in Power BI is preferred)
Must understand Financial Reporting & Analytics.
Must possess excellent process analytical & problem resolution skills.
Must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal skills, management skills, strong work ethic, consensus gathering skills, organizational skills and a working knowledge of Microsoft Office, Alteryx and Tableau.
At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.

title: Sr. Product Analyst-M&A
full description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Products and Technology
Job Details
BT M&A Sr. Product Analyst
Grade 6


Business Technology is looking for an experienced M&A Sr. Product Analyst with an extensive background in building scalable and innovative solutions for Mergers & Acquisitions Go-to-Market Integration projects. This role will join the product group dedicated to supporting the M&A organization here at Salesforce. Our ideal candidate enjoys working in dynamic and high-growth environments and is experienced in managing complex projects in support of an overall M&A philosophy and strategy. This individual must have deep Salesforce platform and application experience, specifically in the area of Sales, Marketing, Quote to Cash, Finance, and Post-Sales functions.


Responsibilities
Conduct Fit-Gap Analysis, Risk/Impact analysis, document “As is” process documentation for the acquisition.
Define Future state business processes, product roadmap and strategy for the acquisition integration.
Gather requirements and create detailed functional specifications to deliver strong business value.
Prioritize, track, coordinate and communicate on M&A integration projects, issues and tasks with cross-functional stakeholders and the leadership team.
Work closely with Systems Specialists and Engineering Scrum teams to execute and deliver on project goals.
Build customer empathy through in-depth client interview and other market research techniques.
Support the implementation of change management activities.
Partner with the BT and support organizations to provide knowledge transfer, support and technical assistance to end users
Assists with backlog grooming of new enhancement requests.
Participate in Agile scrum team as the central subject matter expert.
Skills and Qualifications:
3+ years of similar experience in product management or a combination of product, engineering, and data roles.
Ability to quickly establish credibility and rapport with both business and technical professionals.
Excellent communication and presentation skills. Ability to craft and deliver messages at all levels of granularity, from executive pitches to functional architecture diagrams and implementation requirements.
Experience gathering customer-centric requirements and writing functional design specification documents
Superior analytical, interpersonal, and project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Preferred:
Salesforce certified professional.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations and drive actions
Accommodations
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. title: Equity Research Analyst
full description:

This role is well suited for candidates coming from an investment analyst, corporate finance or an analytical industry role within the food or consumer industry.
Work as an integral part of the team covering all aspects of the Food & Consumer sector including monitoring market developments, interpreting data and market trends

Formulation and regular review of stock views based on detailed industry, company and financial analysis

Regular written, including in-depth company and thematic research on the stocks/sector under coverage

Regular communication ) with clients with sector updates, relevant news, information and potential trading opportunities

Utilisation of various stock market and corporate valuation techniques

CFA qualification preferable

Natural curiosity, critical thinking and logical evaluation

Ability to work independently and part of a team

Strong interpersonal skills

title: Business Analyst, Publisher Intelligence, Online Partnerships
full description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience as a data analyst, business analyst, product analyst, or consultant.
Experience managing and querying datasets using SQL or other languages.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience in R, SPSS, Python, MATLAB or similar statistics tools.
Experience with analytic methodologies such as regression, classification, prediction, machine learning, and neural networks.
Consulting and team leadership/management experience.
Experience developing and analyzing large, complex data sets and converting them into information and insights.
Excellent presentation and spoken/written communication skills.
About the job
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and Google Marketing Platform tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide creative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. We help grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provide account management for users of AdSense, Google Ad Manager and more.

The Publisher Intelligence team is a business analyst team responsible for helping Online Partnerships make the best decisions possible using data.
As a Business Analyst, you will work with high-performing teams across Google including Sales, Finance, Product, and Engineering to play a core role providing analysis in support of the Online Partnerships Group. You will use an analytical, data-driven approach to drive an understanding of our fast-changing business, provide analysis that will translate directly to accelerated growth, and improve the ability of the overall Online Partnerships Group to operate at scale while simultaneously delighting its customers. You'll partner with sales teams to identify the insights and intelligence they require to understand, manage, and grow their business, and develop solutions to deliver their requirements at scale.
Google was founded to organize the world’s information, and our Partnerships team was there from the start, connecting us with the world’s largest generators of online content. Google helps our partners find better ways to reach their audiences and manage their digital businesses. In return, our partners provide great content for our products, and they syndicate our Google products to enhance their sites. Our Partnerships team members expand and nurture these relationships by continually finding new opportunities and solving technical problems for our partners.
Responsibilities
Lead cross-functional research and analysis projects for Online Partnerships Group including initiating, analyzing, and socializing data projects in conjunction with various cross-functional stakeholders.
Manage and develop data infrastructure in order to bring order and insight to complex datasets.
Understand, analyze, and interpret trends in the market that affect the display ads business.
Communicate findings from data and analyses to senior stakeholders, influencing them to make the best decisions possible.
Work closely with Management and their teams to understand their information needs, ensuring that BI solutions are an excellent fit for their evolving needs, and help to develop their related skills capabilities.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

title: Graduate Data Analyst (Supply Chain Planning) – 12 Month Fixed Term Contract
full description:
As the Data Analyst, you will play an important role providing data-driven insights on supply-chain initiatives. Corresponding with stakeholders, you will seek answers, patterns, and explanations from data and draw initial conclusions to support key decisions and actions.
Key to this position will be understanding and analysing large amounts of data from applications (mainly R+ and SAP) across the organization.
Your Role
Develop a consistent process for preparing, preprocessing and analyzing data.
Create and maintain efficient processes to extract, transform, format and structure data from diverse databases, files & processes.
Produce data extracts, profiles, and analysis in a suitable and timely manner for stakeholders, team-members and managers.
Analyze data for statistical patterns, distributions, summaries, anomalies, correlations, structures for further processing or reporting.
Develop, present and maintain intuitive and interactive dashboards and reports using recommended tools and technologies
Facilitate the preparation and delivery of data and reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential challenges in data sources, systems, and analysis across the organization as identified by the project proposals or tasks provided by the manager or organization.
Answer questions, resolve data problems, and responds to requests to accomplish the objectives of the projects and programs of the organization.
Contribute to team effort by accomplishing high-quality results on time.
Acquire new skills to meet demands of any new emerging challenges, technologies, tasks and projects.
At times, the Data analyst may be asked to provide support (including but not limited) to ensure project plans and project documentation are complete and up-to-date, provide regular project status updates, help acquire the necessary resources and skills, and contribute to the delivery of business systems to meet identified business requirements.
Your Background
Recently qualified/qualifying university degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Science or related field
Ability to translate informally communicated requirements into agreed specifications
Strong communication, presentation, analytical and organizational skills
Experience in Microsoft Office (excel, word, powerpoint, access)
Ability to meet deadlines
Aptiv Rewards & Advantages
Competitive compensation package including; Healthcare, Pension & TaxSaver schemes.
Learning, professional growth and development in a world recognized international environment.
Access to internal & external training, coaching & certifications.
Recognition for innovation and excellence.
Opportunities to give back to the community.
Meaningful work that makes a difference in the world
Some see differences. We see perspectives that make us stronger.
Diversity and Inclusion are sources of innovation and creativity, both of which are essential to Aptiv’s success. Everyday our diverse team comes together, drives innovation, pursues solutions, and meets challenges using their unique abilities, perspectives and talents, changing what tomorrow brings. When you join our team, you’ll get encouraged to think boldly, express your viewpoint and innovate as a matter of habit.
Some See Technology. We See a Way to Make Connections.
At Aptiv, we don’t just see the world differently; we work to change reality. That means developing technology that rewrites the rules of what’s possible in the pursuit of making transportation safer, greener and more connected. Today there are more than 180,000 of us globally, located in 44 countries, and united by one mission. Join the movement and together, let’s change tomorrow.

title: Graduate Real World Evidence Scientific Data Analysts
full description:
108,000 people of more than 140 nationalities work at Novartis around the world. Would you like to join our team?

Real World Evidence (RWE) uses data collected through routine healthcare together with advanced statistical methods to generate insights. It is an innovative and growing area within pharma and health care. If you are interested in analytics and their application in human health, would you be interested in joining our RWE team? We’re currently hiring graduates to fill positions in RWE as a Scientific Data Analyst.

This person will gain experience with the exploration of large observational datasets (e.g. medical and pharmacy claims data, electronic health records) to answer research questions through RWE projects such as Non-Interventional Studies and interactive data visualizations. These enable disease area exploration and modeling of health outcomes, ultimately improving our understanding of human diseases and patient health.

Your responsibilities:
Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Develop, modify and de-bug programming routines (such as Python, R or SAS) along with SQL queries used to extract, clean, manage, and analyze large databases for health outcomes research under senior guidance. Data sources include medical and pharmacy claims data, hospital data, electronic medical record data, and prospective observational study dataTranslate the study design into algorithms to extract, analyze and report secondary data for Non-Interventional Studies (NIS) or interactive data visualization tools under senior guidanceMaintain consistency and follow company standards of the project documentation for observational studies and interactive data visualization tools, including programming, specifications of analysis datasets, tables, figures, and listings under senior mentorship.Support and contribute to standardization techniques in order to maximise efficiency in deliverables under senior guidanceComply with project timelines together with the RWE Research Analyst and proactively alert the project manager or department leadership on any risks related to the deliverables and the timeline
Minimum requirements
What you’ll bring to the role:

Minimum: An undergraduate degree in a field such as computer science, bioinformatics, biostatistics, statistics or similar. No prior industry experience requiredAn interest in developing programming, statistical, visualization and analytical skillsExceptional problem-solving abilities with a basic understanding of statistical methods (regression, Anova, t-tests, etc.)Strong written/verbal communication skills. Highly effective at providing input at meetings, discussions and activities covering aspects of research data management and analysis on research projectsA strong interest in working in pharmaAble to speak out, challenge conventional thinking, and stand up for ideas

Desirable requirements:

Prior work placement/internship experience with pharma/biotech/RWE organizationsBasic understanding of statistical tests and modelling and in R, Python, SAS or another statistical programming languageExperience with electronic medical records, registries, insurance claims, or health outcomes data. Experience in epidemiology, market research, or clinical research is a plus

You’ll receive:
Competitive salary, Annual bonus, Pension scheme, Share scheme, Health insurance, 25 days annual leave, Flexible working arrangements, subsidized dining facilities, Employee recognition scheme, learning and development opportunities.

Why consider Novartis?
769 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2020. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?

We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

Imagine what you could do at Novartis!

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:
Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration, and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.
Novartis are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons

title: Modelling Analyst
full description:
The role: Modelling Analyst

We are looking for a Modelling Analyst to come be a part of our rapidly growing & evolving Marketing Effectiveness team in our Dublin office.
Are you our next star player?
The Analyst will report into the Department Head of Marketing Effectiveness and modelling team lead, serving as member of the team who is responsible for crafting and delivering modelling capabilities to measure marketing efficiency.

Why we need you:
You’ll be working with the Head of Department and team lead to build and deliver marketing efficiency models.

Your role will include:
Application of data modelling to areas such as A/B testing, return on investment analysis, customer journey, etc.
Supporting the marketing insights evaluation team with access to and provision of data and analysis
Developing new modelling and analysis to answer business questions and inbound queries
Work with agency partners & internal partners to ensure that company standard is followed with regards request for & delivery of data and reporting on media asset delivery to enable analysis
Work with the marketing insight colleagues to streamline capabilities in terms of analysis & reporting
Supervise relevant critical metrics and the impacts on them from various media campaigns
Who we're looking for:
Ideally have a Degree qualification in a quantitative (STEM) field with experience with SQL/Oracle, Excel, PPT and PowerBI (or equivalent data viz tool) It's an advantage to have exposure with data analysis application e.g. R, python, SAS, etc. a bonus. Knowledge of the online Poker / Casino / Sportsbook industries would be an asset.

Your experience:
Experience of creating and developing models using statistics, and/or machine learning (regression, cluster and segmentation)
Comfortable with working with big data sets and fusing multiple data sources. Crafting Data flows and models
Previous experience of modelling marketing effectiveness and the consumer journey (A/B, MTA, etc)
Pioneer new techniques and models
Your behaviours:
Resilience: Resilient and confident under pressure, comfortable in dealing with ambiguity and running multiple simultaneous projects
Quality obsessed: gets it right first time
Partner management and influencing skills: comfortable operating at pace to a high standard, despite requiring the involvement of multiple partners across multiple countries to deliver results. Actively builds a network of effective relationships across Flutter. Can get things done both through formal channels and informal networks
Fast learner: Learns quickly when facing new situations. Experiments to find new solutions. Pursue the challenge of unfamiliar tasks and extracts lessons learned from failures or mistakes
Comfortable both in detail and in stepping back to consider long term strategy
What’s in it for you?
Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus. And we provide advice and dedicated assistance to those moving to Dublin.

Your package will include:
health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address)
a personal interest allowance to let you learn something new or pursue a hobby
the option to join our company pension scheme
looking to extend your family? You will receive a cash gift of 1,000 EUR for your new addition whilst working for us
in-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career
free fresh fruit, snacks and drinks in the office
access to an onsite gym.
What happens next?
We will aim to get back to you as soon as possible. If you meet the criteria, we’ll contact you to arrange a Zoom interview.

The Group
PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange, which brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.
We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.
We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact: talent@starsgroup.com.
Please note we cannot accept general applications; this inbox is just for providing support to those who need it.

title: Junior IT Business Analyst
full description:
Organisational Environment:
Mercury is an Irish based European Contractor.
Mercury is a European Contractor that builds and manages complex engineering projects that reimagine how people work and live in the built environment. Our determination and focus enable us to deliver leading-edge construction solutions across a range of key sectors including Enterprise Data Centres, Advanced Technology & Life Sciences, Hyperscale Data Centres, Fire Protection, Technical Support Services (TSS), Data Centre Facility Management, Healthcare & Building Services. Mercury employs over 2,600 people across over 10 locations in Europe and had an overall turnover of €1bn in 2020. Mercury employs the best people, invests heavily in training and education and ensures that the highest standards of health, safety and governance are applied throughout the organisation.

Key Responsibilities of the Role:
Support the process of business change, improvement and efficiency by working with business leaders, process owners and relevant stakeholders to understand business requirements
Map end to end processes, highlighting business challenges and pain points
Review the performance of processes
Identify root cause problems of where processes breakdown
Identify opportunities for process improvement
Understand the intended outcome of proposed initiatives
Deploy problem-solving methodologies and tools to diagnose and solve operational problems
Perform analysis
Work with BA colleagues and relevant business stakeholders to identify solutions and assess them for technical and business suitability
Complete research on market to locate suitable products and solutions and present options to business stakeholders
Identify potential IT partners as needed
Elicit, define and document the requirements
Break complex business problems into clearly articulated requirements
Assist business stakeholders in prioritising the right business requirements
Under guidance, assist in the development of project documentation such as RFI, RFP, business case, UAT scripts creation etc
Participate in producing implementation plans including any infrastructure requirements, testing regime, UAT and training
Involvement in the support of full project life cycles
Scheduling of meetings and workshops
Participate in project review meetings
Document and collate project data including minute and actions taking as well as maintenance of any project related trackers and registers
Identify and advise on business and IT resources required to support any proposed projects
Assist in completion of QA and UAT planning and test cycles
Assist IT Adoption Analyst on change management aspects of project delivery and user awareness & provision of knowledge transfer
Assist post-process improvement benefit analysis
Present product / solution demonstrations to stakeholders
Validate solution meets needs and expectations of the business and stakeholders
Upon completion of a project, hand-off of project to relevant managers and business owners
Support senior analyst colleagues with the delivery of more complex projects
Software & Partner Contracts & Agreements
Assist in analysis of business needs for licencing requirements for new software and IT partners
Assist in renewal process through analysis of usage, assessment of business requirements and identifying suitable alternative options where suitable
Liaise with providers and/or partners to obtain appropriate quotations
Raise requisitions on ERP system to ensure IT partners are issued with PO for payment
Know the Business, Know the Industry
Build an in-depth knowledge of our business and forge strong working relationships across the full suite of departments, business units and sectors
Develop knowledge and understanding of technology trends and techniques
Attend relevant meetings and events (such as conferences, webinars and seminars)
Remain current on legislative changes which would impact the business
Develop strong understanding and appreciation of cyber security practices
Participate in cyber security initiatives lead by the team
Promote the role of the BA and Business Applications Team throughout the organisation
Support Group IT activities and strategy as required

Essential Criteria for the Role:
1-2 years’ experience in a similar business analysis role
A self-starter with the ability and experience in working independently with general supervision
Proven experience in development of documentation (such as business case, RFI, RFP)

Desirable Criteria:
Exposure to conducting UAT cycles an advantage
Effective time management skills, with the ability to work on multiple tasks simultaneously, prioritising tasks, shifting priorities, fluctuating workloads, deadline pressures
Good understanding of current technology trends and techniques, with an awareness & active interest in new & emerging technologies
Solid grasp of enterprise architecture, on-prem and cloud IT environments an advantage
Ability to think on your feet, work independently and also proactively with others to find solutions to issues
Excellent interpersonal skills, interacting appropriately with technical & business resources, driven but courteous
Creative thinking to deliver proposed solutions to meet new or changed business requirements
Willing to take ownership of tasks and driven to constantly go the extra mile to see them completed successfully

Mercury is an equal opportunities employer.

title: Lead Analytic & Insights Analyst
full description:
The role: Lead Analytic & Insights Analyst
We are looking for a Lead Analytic & Insights Analyst to join our lively & dynamic Marketing Effectiveness team in our Dublin office.
Are you our next star player?
The role reports into the Department Head of Marketing Effectiveness, serving as a senior member of the team who is responsible for working closely with the operational marketing teams to deliver insight and deliver the ‘why’ analysis.
Why we need you:
Your role will include:
Work with the Head of Department and the Marketing/Channel Heads to plan and execute optimum strategies consistent with the brands wider commercial and marketing activities
Lead the team’s timelines, projects, presentations and research, presenting these to each department with the view to seeking to alignment and optimisation with all internal partners as well as establishing new ways of working in order to achieve the brand outcomes and vision most efficiently
Work with SLT, marketing, verticals and channels to produce efficient reports which are data led and which establish measurement frameworks against our objectives.
Where required take ownership for overseeing critical metrics for the teams and reporting on these to other departments.
Project Management of any other tasks related to market planning. Align with partners to ensure we get to a firm outcome that delivers business ambition within deadline for these tasks
Who we’re looking for:
Have an excellent grasp of Marketing funnel metrics and how to influence them. Working knowledge of budget allocation and the fundamentals to investment planning. Be flexible, pro-active and an ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment
Your experience:
Previous marketing and planning experiences are required. The ideal candidate will possess teammate qualities with the ability to cultivate good working relationships.
Will need technical & data literacy within a commercial environment
Have a love for BOTH data analytics and data science
Have an outstanding desire to build value from data and information
Ability to measure marketing and understand what drives business performance. Experience working with linear through to digital channels
Have experience of delivering MMM programs and marketing efficiency measurement
Your behaviours:
Resilience: Resilient and confident under pressure, comfortable in dealing with ambiguity and running multiple simultaneous projects
Quality obsessed: gets it right first time
Partner management and influencing skills: comfortable operating at pace to a high standard, despite requiring the involvement of multiple partners across multiple countries to deliver results. Actively builds a network of effective relationships across Flutter. Can get things done both through formal channels and informal networks
Fast learner: Learns quickly when facing new situations. Experiments to find new solutions. Encourages the challenge of unfamiliar tasks and extracts lessons learned from failures or mistakes
Comfortable both in detail and in stepping back to consider long term strategy
What’s in it for you?
Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus. And we provide advice and dedicated assistance to those moving to Dublin.
Your package will include:
health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address)
a personal interest allowance to let you learn something new or pursue a hobby
the option to join our company pension scheme
looking to extend your family? You will receive a cash gift of 1,000 EUR for your new addition whilst working for us
in-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career
free fresh fruit, snacks and drinks in the office
access to an onsite gym.
What happens next?
We will aim to get back to you as soon as possible. If you meet the criteria, we’ll contact you to arrange a Zoom interview.
The Group
PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange, which brings together outstanding brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.
We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.
We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact: talent@starsgroup.com.
Please note we cannot accept general applications; this inbox is just for providing support to those who need it.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Big Data & Analytics
full description:
Founded by Mastercard and IBM, Trūata offers a new approach to handling data anonymization and analytics to help organizations meet the standards of personal data protection envisioned by the GDPR. We engineer privacy-enhancing technologies that empower organizations to do more with their data – at scale. Trūata offers its customers a service to fully anonymize algorithms and reports that they can use in their own products and solutions.
We are based in Sandyford Dublin 18.
We are currently recruiting for a Senior Software Engineer to join the Platform Engineering team in Dublin. This is an excellent opportunity for somebody who wants to work at building something new and exciting.
As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be required to implement advanced GDPR compliant big data and data analytic applications. You will be a member of a highly capable software team designing and developing applications for big data handling, data wrangling, anonymization, and data analytics. Our PaaS solutions will be deployed in cloud native environments providing highly scalable and secure data management. A great candidate will have a real passion for developing team-oriented solutions to complex engineering problems. This role is computer programming intensive. A great candidate will have a real passion for developing team orientated solutions to complex engineering problems.


This position reports to Trūata’s Director of Software Engineering.
Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain Trūata’s data management platform components which include but are not limited to a Data Lake, Data Privacy Engine, Data Ingestion Algorithms, Enterprise Application Integration (EAI), Analytics Engines, Data Engineering, etc.
Full software lifecycle participation including design, development, testing, bug fixing, cloud deployment, etc.
Participation in an Agile Scrum based software development process


What you need

University degree in Computer Science or equivalent. Advanced degree preferred.
5+ years strong coding experience in either Scala or Java
Expertise with Big Data Hadoop platforms like Hortonworks, Cloudera, MAPR, Teradata, etc; experience building large scale Spark applications & data pipelines
Solid foundation in data structures, algorithms and software design
Experience in architecture and development of data models and data dictionaries in big data systems
Experience working in an Agile environment following Scrum
Creativity and a passion for tackling challenging data problems and willingness to work in a start-up environment
What you should also have

Expertise with platform engineering
Extensive knowledge with Hadoop stack and storage technologies, including HDFS, MapReduce, Yarn, HBASE, HIVE, Sqoop, Impala, spark and oozie
Experiences in manipulating large datasets using data partitions and transformation, and in-memory computations (large-scale join / groupby / aggregations)
Strong knowledge in NOSQL technologies (MongoDB, Cassnadra, Hbase etc), and/or object storage services from AWS or Azure, or open source object storage solutions (CEPH, Openstack Swift)
Relevant experience with ANSI SQL using relational databases (Postgres, MySQL, Oracle, or others).


Benefits

We take pride in offering an energetic and contemporary employee experience, supported by and array of benefits that provide our employees and their families with flexibility, quality and value. These include excellent health insurance, contributory pension scheme and free lunches!

title: Finance Analyst, Manufacturing
full description:
The Company
Our client is a growing manufacturing organisation seeking to recruit a part qualified accountant with a strong focus on systems.
The Position:
Reporting to the Finane Manager this role will focus on the development and automation of financial reporting within the group along with more traditional elements of finance. The role will be cross functional across IT, Data Analysis and Finance.
Some of the duties include:
Monthly accounts preparation and analysis
Reconciliations
Financial Reporting
Assist with the implementation of data warehouse
Become super user across all finance platforms
Data analysis
Develop robust financial models
Involved in additional ad-hoc finance duties as required
The Person
Part-qualified accountant with excellent IT skills, ideally SQL
Ability to lead a team and deal with multiple stakeholders
Experience in a multinational environment an advantage
Ability to work in a fast-paced industry
Interested in this position?
If you are interested in this position, please email your CV to Suzanne Fowler, MCIPD, at industry@accountancysolutions.ie or phone 01-6797990.
